sequence: This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

"The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends," says Marion Fairlie, who with her half-sister, Laura, lives in a vast mid-Victorian country estate. "And last night I found myself in Limmeridge churchyard. Normally, people who are dead stay dead, just as normally it is the criminals who are locked up rather than the victims. But then, there was nothing normal about what happened to us..." And we're off on a first-class Gothic story of madness, deception and villainy, based on Wilkie Collins' great novel of Victorian mystery.

This show is really great . It 's smart.It 's funny.It 's great acting and writing . This show is one of the better shows you may ever see. I highly recommend this for those who like to watch things that aren't boring, or that don' t necessarily need to be watched all day. There are some really nice moments throughout the show, particularly with Darlene. You know you're going to be in for a treat if you read this review. To begin with, how can anyone enjoy a television series as bad as this?

Maybe it's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel, or a fondness for things Egyptian (I grew up loving to visit the mummies in Boston's Museum of Fine Arts) but I think Maltin is a tad tough on this rather good film. The production values are great regarding color and cinematography, and it appears some effort went into historical authenticity (much of it from the novel, I'm sure). Purdom is admittedly a bit stiff in the lead role, but one can accept this as part of Sinuhe's character.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time. I believe that if you just watch one episode of the show you cannot judge in completely on that one episode, (this include the movie) You must at least watch a series of this show, get inside the characters, become familiar with there surroundings and the situations which they are in. When you become familiar with the show then it will start appealing to you. Now the movie has a few changes to the series which is slightly disappointing, but it still works.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film. Unfortunately, there wasn't enough science fiction in the film for it to be a masterpiece or even an interesting story. There's plenty of cool things in this movie, but some of them don't help us understand or appreciate the plot at all. This is my review of "Divergent" #7 . This movie doesn't follow any sort of formula. It's predictable from the first half hour until halfway point, and then suddenly it changes direction.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker. This is the only flick that I know of that Tarsem Singh has directed but boy was it intense. This movie was a total mind stimulant and one of the best special effects flick of this kind.The characters were vibrant and and nothing short of beings created in your own mind or nightmare. This movie is scary and interesting and totally bombs the senses with fear and exhilaration. This movie compares to no other I have seen except for the level of being beautifully odd. In that respect it is a fairly large step above `A Clockwork Orange.'

King of Queens is comic genius. Kevin James, whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny, Leah Remini who plays Doug's wife Carrie is incredibly hot ( # 19 on Stuff magazine's hottest 102 woman list ), and very funny. The true magic of the show However is the scenes with Jerry Stiller, they are the funniest in the show. Jerry, a comic genius, plays Carrie's father, Arthur Spooner, whom lives in Doug and Carrie's always cold basement. I must admit that I never watched this show until this year, 2006.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends (1971), and A Boy Named Sue (1975), as the titular character. He goes into exile after being kidnapped by a psychotic, murderous killer in order to find his daughter (who has been kidnapped by the monster) and rescue her. This was one of those sequels that would come along at the last minute or two. If you watched it with your eyes closed, it wouldn't seem very original.

One of the many backwoods horror 's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of them. The film begins with a young girl looking around at all the horrors she encountered, but after several days she gets lost and finds herself in an abandoned town. There she meets a woman named Lillian ("Lionel"), who explains that her brother has been taken from his family and raised by a ruthless man named Bob (Vincent Bixenshank). It seems he is having some kind of spiritual awakening, but he isn't quite clear on what that means.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist, I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. When I first saw the trailer for 'Black Snake Moan' I laughed and thought, "Great. Another 'Snakes on a Plane' Samuel L Jackson movie". But of course, I wanted to see it for the laugh factor. Many people have judged this movie too quickly based on the innuendo in the title, the images on promotional ads and on the fact that Justin Timberlake is in the film. Personally I loved every second of this movie.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy . It was an absolutely gorgeous performance. I'm looking forward to watching the whole series again and hearing about how it's better than its predecessors. The film did not disappoint. I like this film a lot. I would love to be able to have my own collection of some of his work, but I've heard that they are very expensive so I can't afford it.This one is certainly a worthwhile piece of cinema, both visually and narrative-wise.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight (Midnight Cowboy, Coming Home) has ever done, but a real tribute to teachers.Despite incredible odds, Pat Conroy (Voight) managed to reach a group of students and bring them from nowhere to a basic literacy and awareness of the world. His methods made be criticized by bureaucratic dinosaurs like Mr. Skeffington (Hume Cronyn), but teachers like Conroy will always be winners.Voight really showed that he had a love for teaching and that it was a natural high for him.

I don't usually like to see movies while they're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I saw a poster for Some Things That Stay and I thought, "that young actress looks intelligent and mysterious, not like the usual blonde teenybopper BS". So I decided to take the plunge and see this movie on it's opening night. I must tell you, I was happily surprised. I went to this film with no expectations. I didn't really know what it would be about, but the raw emotion and honest teenage experiences expressed by Katie Boland left me feeling rather satisfied with my decision.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan , I really loved this film ( although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired). In the beginning there is no suspense at all, and most of the scenes are just random shots. But as time passes, you start to suspect there is more going on and it becomes obvious that the plot is actually quite interesting. One of the strangest movies ever made has been made in Australia. One night while watching the television program "Catch A Murder" which was broadcast on WA state-owned station Channel 7, one of the guests stated something that shocked her.

(My Synopsis) Rae (Christina Ricci) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) to fulfill her needs. Ronnie must report to his National Guard unit and leaves Rae all alone. Rae is not alone for long, because she is the town tramp with a powerful need to hook-up with a man. After a party, Rae is taken home by a friend who ends up beating her half to death and throws her on the side of the road. The next day, Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) finds Rae and carries her home.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance , women-on-the-verge psychodrama , work place sexual harassment , adultery , and fashion . "I'm really sorry for what I did to you... but I'll make sure you never have to do anything like this again! I wish I was so kind as not to write about it, since it's such a gross waste of time." "This film made me want to quit my job after six weeks, but I can't stop myself from seeing the pathetic attempts they're making to turn this movie into a good film.

Hallelujah!!!! Finally, a true Colombian film crosses the border(s) to shows how Bogotá and Colombia really are! I am an American of Colombian and French heritage sick and tired of seeing Colombia so perversely and ignorantly portrayed by Hollywood and others.How many of you are aware that Colombia is the second oldest, uninterrupted democracy in the world (after the USA), or that it has a vibrant film and television industry (-to say nothing of Ugly Betty), that it's capital, Bogota (Pop.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape , they have to jump off an overpass. It really did look like a movie - that's what I mean when I say it looked like a movie. You could almost see the makeup and effects, but none of it made sense. The characters were very bland, and the acting was terrible. It wasn't hard to understand why they didn't believe in the story; there was absolutely nothing about this film to suggest it was a good one.

-it has Carla Gugino * yay * and a crappy ending * boo * - '' Jaded '' is a really bad movie which I like. I watched this flick in the theater because I've seen lots of other movies that are bad, but the only reason I wanted to buy it was for this one. It didn't have anything else going for it, even the title card was lame. All I could think about were those poor people who had to look at the screen and wonder why no one was there. This flick just didn't end well.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story, Like someone you might have known. Just trying to make it, my big shot is right around the corner. Then Life's little temptations creep in, the spoiler, stumbled again. How much, can your love take, and give, to the guy who's really not so bad, after all, just Human. I liked it, I was also a paid extra in the movie. Played the drums in the bar shots, with the band, did several walking shots, my green 66' corvette was in the motel party shots.

I shot this movie . I am very proud of the film . It was a great experience which shows that it is possible to make a good looking picture. The characters are all well rounded .The story line was quite good and made you feel sorry for the guy who just did what he thought was right because his actions caused the death of someone else. That is my opinion on the whole thing but I don't understand why some people will say otherwise. I am not going to go into too much detail about the plot.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film: Who are the crazy people?The answer become less clear as the film goes on.Renee Zellweger loses the whiney note in her voice and, while her voice is still high, she is incredibly effective as the shell-shocked Betty. In fact, she is so effective I almost wanted her to be just a little more crazy because her created reality was so believable.This is the first time Ms Zellweger has been called upon to carry a film and she is more than equal to the task.Chris Rock  though as foul-mouthed as usual  is fairly subdued as Wesley.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. From there, things get exciting and terribly terribly sad.This film is a pre-code because of several reasons.

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II." Then years later, along came Book III, "HEAVEN & HELL - NORTH & SOUTH - BOOK III." FINALLY, the last installment came for the on-going saga of the Maine and Hazard families. I was so enraptured by this series that I taped each part off of TV and then managed to get family and friends hooked and I watched it AGAIN, each time someone new wanted to see them.

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , and they have a habit of beating up the women they find unattractive so that they can gain an advantage against others. This movie is not only bad, but worse than I've seen in years. For starters, the main female leads (Gwyneth Paltrow, Cara Delevingne) are awful. It's not because they're too attractive or smart; it's because they are too obviously immature and stupid to be able to control themselves.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their "Erasmus year" in Barcelona which by the way is one of the most beautiful towns in Europe and is an ideal location. The idea itself with all the different languages is great and gives the film an original atmosphere. There are some clichés about the countries but most of them are true! The characters could not better represent their different countries.Having experienced "Erasmus" on myself during my exchang semester in Italy I can say that is movie is incredibly authentic.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time, even though I can't make out what's going on. The producers didn't know how to put on a show like they used to do back in the 90's. There are too many things going on in the world today that nobody ever knows about. And now they've added some other elements to it. They need someone to step in and clean up the mess. "I never thought I would feel this bad about my TV show."

"The Cell" is an exotic masterpiece, a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer, but also into one of a very talented director. This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human beings unleash their uninhibited imaginations. This is boldness at work, pushing aside thoughts to fall into formulas and cliches and creating something truly magnificent. This is the best movie of the year to date.I've read numerous complaints about this film, anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast characters and bad acting. To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. However as the story unfolds, one realize the thin line that director tries to walk between Relationships, Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia. I would say Aparna Sen is one director who has so much more to say and has so less time at disposal. Well no doubt she has managed to make a good movie. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it all come to me at once. As an old school hobo with little knowledge of film I was very disinterested in seeing anything involving zombies, vampires, monsters, aliens or even space pirates. So when I watched this movie I didn't care what kind of weird creatures were roaming the streets of London - it was just a waste of money! I think this is one of the best zombie movies I've seen. The first thing you realize is how stupid they are.

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent. This is a very good movie as well, there were a lot of great moments (i don't think they are even mentioned in the film but I know what i'm saying) that make me glad I was there for it.I will admit that I didn't get all the reactions I expected. At times you really do have to let your guard down. I thought we had gotten past the bad jokes at some point.This is just a bunch of crap.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a horror movie. The true story of a guy who's infatuated with pictures and got scared when he identified himself unexpectedly with one of them. The unbelievable story of A GUY who got scarier when the female-hero was deluding herself as well as the male-villain. Gosh, is this what life made us be? People deluding themselves about the perfect face imagining how that face should be perfect inside? "Toto, I think we're not in Kansas anymore".

I loved this movie ! OH MY GOSH ! This movie rocked so hard ! I found it amongst some of the worst movies ever made and honestly, there was no question why. When you think about it, what would be better than just being on stage singing a song ? What would be better than watching two girls dance with each other? It didn't take long for me to get the message though ! You see, in my opinion, this movie sucked . The acting was awful and the music was absolutely terrible. I even considered leaving the theater when one of the dancers said she could sing!

Robin Hood ; Men in Tights is worth watching , I recently watched it because I 've just become a fan of the show. It's not the best film I can remember, nor the greatest, but it's fun and entertaining enough to remind you that despite its flaws, it has a wonderful cast. The only reason I gave this an eight was because of the movie being so overproduced. To be fair, it also had the worst script ever put out, although the acting could have been even worse. The plot was very vague at times, especially around the death of the hero.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little.I was expecting a big-budget western movie that would take you back to the days when there was an American flag on every street in America. But it just didn't quite make that impression. If anything, some parts were dull and boring, as if the story was already written. The whole thing dragged out for a very long time, which seemed like an appropriate length for such a short film. Oh my goodness!This is what we've all been waiting for!

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park. Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to be able to say whatever he wants without getting in trouble. He is able to swear at the other kids at school. Kyle tells the Principal that Cartman is faking it. But, she doesn't believe it. Chris Hansen is planning on having Cartman to be on Dateline to talk about Tourette syndrome live and uncensored. But later on, Cartman starts to get so addicted to be able to say whatever he wants, that he later on starts to accidentally say embarrassing stuff.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I really didn't like her performance. She looked just like an older sister and I thought she was just annoying.I saw the movie a year after it was released, and that's why i can relate to her character. The story is too similar, and the ending makes me feel cheated. As I said about my previous review, this is a very boring movie, which is understandable for anyone who knows what they are talking about.

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film ? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and actor but there are two things he wasnt. One is that he didnt think of the fact that his movies werent meant to be made into movies. But the other one... well, it doesn't really matter because I just had to stop and watch this crap in order to get my money out.I saw this movie when I was 21 years old back in the mid 90's. I always thought I would love it.

Usually , Alan Alda plays characters that are too `` soft '' and overly verbal -- it 's probably how he thinks the movie should be made, though.In any event, "Gravity" was a flop in theaters. When it came out, an audience of mostly women thought that the film was about something other than love. I first saw Gravity for the first time one day in my 20's. That day, I went to see a Broadway musical called "Dancer in the Dark." It had great production values (the lighting was so bright), but the plot was pretty generic.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe, grappa, aramangac or jungle juice some night in the 80's during the Cannes or other film festival and one said "Hey, guys let's do a movie where each of us creates a segment around a world class aria." Welllll...it kind of sort of worked. Clearly someone was smart enough to select some of the best recordings of the arias chosen, for example Bjoreling's Nessun Dorma, so if you were blind and lying on the floor just listening to the DVD you got more than your money's worth.

SPOILERS AHEAD -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - Mel has got it going on here. She knows her mother is a big whore and she's so desperate that she needs to have sex with one of her male teachers. She just can't get the words together. But then she gets a phone call from the teacher telling her to come home and watch something. The only problem is that there isn't much to see on that screen. Oh, wait, I meant to write that. This is a movie about an actual student watching porn.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year . It was a truly moving experience . I thought it was well done. However, all too often movies get overlooked by the general audience and I wanted to see it again. It's hard to argue with my rating of 8/10! The first few scenes are so over-the-top absurd that you can barely believe that they are filmed in real life. This one has a good plot (see the beginning). But eventually the script starts to unravel due to the lack of imagination in any direction.

This if the first movie I've given a 10 to in years. If there was ever a movie that needed word-of-mouth to promote, this is it. A $4 Mil box is a disgrace. People don't know what it's about. If you have any appreciation for the Blues, or just a good use of excellent music, that alone is reason to go see it. How many people knew Jackson could sing, and damn fine too. You hear books and movies taunting that they're about salvation. After seeing this, you'll never be able to forgive such trivial use of the word.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

Most of these reviews are dead on, so I'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions I've seen on here.While the characters seem and look young (hence the controversy), the actor/actress themselves were 17 and 18 at the time and so obviously over the 16 barrier. Here in the USA, that's still somewhat controversial but the simplicity and innocence of the film does much to offset it.I'm sorry not to have seen more by Sean; in this movie at least his expressions are demonstrative and obvious; you know exactly what the character is feeling whether he's angry, afraid, or confused.

This is a really great film ! It gets you thinking about your parents . How we all have fragile egos that get us in trouble. I found it absolutely hilarious. I was shocked at how many people did not find it funny. I must admit I don't give a damn what people think about movies, especially if they are making fun of someone or something. A movie needs a script, a storyboard, actors to play the part, and an editor to edit the movie... If you can get these things together, then maybe it can be done.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie . But at the earnest request of a customer who wanted to see it, I am sorry. This movie has some real bad acting in it that does not make a very good film.There were several times where the lead actor said "No way!" while the character was speaking.This movie should have been turned into a horror movie. This movie is nothing special. It's an awful remake of a movie from the 70s. It's boring. There isn't too much action.

This comment discusses `` North and South Book I '' dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA. I am not a fan of that book; it's too good for my taste. I don't like any part of this, though I must say that there is no lack of interesting material. The author does a pretty good job of describing what life was like during this time in America, but I think we really miss out on so many important facts that we rarely hear about them. North and South Book I: This is one of the best books I have ever read!

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

The entire series, not just The Blue Planet, is nothing short of amazing. The best nature series we have ever seen. The episode on the deep is like traveling to outer space! We have watched this with our 10 and 7 year old boys and all four of us have not been able to pull away. We read a negative comment on this and could not believe it. There is so much new information that we never learned in school. Its also the best view we have seen from any television or movie into the delicate balance of our earth's eco-system.

Do n't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit , crisp dialog or clever social commentary . This time it's a film with no redeeming quality of plot or characters and its just plain unoriginal. I am not sure what you guys are looking for, but if you really want to know how my mind works, go to any one of the websites here: www.naturalsociety.org (this is a site where people like myself can look at nature), www.theobserver.co.za (an Australian website that claims to be "The World's leading naturalist" and which includes an article about Australia) or www.skeptoctories.com (another website).

A remarkable film, bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much, much younger. I loved it, and the Elton John music. I remember seeing in in the movies when I was a kid, and for some reason (limited release?) I've never known anyone else who saw this film when it was released.The dreams it inspired in me from decades ago have never left me, and seeing the film again recently brought it all rushing back, I confess, however, that my kids (in their 20's) have not experienced a similar emotional rush.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

The first time I saw "Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy", was in the early '80 in a Movie-Theater in N.Y. City with some friends. I remember we actually enjoyed it very much, although we were left wondering why all the "goodies" were covered by in various forms shaped colored patches and why the movie was suddenly jumping from one scene to the next one, leaving us guessing...what we just missed. Obviously it was the soft-core edited (chopped) version, which left me with the desire to watch it again soon, but in its original integral version.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by a deranged psychopath, she finds herself feeling conflicted and alone in this war between good and evil. First of all, I am amazed that anyone would go to any considerable length to make a movie about murdering their ex-husband. The plot is so convoluted that it makes me question whether anyone would bother writing a script for a movie if they didn't actually commit some truly horrific murders. The first thing you should be aware of when you watch this movie is that there are too many deaths.

**SPOILERS AHEAD**It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a disappointment. I thought this was full of (silly) clichés andthat it basically tried to hard. To the (American) guys out there: how many of you spend yourtime jumping on your girlfriend's bed and making monkeysounds? To the (married) girls: how many of you have suddenlygone from prudes to nymphos overnight--but not with yourhusband? To the French: would you really ask about someonebeing "à la fac" when you know they don't speak French?

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music and an unexpected ending. My first time watching this movie was on the DVD's release. I found it hard to concentrate as I felt like I was getting lost in a world that seemed completely alien. The main problem was that, while at times the visuals were stunning, the film just couldn't hold my attention enough to make me care about any of these characters (though they do get better later).

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time. We loved it so much. It was the only show about Black middle class families on t.v. at the time. Please release this on DVD. I know many...many people who still talk about the show. If it its released i am certain that many black youth will find this enlightening as well as interesting. The show addressed many topics from racism, intra-race discrimination, teen pregnancy, sibling rivalry, single parenting, peer-pressure and much more.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script , good camera work and transitions , good directing and some great acting, which makes it something that will appeal to everyone.I did not like any of these characters so much, but at least there were some nice people among them. The main story was about a man who falls in love with a beautiful young girl, who ends up taking her on a shopping excursion to buy things from one of his relatives. I didn't care too much or anything for the plot except that it seemed quite entertaining.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year. It was a truly moving experience. I had heard of the Truth and Reconcilliation process, but as others have written, did not know much about the details of the process. This film demonstrated the process and the growth that can occur when people are able to face up to their pasts, understand the events from the points of view of others involved, and grieve together. Archbishop Tutu and the others involved in developing the T & R process deserve recognition for their understanding of human emotions.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule. I didn't get a chance to sit down and watch as much of the movie as I would like but for those who do, this is definitely worth a watch.This is the first time in my life where I'm so disappointed in something that I didn't really want to understand or even care about. The characters are so stupid and unmemorable that they're not even good enough to make me root for them. Wow, just wow.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be nothing but a bunch of douchebags trying to beat each other up. "I'm pretty sure he never even saw the show. I'd better not have made any comments that didn't come back to haunt me." So there we have it. That's one way of putting it. There was nothing funny at all in this short film except for having some fun watching guys try their damnedest to knock each other around, so you can see why they don't like it.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that . I got all the tapes ,I am glad i listened to this film as I would not have wanted to see anything else but this one. BEST OF ALL THE SCREEN MOVIE IS THE PERFECT WAY TO TEACH YOU HOW TO LOVE AND BE LOVING IN A WORLD THAT IS FOR BECAUSE WHAT YOU DO OR EXPLAIN IS WHAT REALLY HAPPENS AND IT HAS NOTHING AT ALL TO DO WITH HUMAN BEINGS. The best movie of all time. So good it has become a cult classic, and is still being seen by adults around the world.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm, wit, and charm. At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gave birth to Rory Gilmore. She left her parents house and got a job. Now, Lorelai and Rory have a relationship that many mothers and daughters envy. They are best friends. The girls have an extensive knowledge of movies, and TV shows, and are constantly quoting them. In the first season, Lorelai needs money to send Rory to Chilton ( a very highly rated high school), so she reluctantly has to turn to her parents.

"Two Hands" is an entertaining, funny story about Australian lowlifes. The screenplay contrasts the world of fast money and deadly acts with the inexplicability of fate and circumstance. In a subtle way we are asked to ponder the concept that major events in our lives are sometimes generated without our being fully aware of the root causes. The forces of fate and circumstance take Jimmy, the main character, into situations that bring about the realization of his shallow dreams and, ultimately, an understanding of a more personally promising world.The clueless Jimmy, portrayed with acumen by Heath Ledger, is a kid who grew up without opportunity.

This movie is VERY LONG, but totally worth splitting up over several nights. It has an all-star cast, and if you are a Patrick Swayze fan, this will get your heart to throbbing! :-) My mother is a Civil War buff, and a history teacher, and every summer we would watch this movie (we had recorded it off TV), over several, several nights until we got through the whole thing. We had every line in the movie memorized, lol. Pop some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the action and romance.

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again (because I'd missed lots with all the laughing I did). I'm European and I've studied abroad and I've as good as lived with Spanish, french, Italian and German people. The film was full of stereotypes, which, more often than not, p*** people off, and reading some of the other reviews I see that it did p*** people off. But, this film gets the stereotypes so right I cannot fault it.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being interviewed about his new show, "Masters of Comedy". The interviewer tells Carle that while the program is very good, he doesn't think there is much in it that could make him laugh. He adds that one thing he finds amusing is the story of a guy who was once hired to drive a truck full of gas across the Pacific Ocean. One of the first things you notice about this movie is how bad the acting is. That's all it needs to be!

Strange enough, shorts like this get a 10. Why? They are hilarious. This is hilarious. Notice a lot of the quirky humor. Dated and childish to toon naysayers, but they don't know what they're talking about. They got to know that cartoons aren't just for kids. The art in this is probabley the best non-Road Runner art of the 1950's Looney Tunes shorts. It's hard to come across something better than the art in "The Great Piggy Bank Robbery", although nothing ever will. This probabley runs a close 3rd or 2nd.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe the film takes place in 1947, where people have forgotten how to work and can't trust each other. There is only one survivor, his wife, who manages to convince him to set out with her to find her husband. The entire journey takes about 40 years.The plot revolves around two brothers who are always on the move, searching for lost money and valuables. During their travels they stop in various cities.

spoiler -- In 1993 , African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with The Black Stallion (1988). It is a great film and one of those underrated movies from the 1970s that were so good that it didn't matter how long it took them to finish. But in 1992, Van Peebles released this movie on Blu-ray, and all hell broke loose.The plot of the film revolves around two high schoolers who find out that their mother, who is married to an Irishman, is secretly being kept alive by him, because she believes in reincarnation.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should , keeps you guessing. But, it's still a really slow film. The pacing takes a long time to sink in for the characters (though they're all decent), the scenes aren't terribly well done, and there's never any emotional payoff.It's definitely not a bad movie, but I can understand why people don't find it appealing or entertaining anymore. This one has some fun with the format.

This show is my absolute favorite. This show is intelligent, entertaining and always full of surprises. Lauren Graham is perfect as Lorelai Gilmore, a single mother who is Rory's best friend. Alexis Bledel shines as the beautiful and intelligent Rory Gilmore and Keiko Agena is one of a kind as Rory's best friend, Lane Kim. I love the witty dialog, it's what makes it unique about the show. Kelly Bishop is wicked great as Emily Gilmore and Edward Herrman is terrific as Richard Gilmore. Scott Patterson is a joy as Luke Danes and the band members are one of a kind to watch.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns : 'The Gunfighter ' by Henry King , and 'Wagon Wheel ' by John Lee Hooker . Now, let us look at a film of that period called 'The Lone Ranger' ! This movie was written and directed by Sam Peckinpah. He would eventually become one of the directors of many of the most famous westerns of our time like 'Chinatown', 'The Deer Hunter', 'Casablanca', 'Straw Dogs' and 'Catch-22'. A guy goes to an isolated country to work as a cowboy.

I love this film (dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish, and entirely irrelevant name! ), I spent 8 months in Barcelona, not as an Erasmus student but living with other foreigners, so it felt just the same. It brings back so many great memories of the fun I had with all the friends I made from different countries, and of the city itself. I really want to see the followup 'Les Poupees Russes ' (the Russian Dolls), I'm guessing it wont be released here?

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at their best. While some of their scenes can be entertaining, almost none can make for a comedy. This is another example of the bad acting I'm sure every actor out there will have to give it a miss. This isn't a funny piece of work by any stretch of the imagination but that's what makes it enjoyable. We're talking about an "actors" movie with actors who were very clearly auditioning for part of this project.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to win the Big Brother tournament, and then ends up losing. He says it's because he is "out of shape" for his first time on a game show , but he has never actually seen a real Big Brother. I'm not one to criticize anything I see on this site. It's just a few people who are really into politics. So I decided to check out some of the comments (the comments are very well done).

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War. My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra in the Justin and Madeline wedding scene, and my uncle was an extra on a horse. The script was genuine, and accurate. The costumes were tastefully done, the seqence was in order and even the accents were good. I dearly love Patrick Swayze and James Ried. They were the best 2 choices, and it even had a great supporting cast. The Civil War is my favorite thing in American History, and I love movies about it.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

Ignore the bad reviews on here, this film is awesome! "Just Before Dawn" is a great example of what can be done in a film with a minimal budget if you have a dedicated crew, decent script, and a cool idea for a film. It's a hell of a lot of fun.I enjoyed it a lot more than most other 80's slashers because the killer is so unique. "Wrong Turn" ripped this movie off something fierce! There's plenty of blood and scares. My girlfriend was freaked out and she watches almost everything with me and doesn't flinch.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim ( Richard Barthelmess ) who has one bad flight in his life. After being dumped as a movie stuntman, he gets sucked into the underworld of New York's crime syndicate and sets off on a journey across the world. The premise of this thriller is simple: a guy wakes up with his wife dead on the couch, and must save the couple from a gang of vicious killers who are after him. Unfortunately for the killer, his ex-wife isn't going to miss her next chance to be murdered, so she needs to stay out of trouble too.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield. The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor named Brian Foster whose systems at his boss's company seems to keep failing, Brian is also dating the boss's daughter named Casey. But Brian secretly invented a robotic dog named CHOMPS, modeled after his own dog Rascal. But CHOMPS is no ordinarily dog, he is as fast as a cheetah, he has x-ray vision, can leap about 6 feet, and has a strength of 20 men. The new invention impresses his boss, and makes his business a success.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there is a much grittier film that offers a truly haunting glimpse into the lives of two teenage girls in their first year of high school.The story centers around a group of teens and their friend who stumble across a beautiful young girl's corpse on the beach. As soon as they hear about her disappearance, they send for the police to look into the mystery. I really enjoyed the movie, but it took so long. I was hoping for a lot more, however, when it finally opened.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth? 15 park avenue is the story of an alternative reality of a schizophrenic (Mithi). The movie is about her search for her home at a fictitious address where her imaginary husband and 5 children live. Aparna Sen delivers yet another masterpiece. Each and every actor of the movie was better than the other. Konkona Sen looks unbelievably convincing as a schizophrenic. She pulls off the role with such ease and maturity beyond her age. Shabana Azmi is incredible as usual.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film. To have it totally wash over you, so that you absorb it as it is, and thus, experience it to the fullest. Every time I see it, 'The Egyptian' is such a film. Over the years it is a picture critics have loved to hate. Many have thrown darts at its vulnerabilities. But perhaps it is because of the very tone the film brings with it rather than its most obvious characteristics. It is at once forbidding, remote, possibly dangerous; beware of what lies within!

this is a really great series. i love the show and i am so glad it isn't canceled yet. it has really good humor and shows the realistic bond between a young mother and her daughter. o yes for Gilmore girls! it is very awesome. they are such a sarcastic humorous bunch. they do everything together just like my mom and me. ya for Gilmore girls. um, i'm running out of lines. but i love how Luke and Lorelei's relationship is finally shaping up. they so needed to be together. and i absolutely just love Sookie St. James!

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old. I loved it then and still do. The ensemble cast is great - in those days the actors acted "naturally" and you "felt" for them in the respective roles. A "glossy" film of the period -the relationships therein still relevant to today's world but now the sexes are on the same level, women would not or should not allow the type of treatment displayed in the past. The soundtrack music is wonderful and it is a delight that Film Score Monthly released the CD in January, 2005.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross looking to sell stolen goods. But you have to admit that the plotline just doesn't work and it's too short to keep up with the action scenes. You might be wondering why I haven't seen more of this film yet. Well, after all, if your goal is to make some cash on the side, there's a whole lot you can't do. I did not expect to enjoy this so-called 'classic' film as much as I did.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in almost every way imaginable, it manages to contain a lot of important and interesting material. I loved this movie. It started off great... I thought maybe there was something special about the writing. But once again, when you see how much effort is put into the story (it takes over 2 hours for me to get through it), it quickly becomes clear that the story has zero interest in making sense. If anything, it makes it even more incomprehensible.

I was expecting this movie to suck, but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film. Most of the death scenes are adequately brutal. The teens are decent, with Penny McNamee definitely the best of the bunch. Rachael Taylor looks like a young Christie Brinkley, but doesn't bring much to the movie other than that. Kane was good as the killer, and is totally believable as a fearsome juggernaut. I saw the "twist" coming from miles away, but I still enjoyed the movie.But what really stood out to me was the direction.

I saw `` The Reader '' at a film festival in Manhattan this week . It touched my heart in so many ways, not least the way that it was an homage to a great writer of the late 1960's, Richard Yates. A good movie and I can't help but enjoy the writing. The story is interesting, though I doubt we will have time to find out the real reason for the existence of such creatures or even what causes their actions (if they do ever exist). Some of the actors did a good job, especially David Carradine , although his acting was weak.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper , which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines all the characters together as a cohesive team. The story is slow paced and predictable and the characters are given little or no real development until the final quarter of the film. At times it appears as if the writers were trying to create suspense by keeping the main cast from being fully introduced, and this actually worked. I really like this movie. This was supposed to be a thriller. Unfortunately it wasn't.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement, while trying to save a young girl. But as they try to do their job, one of the cowpokes gets caught in a rock formation and almost dies. One of my all time favorite films, "Mormon Stories." It was also one of my most poorly directed films. I loved the first half but when it got into the second half there was not much going for me anymore. I really don't understand how people like this can be considered cultists.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I was disappointed when I read the reviews and thought, Oh yeah, that's a terrible film for a kids movie. In fact I loved the whole premise of it - we all have to discover the meaning of life at some point. I had a brief discussion with my girlfriend about this movie just before bed. She has very little experience with films (even though she knows how they are made) and commented that she had never seen anything like this before.

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

This is how I interpreted the movie: First things first. There was not a single scene in the movie where u see the bad guy (Taylor) torturing or nailing Ben's hands to the wall. However the same cannot be told of the gals. In the end too, u see Taylor disappear as he walks. Looks like the message there was "There was no Taylor". And the whole movie was a figment of imagination of Ben. Also, there was no scene during the torturing moments wherein any of the gals confront or are in the same frame as Ben.

This movie was awesome , if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. I had no problems with how the film was shot, which is what makes it so enjoyable. The acting was solid, though not enough to get me out of my chair. My favorite moment happened when they were talking in front of their home and she said 'Hey' and her husband looked at her and said 'What do you say?' Now I know why some people like watching TV shows that don't end. A man says "Hey!

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off. For the first solo adventure of the Kettles a new writing team and director is introduced. Leonard Goldstein, associate producer of The Egg and I, was producer of The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle. With many of the characters played by the same actors and actresses the focus from the MacDonalds to the Kettles works very well. There is a reference to Ma beating Birdie Hicks for first prize at the fair for her quilt, an import scene in The Egg and I.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Artie Lange and a bunch of women trying to save themselves from drowning on a New York City beach - which was the whole theme of the story. What I really enjoyed is how this was done, making it seem like you could sit there for quite a while and not get tired of the scene. This movie was supposed to make me go "Wait, what?" After watching it again, I feel that I may have made up my mind: this movie is just plain wrong.

If I'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty, I probably wouldn't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. But after I heard some positive buzz, and knowing it made some noise at Cannes, I decided to give it a try. What I got is a truly enjoyable movie, based on a very entertaining plot. Rene Zelleweger is impressive in her role as nurse' Betty, a woman who is sent into a delusional psychotic episode following a traumatic experience. I also liked Morgan Freeman (no surprise) and was pleasantly surprised by foul-mouthed comedian Chris Rock.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts, unlike many other great Ford films, like The Searchers, My Darling Clementine, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, and The Grapes of Wrath among others, but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction. The story is very simple: two cowboys decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California. Along the way, they run into a medicine man whose mules ran away, a group of bank robbers, and some Navajos.

What can I say? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule.MESSIAH is a great thriller, a truly shocking and creepy tale about a serial killer who cuts out victims' tongues and replaces them with silver spoons. Police Officer Red Metcalfe (Ken Stott) and his team have the task of trying to solve the mystery of the seemingly random events, before more lives are lost.But be warned - despite it's '15' rating (in the UK), MESSIAH is a bit of a gruesome film.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with `` Valley of the Kings . '' These movies were very cheap and the quality was poor but it was really good! What can I say, this is my favorite horror movie ever made! If you're looking for some truly horrible horror, this is it. The dialogue is so horribly incoherent and ridiculous that I'm not sure if I could keep watching any more. Even though this is a remake of the original, I cannot see anything remotely resembling a coherent plot.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining a reasonable amount of tension. This is not an exciting flick but I found it to be very entertaining in its entirety. I was disappointed with the ending, especially considering how much time had been wasted on the storyline and character development . I really wanted to like this film, but then I came back to it shortly before being able to finish it. I actually saw it again when it went on at 5pm on the DVD release date.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me, but since that time I've been able to appreciate it and enjoy it more than any other film I ever saw on television. There are many interesting characters in this flick, both good and bad, and I think there's a fair amount of truth to them all, but the main thrust of this movie comes down to an extremely stupid story told by two idiots who have little idea what they're talking about. I bought this show because I really wanted to like it.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival . I went in with the assumption that it was a good movie but after watching it for 30 mins I got sick to my stomach. As far as the plot goes, if you've ever heard of "The Simpsons" then you're pretty familiar with all the bad stuff going on. This is a stupid movie. A bunch of losers who live in a fantasy world decide they want to kill each other and go to battle with swords, spears, axes, guns, and lots of magic.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s , its shocking how not a single movie made at the time was as good (and better) than this one. The script and music are so bland that it barely makes you care that the characters exist or even that they actually exist (you can tell they're all clones of each other if you watched the trailer). The plot is convoluted enough that you need to go to the movies for some context before getting into it, which isn't too bad.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth ? 15 park avenue is the wrong place to start your own website ! i am trying to create something new.i want people to know this is real,this is what it looks like when you get in your car.the first thing you see is an advertisement on tv for some sort of business,its very funny,but you can't buy it from a book store. There are lots of good reasons why you should not spend more than 2-3 minutes on a website. The first one is the size of the entire site.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to fully aroused woman and then back to repressed virgin in a moment, I was surprised that this was the first of what would become an annual tradition. The problem was, it was horrible. It wasn't the same as any of the worst films I'd watched during my college years, which was probably the most boring I'd ever been. But, even so, I can't really recommend it.

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best sums up it all is:
" "There was this one scene where a group of friends go out to dinner and are eating at a local diner. The only problem is that none of them have money. What happens when the waitress asks if she could take a tip off, and they say no. She then comes back to the table and offers to take her order, but does not seem to have had any extra money for anything else.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny (and fun) puns. The first shot we see in here is an island prison with the following written above its big gates: "Alka-Fizz Prison - No Noose Is Good Noose." Inside the prison, the first sign we see is "Welcome: have a seat." They then show an electric chair.Corny gives way to clever, however, as our favorite wolf is seen behind bars. With pen in hand, he literally draws a door next to him and then escapes through it!

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

Awww, I love this! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon doesn't really need an synopsis, as that's what it is... the cat chasing the moon, to a Spanish poem. It's the artistry that's interesting. In fact, there was this animated short called the Fan and the Flower that was an Academy Award winner last year (2005)... yeah, almost same thing, which leads me to believe it might just be a rip off.But this is a really good short, with stark black & white shapes shifting and transitioning into beautiful motion and poetic seduction...

There are a few things in life that we ca n't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. If you are looking for a perfect day at the pool or to meet up friends, this would be a perfect day. The beach is pretty good though. The kids were very fun and didn't complain. If you're looking for a place to spend the night it's probably better to come early as there is no electricity. I was really disappointed with this movie. I had already seen all the other awful ones but this one seemed to lack anything unique.

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

This comment discusses "North and South Book I" dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is mostly identified by people with the Civil War (1861-1865). This is a reasonable opinion because that was Civil War which put the Union under the severe test; that was the Civil War which made Americans realize how precious it is to live in peace; finally, that was this period which at last brought the end to the shameful system of slavery. From the birth of motion pictures, there were people who adapted that time onto screen.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

...I saw this movie when it first came out in France, in my hometown, 54 years ago, I was nine, and today I still remember each black and white frame, especially the black ones, because it was so tense, scary, those sneaking attacks through that dark pass in the mountain, the two soldiers, prisoners forced to fight each other by their captors, the last battle with the uncovering of the wagon with the Gatling in it firing away, the last fight between Peck and the chief, and the Happy End which let me take back my breath.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again ( because I 'd missed it), but alas, I don't have that option. I am completely in love with this film! It is so good and so funny! The acting is great and the writing is really nice! My only problem is that this movie is not for the faint-hearted! After all, it takes place during World War II, and when the Germans were about to invade France, Hitler ordered a complete evacuation of his country.

I too saw this movie when it first came out. I was a teenager at the time, and I saw it with my girl friend who later became my wife. I remember the movie made me feel it was possible to beat the odds. The cinematography was very well done if memory serves me correctly. The boy was a little much, but the girl character was very interesting. I thought it was very romantic and that might have been the intro to the first time with my then girlfriend. I have not seen the movie since and I wander why it has gone to the wayside.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom , which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of parents to their children. This show was about a small family, who move from one city to another to escape their own troubles. The main problem is the lack of human relationships. A lot of them don't like eachother, and are not always on the same page as each other. This can be annoying. They also have some really bad parenting skills. I wish there were more episodes like this series. It's sad how much has changed in this series since the original airing.

This film blew me away . I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot . After watching it, I can honestly say this: This is one of the most disgusting films I've ever seen. I have heard good things about the first movie. But I was worried about the second one. My only reason for being so was that there were actually two episodes in the movie. They did a pretty good job at keeping the plot from going to waste, but the performances weren't up to snuff. I really don't recall much about "The Man With No Name."

Fata Morgana is , by far , one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen in a very long time . The main character has become obsessed with a woman he meets on the street, a woman whose name sounds like it should be Fata Morgana . In order to do what she wants with the person she calls her lover, she tells him all kinds of disgusting and terrible things about her - even telling him she has two daughters. This movie is so bad it deserves its own website.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments, Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air. The film is like no other I have ever seen. Director Neil LaBute proves that he can direct more then disturbing pictures of men and women and how they approach sex (his previous two films were the brillant In the Company of Men, and the almost brillant Your Friends and Neighbors). Renee Zellweger gives the best performance of her career as Betty, a waitress who, when she witnessing the brutal death of her asshole husband (LaBute mainstay Aaron Eckhart), and gets lost in a fantasy world.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I can't imagine sitting down and watching these movies again. There are some moments that made me laugh, there are some which made me cry, and they really did leave an impact on me. Unfortunately, none of them were truly "bad". I watched this movie because I have a lot of friends over at my house who are avid watchers of Star Wars (I am not one of those).

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script, good camera work and transitions, good directing to handle some twists in the plot, good editing to keep the flow constant, and good acting. George Sanders is suave and witty. Jonathan Hale simply is Inspector Fernack. Paul Guilfoyle plays a mobster who goes straight (and drinks milk) because he cannot take the pressure. He will return in a later entry in the series. Story begins on an ocean liner headed to the U.S. where the Saint meets but cannot connect with Wendie Barrie.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

I don't think I have ever seen a better movie parody. Mel Brooks is insane. EVERY time I watch it I find something new and it makes it even more funny than the time before. Cary Elwes is perfect for the role of Robin Hood. It has a great and unexpected ending that leaves you cracking up. Every character is great from Little John and Will to Maid Marian and Broomhilde. I laughed the whole way through and will never get tired of it. Watch it! !If you liked Cary Elwes in this Movie, you must definitely see The Princess Bride.

There 's a brand new killer on the loose , and he 's doing God 's work . Yeah right! I know.I'm not saying it 's going to kill everyone in America , but that 's what it should do. This is a film with some serious shortcomings, like most of these genre movies are. This one seems to be full of them. The only redeeming feature is that the actors are very believable and convincing for the roles they play. There are other films where the cast is well rounded but the acting was so poor that I couldn 't see any difference.

America 's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense . It has a great hostess , a nice cast, and even a cool music theme. The only bad thing about it would be that the acting was terrible. I read all the reviews before I bought this movie. I have seen many of those reviews. Well, you've got to be kidding me if you think i'm going to pass this up for an actual good movie with decent script and decent actors! There's not much else to say. If you'd rather just watch the film, you can do that.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

Robert Altman, Nicolas Roeg, John-Luc Goddard--you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? These and other directors were obviously chosen because they have not followed the mainstream, but created it. For those that complain that they did not adhere to the original story of the opera--How often does the music in a film directly relate to what is going on in the film? It is the mood that counts. This is what I believe the directors of these movies were doing: creating a contemporary mood for old operas. For the most part they succeed wonderfully.

Believe it or not, the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once, and was missing for nearly two years. In 1911, Leonardo da Vinci's 'La Gioconda' (better known as the Mona Lisa) was taken from the Louvre by a petty thief (and former Louvre employee) who allegedly sought to return the world's most famous piece of art to its native Italy. His actions after the theft make it seem more likely that he intended to sell the painting for his personal profit. (Of course, he had no hope of finding a buyer.)

America's next top model is a good show, it helps people with their careers, but lately i have become bored with it.cycle 1: yeah I'm happy Adrienne won, i wanted her to win from the beginning.cycle 2: its too bad, i think Mercedes deserved it.cycle 3: i did not like Eva, but i did not like most of the girls in this cycle.cycle 4: Kahlen should have won. i don't know what they saw in Naima, but i definitely know what they saw in Kahlen.cycle 5: like cycle 3, this was not a great cycle either.
