Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have ever seen in years. "You know what's funny? Everybody thinks they know everything. But everybody doesn't know everything. So we just keep coming back." I can see why a lot of you didn't pick it up but for anyone who did, there are two things to bear in mind. First - it's an utterly forgettable movie with a bad name, a bad cast (it was directed by Rob Reiner), a poor script and lousy acting.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent, unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters. In the same way I loathed Fargo on first viewing, then realized I was still thinking about it days later and enjoying it somehow, I liked Nurse Betty a lot more the day after I saw it. Hard to understand, harder to explain. As others have said, it's quite forced in many ways, but that seems to be part of what makes it so striking.Fair job by Greg Kinnear, great work from Morgan Freeman (although I worry that he's being stereotyped as the principled villain).

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! The script is well written and keeps things escalating. It also has a great current of suspense coursing through it. You don't know what's going to happen next as the main character tries to deal with the realization that his new neighbor might not be the most ideal person to be living across from him. The jokes are quick and unexpected.

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to do a short animated movie. And boy, are they good. The writing is on the wall (well almost) for everyone to hate it as soon as its released, but I will say this... if you've ever seen it you will see why. A few months ago I stumbled across a great documentary on the film school's history. Its called "Hollywood vs. School Life" and has some truly funny moments.

Susie Q. is one of those rare , and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling . It 's a very well made movie in every aspect. I can't really describe it to you more than that because it is such an unbelievable movie, it makes you want to watch it again. You will wish you saw it sooner rather than later. The characters are quite well done, there are not too many plot holes and there is plenty of time for the story to get started. The movie starts off with a shot of a man lying on the street.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

If you want to see a movie with nudity , sex , drugs , alcohol , brutal beating of a woman, and what not, this is your movie. As I said earlier in the review I have seen quite a few terrible movies over the years so I was shocked at just how awful this one was. From the beginning it is clear that there has been a lot of poor writing from the writer. The script is very repetitive and lacks creativity. I honestly don't think the actors did much better on this one as the acting wasn't all that bad either.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old . I knew nothing about it prior to that point. I didn't even remember having seen the original film, much less its sequel. I also don't really know anyone who grew up with a Star Wars Blu-ray...so it was a bit strange to catch this one in the mail. If you are into Star Wars, The Empire Strikes Back, or the original trilogy then this is definitely for you. After all, there isn't much else out there like this anymore...if any!

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying. In their escape, the bandits split up. The one thief who knows where the gold is hidden is killed before he is able to talk. Three men have a different part of the "clue" that will lead to the gold. Can the banker, the bandit, and the bounty hunter work together to locate the missing loot? Or, will they kill each other first? - The plot is an obvious take-off of Leone's The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars ! I really do n't care what people can say badly about it ! I just want a movie that tells the truth of the matter! I am truly sorry that I wasted my time with this film ! One thing is for sure though - it is a terrible movie. The story was totally stupid, the acting was horrendous, the direction was horrible and the acting by the main couple (who I loved) was absolutely awful! It's one of those classic stories where the main characters get on a plane to another part of the world.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships, 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the spotlight on his own family, Block covers terrain that is off-limits for most filmmakers. He explores a common but often unspoken family dynamic and does so without resorting to hyperbole or sensationalism. In fact, the film is deceptively low key at the outset. In addition to providing a probing look at one family - and, by extension, every family - Block has also chronicled a very specific period in recent history. I don't know if this was intentional, but unavoidable due to archival content.Highly recommended.

I'm certain that people from USA don't know anything about the rest of the world, but I think they mustn't talk about what they don't know. And they must remember that the rest of the world is not as hypocrite as the USA. The only places where consented sex between teenagers are illegal are the USA and Islamic nations. In France, for instance, the age of consent is 15. In Brazil it's 14. In Spain it's 12. So the teenagers actors, 16 and 17 years old by the time of production, aren't doing anything illegal.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person's past? this film was very disturbing to watch in the sense that it was a true story and to think that humanity is still so cruel after all these years makes me ashamed everyone is human and everyone has the right to live their life in peace and harmony live and let liveif anyone knows the quote please let me know Thank youthis film should be shown a lot more publicly as true events as horrific as these shown in the film should be known to all in the hope that things will change sooner rather than later.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

Police officer Dirk Hendricks ( Jamie Bartlett ) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo ( Chiwetel Ejiofor ) .A member of a local crime gang, Hendricks is assigned to catch him. As he attempts to track down and interrogate the group's leader , Hendricks discovers that he may have been framed by someone who knows his name... but doesn't want anyone in trouble with his gang.The film starts out with some great performances from Mpondo and Ejiofor, which lead to one of the most gripping thrillers I have ever seen. In fact, it was nearly unbearable.

In a time of bad , if not plain awful , comedies , King of Queens is more than just a good story. In the 1980's and 90's television was dominated by movies, dramas and even reality shows. However with the arrival of Reality Shows it has been shown how far we can extend the boundaries of TV to allow comedy and drama to fill in the gaps. I don't think there's anyone who doesn't have some sort of fondness or obsession with King of Queens . I've watched two episodes of the first episode of season 2, and that's it.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of American culture and that of its Nazi counterparts. This makes for some pretty cool imagery, particularly when combined with the movie's plot.It's no secret that US The Movie was extremely popular at the box office back in the summer of '76. I'm sure anyone who watched it knows what a hit it was at the time. But even though it won awards (and critics too) there were so many things wrong with the film that it had to be pulled from the market.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim , California in 1998 . It had just been released on video and I didn't realize until a few years later that it is an excellent example of what film critics have said about it. If you want to make fun of bad cinema, this movie could really help you understand why some people seem to have a very hard time getting through it. This film has absolutely no redeeming characteristics. It may not be as bad as its title suggests, but I don't think anyone knows what it's trying to prove.

"L'Auberge Espagnole" collected the audience wherever it was shown. It gathered audience awards on many film festivals all over the world. And it is not strange. We have the ability to watch a cheerful and an astonishing piece of art. And it is wise by the way. "L'Auberge Espagnole" is a very funny comedy about youth and growing up. But most of all it is about the lights and shadows of living in the European Union.The main character of the film is a French student of economy Xavier. For his future carrier his is sent for one year of studying to Barcelona.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50's, along with my other favourite, Land of the Pharaohs". The sets and colours are just wonderful and everything seems so "neat" in the production quality. I thought Victor Mature was well cast and Peter Ustinov a real gem! The whole look of the movie (along with others made in this era) has an appeal that you just don't get with modern movies with all their digitized effects (I have yet to see the 1999 movie "The Mummy but am sure I will love it!

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by, no matter how bad it may look. His debut, Hustle and Flow, was one of my favorites from that year, with its emotionally charged storyline and realistic, fallible characters. I wasn't quite sure what I would end up thinking after seeing this sophomore effort. The cast seemed great, the trailer used music effectively, however, it seemed like there was a good chance it would cross into absurdity, and fast. Fortunately, Black Snake Moan hits all its marks dead-on.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years. As a boy, I enjoyed stories of mountain men and the wilderness. Books like "Call of the Wild", "White Fang", "The Frontiersman" and "My Side Of the Mountain", influenced me tremendously. I wanted so much to live like a mountain man, but nothing inspired me more to do so, than when I saw this movie on television in 1975. I wanted to be just like "Trapper".

This is a `` revised '' Riverdance presentation , staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City . The cast of this version includes John Goodman, Ed Begley, Gary Cooper and Robert Taylor. I have to say the film I saw last night that I had read about, was actually excellent. But as for the title of the movie it made me laugh out loud. It's an ironic title, isn't it? Maybe it was a good parody of "The Man Without A Home," which came out two or three months before this film was produced.

The most beautiful film . If one is looking for serious depth , meaning and excellent performance then you have to watch this film. I cannot say how well the rest of the film has done with respect to plot, characters and direction . It's a good movie! Not great as I expected since it was made by David Lynch and his wife in 1979. But hey, there are so many more great shows that he could've made at least if he would have tried harder. I really don't know how much effort he went through in making the movie.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking . I 'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and inspired by the most beautiful people alive, including yourself. If there were one word that could convey this film it would have to be "awesome" and if you haven't been watching it yet, here it is: awesomesauce! I'm a diehard sci-fi fan and when I first heard the news that George Lucas was writing a movie called "Star Wars: Episode 5," I had no idea what to expect.

Blue Planet ... Wow ... Where do I begin ? The years of hard work paid off in what is a pretty cool film. One thing that didn't quite work for me was the special effects, but this movie does an excellent job at adding to those effects.I'm not sure if it's due to the lack of good actors (at least IMDb listed some decent ones) or because there wasn't much time between the release of the first Star Trek movie and the production of the second one, but this was definitely my favorite movie of the year.

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

Minor spoilers follow, but nothing you won't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a wonderful central performance from Renée Zellweger, Nurse Betty is a dark yet deceptively good-natured comedy.Suffering from an emotional and mental breakdown after witnessing her sleazy husband's murder, already-troubled and desperately unhappy waitress Betty becomes convinced a character on her favourite daytime soap is her long-lost fiancé and sets off from Kansas to Hollywood to find him.Instead of making jokes at the expense of Betty's mental state, writer John C. Richards is very sympathetic, with Zellweger portraying her as a lost innocent, not entirely helpless but tragically vulnerable nonetheless.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film. It was when I was a teenager, I think (I'm 37 now). I started watching it as a late night movie sometime in the mid to early 80s, and so much of it has stayed with me ever since. Seeing other comments, I had NO idea it was shown at theatres, or that anyone else even new it existed. I don't think I've even mentioned the movie to anyone else.But half a lifetime later, I still remember much of the movie that I watched late at night so long ago.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. It is not difficult to define the reasons of this success. This movie made by one of the most interesting French film-makers of these last years, Cédric Klapisch, presents students coming from all over Europe and gathered all together under the same roof in Barcelona. These students are described like the ones you imagine or you see in everyday life: either untidy, either serious or with a sense of humor.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me just say that when I first saw it (in college in the mid 90's) I wasn't very good at acting, I just knew what to do. This movie is absolutely awful and I feel sorry for the producers as they would rather make a movie that makes people laugh and enjoy it. "The Box," based on a novel by Charles Schulz, was one of the great horror flicks of the '80's.

Honestly , when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana , I did not realize that this would have such a negative impact. I think this movie has been overhyped because it was released during the first film, The Big Lebowski. What made this film work was its storyline which took place back in the 1980's. This movie had a great story line with characters who were interesting and different than the previous film. There are also some very cool effects in this movie. It is hard to believe that even in 2000, we still had the idea of using cars for space travel.

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort to portray the character and the story but he just can't be bothered to put it together. I don't mind seeing an action-movie star doing his thing, but I have no patience for films that are "just so bad". I am surprised that this review was written in January, because I had seen the trailer and immediately thought, "Holy crap!" It was a beautiful film, especially the opening credits. However, I wasn't prepared for the movie to go nowhere.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . Both films are absolutely terrible. This movie isn't bad by any means.The acting is pretty good and it's a bit more interesting than I expected. The story doesn't hold your interest too much (unless you like to see violence) and there are a few bits that I couldn't help but laugh at. All in all, I would rate this 1 star. If you like westerns check this one out. I just watched the film.

there 's only so much that i can take of Filipino films , especially nowadays where the trend is sexier and more melodious, I have no problem with what happened in this film , just not enough to make me sit through it (it was very slow-paced for its time).I will say that some of the action sequences are pretty decent, there's no way I would want to watch such a gore-fest like this. But you know what? I'm glad they didn't rehash them. I liked The Great Gatsby quite a lot when I was growing up, and still do now.

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

Jimmy (Heath Ledger) is given a simple job by Pando (Bryan Brown) a underworld kingpin to deliver money to a particular address, but when no one answers the door Jimmy decides to take a dip at the beach to pass some time, but he notices that his clothes on the sand have been messed up and the 10 grand is gone. Jimmy rings Pando to tell him the problem, but he doesn't want to hear it. Pando and his boys try their best to locate Jimmy, meaning no more Jimmy if they get their hands on him.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time, but in truth, I don't even get to see enough of it to decide on what goes on at the end. I would like to see someone write a proper conclusion, but that seems impossible right now! I loved this show when I first watched it. However, since then I've only watched the DVD version and so far have fallen in love with this crappy movie. There really are no funny moments here, there is very little drama, and the entire plot is completely predictable.

The philosophical, meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind. I'd give it 10 stars for that alone. That being said, though, what hit me with particular force was what I take, possibly incorrectly, to be its Art Direction. Many of the interior shots feature a rich concoction of color blends seemingly based on very understated Munsell Color Model progressions and complementary juxtapositions. This makes the movie probably unrealistic to contemporary eyes, but, to me, very beautiful as an aesthetic work in itself.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art to more post-modern approaches that like to dissect the play along post-colonial, feminist, gender or deconstructionist lines. The reason why Jarman's version left me fairly cold is that I didn't have a clue what he was on about. What is the underlying vision/idea/concept behind this rendering of Shakespeare? The previous reviewers do not get much further than revenge tragedy, punk show, but surely there is more to it, isn't there?

See No Evil With Kane. The Movie Has a great storyline But it just wasn't a Hide my eye's, Scream Out Loud Horror Flick I thought it was going to be from watching the WWE Superstars on Monday Night Raw When The Movie First Came To Theaters. I Did ENJOY The Movie Though I Loved The Story It Played Out.GREAT MOVIE EXCELLENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A PART 2 It Doesn't Matter If Kane Gets Killed At The EndOr Not They Have Killed Off Other Horror Stars In Every Movie They Have Out And They Still Comeback For More So a part 2 wouldBe Very Interesting.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band's 30 year career. Lee, Lifeson, and Peart were animated and fun on stage and delivered a great show. That being said, I think the audio recording was botched at the mixing console and/or through the miking process. This is not the fault of the boys however. They even mentioned that the show was setup last-minute, so the band and their crew obviously did their best. They just shouldn't have put the show out for public consumption.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something good! I have no idea if they are in fact the same people or not.I think this is probably the best of the 4 films that they've done. I can easily see myself watching them again, especially if they are an 80's re-make of a TV movie. I would like to give this film 5 stars and say that I found it to be one of the worst movies I ever saw on the internet.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it or not! As I watched, I couldn't help wondering what exactly was happening in this movie. There was a very short sequence that played out on the screen where an older woman walks into the restaurant with a bottle of beer. She turns and sees two young men sitting outside. They start talking about how nice it is to be served food by somebody who can speak their own language. As they begin to drink, one man says something that got me really excited.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film . I had just seen the MOOG docu that made me think, ohhh crap, this is something that I really shouldn't have taken to a movie theater at all. I am not going to spend more than 20 words describing what I enjoyed about the film. There are so many things that make it worth the watch. First, the story. I liked the premise of "The Great American Adventure". We learn that a man comes up with an ingenious idea and goes through several steps to make it work.

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story, where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, and Richard makes an impromptu decision to have Karen sing for the owner of the studio.Richard picks the wrong key for Karen to sing in, so Karen is singing above her natural range. You can see a look of bemusement on the owner's face; he figures she really can't sing. Richard quickly realizes his mistake and tries again in a different key. The next thing you hear is Karen's amazing, beautiful voice, and the owner does a priceless double take.

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn ` t get to see the original teleplay untill a few weeks ago, when it was finally posted online. Now I am in disbelief that this one has not been made into a film yet, since it would have made perfect sense to do an adaptation of the classic story! It's just terrible! There is such a blatant disregard for what the original script actually represents. Everything from the ending, the characters, the themes, the way the whole film should have been presented all fall flat.

it's the best movie i have ever seen!!!!!! i just love them!! i watch it every day! i have the episodes from the internet! here in Romania is being broadcast the 6 season! i'm happy that i have seen the show from the beginning and i'm glad that through the internet i can see the 7 season. until now, season 5 is my favorite one :D i love it because Logan appears and the scene where they jump is my favorite. i have liked Dean too, but Logan is best.

An extremely down-to-earth , well made and acted `` Rodeo '' Western . No gussied up stars needed here as every one had to be seen. The acting is good as does the script but there are so many problems with this film, you could say it's a failure of art. This film should've been banned from the British film industry, I'm sure of that! One of my favorite movies (and probably the worst). If you have any experience at all working on any kind of storyboard or visual effect, this is the place to start.The movie consists entirely of CGI action sequences.

I Love this movie! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie, but I really disagree. The comedy is classic Mel Brooks style and the actors were superbly chosen. This was my first exposure to Cary Elwes, and Dave Chappelle and what a first impression they made. Cary Elwes shines as Robin Hood, the only British Robin Hood mind you. He has great comedic timing and the right attitude for this type of film. Dave Chappelle is obviously much bigger now, but at the time this was his first movie and he did an outstanding job as Achoo.

I really like this show. It has drama, romance, and comedy all rolled into one. I am 28 and I am a married mother, so I can identify both with Lorelei's and Rory's experiences in the show. I have been watching mostly the repeats on the Family Channel lately, so I am not up-to-date on what is going on now. I think females would like this show more than males, but I know some men out there would enjoy it! I really like that is an hour long and not a half hour, as th hour seems to fly by when I am watching it!

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made ..... Realistic . Movies were not candy coated. It's funny to think that I would watch something like this when I still knew nothing about the world of video games (I couldn't even say that I had ever really thought about video games at all). This film tells me, "You must be bored of watching so much of this crap, you should try and see a real movie or something." What? You're going to find some kind of horror-comedy here, right? Nope.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , if you've never had the misfortune of seeing it, then I can only advise you to try it. The opening credits were very cute and i couldn't stop thinking about the beautiful girl who fell in love with a handsome guy that seemed like his age. Hmmm..this movie seems so much like the old "The Boy Who Could Not Escape" where the main character gets married to a beautiful woman and she ends up becoming pregnant with his child.

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

I too saw this movie when it first came out . I was a teenager at the time , and I remember thinking how funny it was . Then I had to see it again because I wanted to go to Disney World that year. The fact that it was shown as an animated feature made me sit through the entire film. It was actually pretty funny in its own right, but I feel like so many people who have seen it don't really care. I thought this was such a good idea that I rented it on DVD (the original one) with no warning, and watched it two times.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

I just watched this movie on it 's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia . I liked (at least most of the characters) very much. The ending was well done but I don't see how it was not funny. The music was OK, especially for an 8-bit era. The whole movie is so boring and pointless. In my opinion it's worth less than 2 cents. It's really nothing more than that. Why does any director go to the trouble of making a film like this when all you need to do is get in a good fight?

Pat Conroy's autobiographical book "The Water Is Wide" proves to be something of a Southern "Up The Down Staircase", yet despite the teacher-going-against-the-odds formula, "Conrack" really does move the audience with each little breakthrough and creative flash. These students (uneducated black kids on an island off South Carolina) are actually shown learning, and their collective wide-eyed innocence is remarkably sweet. The one actual actress in the bunch (Tina Andrews, an amazing performer) plays the "tough nut" Conrack has to crack, and once she falls under his charms, it all seems a breeze.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

Tex Avery 's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the most enduring examples of that. However, since his death in 2006 , it has become fashionable among film fans around the world to blame him (or a bunch of other people such as Richard Donner or Robert Redford ) for the success of certain movies. There's been a pretty big debate surrounding this subject lately, mostly focusing on the criticism directed at Steve Martin's The Departed . I think it's important to put some context about the movie before making general statements about it.

This was on odd film . I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. If they had shown it as a kid, they probably would have lost a little of the charm and fun. So...what do you get when you mix two genres? Let's put this one in your mouth: An epic romance/comedy centered around an over-protective parent who takes her young child for a ride on a road trip between two rural states. Then she gets caught up in a series of "accidents", culminating in one that leaves her severely wounded and scarred by multiple injuries.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager , watching it in the early 90s. The film begins with a man who sees a little girl's face at the window of her house. She doesn't say anything, and suddenly there's a voice over saying something very rude. Then the camera cuts away to reveal an evil figure riding around on two horses, looking for victims. There is no script here, just a shot of one of the horses pointing his gun at some person sitting on the street.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old . In the movie, two friends and I watched 'The Man Who Would Be Queen' from the start. We loved it immediately and then we just stopped watching it for a couple of months. That was the day I decided to stop watching films like this. When I wrote this review today, I knew what I was getting myself into. A remake of The Great Dictator has been on my must list for years now but I wasn't expecting something so awful.

Great Movie! The sound track is awesome! Very relaxing sound. Elton was ahead of his own time even back in 1971. Lewis Gilbert did a magnificent job producing and directing this film! The movie was romantic and a breath of fresh air. The sound tracks written by Sir Elton complimented the movie to a T. Rex Morris does a great job with the tenor sax on the song "Honey Roll" and poem "I Meant To Do My Work Today" by Richard Le Gallienne was incredible! Kudos to everyone involved with this fantastic film!

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 10/10. This story was so over the top that I couldn 't wait for it to finish! This movie has nothing to do with Buddhism whatsoever. And there are NO Buddhists! It's just some nutty people going off on a bender and then turning around and saying, "Well, let me tell you about Zen!" You have no clue what's going on because they never come up with any names. They just start laughing.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries , I did n't expect much from 'Two Sisters'. There are no surprises, and the story isn't overly complicated, at least not for a comedy/drama. In fact, some of the characters act quite childish and even immature. 'Two Sisters' is an interesting drama in many ways. It follows three girls who go on an adventurous journey around the world, trying to find their lost father, only to become ensnared in situations that they can't escape.

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren Faust is amazing as a woman. It's good to see a comedy on TV again since it's been a couple of decades since I saw one. It wasn't much different then, and I guess I didn't know what to expect. The only thing I can think of besides the fact that this show has been done in Canada was that the producers decided to do it in the USA after watching an episode of Saturday Night Live.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel surfing when I saw something that had been posted to our Facebook page with the tag "Shallow Grave". There was a lot of hype surrounding it. After seeing the trailer for the film, I decided to give it a shot. I'm so glad you have seen this movie. If there's one thing I wish I could improve on, it's dialogue. I don't think we've gotten enough of it here in the U.S. or around the world.

honestly.. this show warms my heart, i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has started i'm even more hooked than before.. the characters are so well-developed and their relationships are so real.. i would recommend this show for any woman or mother and daughter.. the Lorelei's are super fast talking witty girls that will, truly inspire you and the show is hysterical at times and never too too serious, but serious enough for it to be completely addicting.. it's an hour long which is a major PLUS because you can't ever get enough Gilmore!

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to wanted to see again. When I saw Raquel Welch's name in the opening credits, I decided to watch it. It was actually mildly entertaining, and took me back "in the wayback machine" to the farcical movies that Hollywood churned out during the sixties, much in the same genre as the current Austin Powers stuff. Oh the acting was not superb, nor was the plot, but it was worth watching.

This movie is Wonderful! I can watch it again and again. Robin hood is Perfectly cast, and Marian is beautiful. I personally think Marian's German man is the funniest character, along with Latrine and the Sheriff! While space balls got boring and stupid after a while, this one always keeps your interest! W O N D E R F U L This was a great film, and never gets boring. A great cast is in the roles, and it is spoofed perfectly, and makes so much sense, and can be watched again and again!

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction. This is what today's documentaries are all about. It's refreshing to watch something so personal, honest and real. Mr. Block's thoughts, opinions and disclosure are rarely seen these days and are incredibly well displayed here. It's a fine line to walk between personal truth and exploitation. This film treads very carefully and quite successfully.One would think that learning about how a seemingly normal couple falls short of society's expectations would give birth to pessimism...but it doesn't. Quite the opposite: it made me feel good.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn in an excellent role. The most surprising thing I learned about this movie for me was that it might as well be a horror movie. Not only did the film have no story, but it even had not one. You know the kind of stuff that you'll watch to get off the edge? Well, you know exactly what happens when you do that. It's been a long time since we saw a good action movie from any company.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

Finally a true horror movie . This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes when I was watching this one, as I wanted to hide. The premise is simple enough: three kids are on a trip to see the Wizard of Oz and they come across a haunted house full of ghosts. The kid who is supposed to clean up at the end of the day has a bad headache and doesn't really want to go anymore. The ghost that haunts him keeps haunting him--even if he never sees her again!

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it's rabbit season. But, you guessed it - it's really duck season. Elmer Fudd appears: he's the only hunter dumb enough to fall for the gag.He's even dumber than that. When Bugs Bunny strides up to him and asks how the rabbit hunting is going, Elmer admits that he hasn't seen a rabbit yet. This is more than Daffy can stand. He emerges from his hiding place and immediately points to a rabbit: Bugs Bunny. "Shoot him now!"

In Mississippi , the former blues man Lazarus ( Samuel L. Jackson ) is in crisis , missing his wife and son who have been gone for years. His life is in a constant struggle with drugs, alcohol and suicide. As he tries to deal with this new world, he meets his estranged daughter (Lily Collins) and an ex-colleague (Bruce Willis), who help him find something else to live for. This story of two men trying to escape the pain of death is not as easy as it may appear at first glance.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story , where both Carpenters are in a recording studio and one of the Carpenters starts to sing "Wish They Were Gone". I think that this was intended to be an homage, but the way it plays out is much different. Well, if you've seen the movie and read all the comments then you probably know that I'm always up for a good laugh. That doesn't stop me from being totally serious about some things. It seems that they just couldn't possibly have thought of anything more absurd than this...

I got this movie with my BBC "Jane Austen Collection" (5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations) and didn't like it at first. It's completely different from the others and it lacks, or so I thought, one of the qualities that I enjoy in all other Austen movies: cheerful common sense. The nightmare scene in which Mrs. Richards apparently sews her fingers together was especially upsetting.I still don't like to watch the finger-sewing scene but I do love hearing Mrs. R. saying, dreamily, while she sews, "My only acquaintance...tore my gown."

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story  but don't find anything to go on  then perhaps you are looking for something rather interesting, especially if it takes a long time to explain and there are other films out there that try to explain everything. I found nothing of note. The characters were bland and their personalities had none of the life and wit that made this film memorable.It was hard to imagine why someone would want to watch this movie. Even more so considering that many people do not like children's movies.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound impact on my childhood. When I was 14, I spent an evening sitting in my parents' trailer watching this movie and thinking to myself, "I am not going to see this again until I am 65." I'm a die-hard fan of American cinema but I couldn't understand why there were only two films I could actually recommend to my kids: 1. The French Connection 2. Bad Moms 3. My Favorite Things 4. All In The Family .

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney, Australia, following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Jimmy, (Heath Ledger), who bundles a job for a local gangster and needs to make amend before they get to him. The gangsters, (led by Bryan Brown), are a menacing bunch with a humorous streak in them. That's what makes the film work, because we always view gangsters as a rough bunch out to screw you badly. But this mob tickle your funny bone as well. A clever structured script by Jordan has characters crossing paths and getting caught in the web plot.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost) is given a job at a hardware store where he discovers that there's more to it than meets the eye. In the midst of a battle with his new boss, Foster finds himself caught in a strange situation that turns him upside down and leads him out of the store altogether.The movie has a wonderful script by David Zalewski (whose credits include'' The Sopranos'' and ''Gangster Squad''), but the acting is dreadful; the dialogue is clumsy, uninspired, and lacking in gravitas.

I absolutely fell in love with this girls . let me tell you something : I am from Romania and it is very hard to find a good Romanian girl who is beautiful and doesn't need help. I would recommend this to any guy who wants to see another beautiful woman. When I saw the movie, my first thought was: "this ain't nothing but an adaptation of a classic!" Then I realised that I wasn't expecting much from the film. A couple of hours later, my second thought was: "what kind of crap did they put on this movie?"

First of all , ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans . Everyone is doing that on here. I'll try to make it funny, but there are many jokes that aren't funny and most of them would be obvious from watching an episode. This is a really awful movie ! It's so stupid that I almost couldn't watch this for hours because of how stupid it was ! The plot was not interesting at all ! The actors were so uninteresting ! You can tell what the writers intended when they came up with characters like Kyle and Trey !

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms, I thought I would get them all done now. Dads Army, is my all time favourite sitcom, It ain't half hot Mum is also a classic as is You Rang M'Lord. I don't regard Hi De Hi as a classic, but it is still funny.It's about a holiday camp, similar to Butlins, but instead of red coats, it's yellow coats. It is ran by Jeffery Fairbrother, a well meaning man, but has the personality of a sock.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a couple of days, but will become a classic within months or years. The story has an excellent cast , and the music does its job on every occasion . This is by far the worst horror movie ever made. At first, you can see the funny side of it, but as the film progresses, you begin to notice the very real issues with this movie. When I watch a movie for the first time, I have no idea what is going on.

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

There are a few things in life that we can't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. Especially if we're living in a foreign country and in a apartment with 6 wackos from 6 different countries. Xavier the main character leaves his tidy life in Paris, his ex-hippy mother and his beautiful girlfriend and goes to Barcelona to study spanish in order to get a job at the embassy. He falls in love with the wife of a french doctor and he makes friends that make him look at things differently.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Sydney. The plot focuses on the plight of a young would-be crim who's life is in danger after botching a job for his future boss. Very well acted by Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown. The plot is fairly believable with some very humorous moments in one scene which revolves around a bank heist. The setting-up of various themes central to the story is quite well done. Eg. When one crim is searching for bullets for his gun.

"Stripperella" is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones (voiced by Pamela Anderson) who lives a double life as a stripper at a gentleman's club known as "The Tender Loins" and as a sexy crime-fighter known as Stripperella, a.k.a. Agent 69 who works for a government organization. As Stripperella, Erotica fights crime and the forces of evil such as a plastic surgeon who gives women breast implants that either explode or make them fat and Cheapo, a criminal who steals from 99 cent stores and makes his two henchmen share a gun.

I saw the Messiah:- The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I have seen, ever. It was one of those programmes that you think that oh, no, I cannot watch the rest of this but you feel compelled to watch it just to see who done it. Jamie Draven was an absolutely amazing actor in it, to be able to switch between two totally, totally different characters one of which is the evil, nasty person that did it and the other person who is Jez Clifton, the cop.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way!! When I first tuned in to America's Next Top Model, I expected to be bored, and to find it very very stupid. I didn't. This show is actually serious fun. I read on one of the other reviews that it makes you wonder if you have what it takes to be America's Next top model. And it so does! Who doesn't love the glamour and excitement that come with being a model? On ANTM you get to see what it's REALLY like.

With all the dreck out there , this is a gentle movie about young love . Yes , it 's not as cute and funny as it may have otherwise sound, but it's still an interesting concept that has been tried and tested. "How to Be a Woman" is certainly not a great story. The main cast of characters falls apart at the seams. We don't get to see what happened to their parents either, and we can't even guess why. I really didn't like this film, but I saw it after reading a bunch of critics' reviews on IMDb.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good : The camera work was absolutely phenomenal . It was easy to get a good grip on this film because there was so many angles going through your mind every time you saw it. There was nothing that looked bad, and everything was really very well composed. I'm really curious what this is all about. Why did they make an underwater adventure? I don't like to think about it, because it seems silly. Maybe it's for the kids who won't know any better (they're adults).

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this must have been a reference to how it will be hard to understand what happens to people after death? What is even more depressing is that the film is not even based on any historical event! I have seen some of these movies before which are very well-researched and entertaining, but this one doesn't go far enough. I would not recommend watching it, but then again, you don't expect anything from a movie like this.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Renée Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats ok, the movie is just not good. This is one of those films you see and think "I can do this better". It is well-made in every aspect but it does have some bad parts. Let's start at the beginning, the way they filmed the opening. It was very difficult for the director to shoot. There were too many actors (well, there weren't too many) with too much time on the clock.

then you will be a big fan of this movie. Its almost the same basic concept, a nice mixture of music, soul, and drama. I'll admit, i was a little aprehensive about seeing this movie, I had only seen previews of a white trash girl chained to a radiator, but I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson and I enjoyed Hustle & Flow so i thought I would give it a chance.I'm very glad that I did. It turned out to be more than just the surface story of a nymphomaniac southern girl being imprisoned by a 60 year old black man.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

Having just got the "Loony Tunes Golden Collection"(which i HIGHLY recommend, by the way), I'm going to try to comment on most if not all of the cartoons individually. As such the starting statement might seem redundant for those whom read multiple reviews of them, for this i apologize.Rabbit Seasoning is the middle short in a trilogy of like-minded shorts (the other two being "Rabbit Fire" and "Duck! Rabbit, Duck). Bags and Daffy argue about who Elmer Fudd should short. It makes me laugh EVERY SINGLE TIME!!!

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film . It is an excellent entry point to watch the story behind it and some of the plot twists. The music in this film is superb, I really like the soundtracks for many films, and this one definitely falls into the "nice but just not up to the mark" categories. This is by far my favorite movie of all time. I don't know why people keep complaining about how good this movie sounds or looks. What do you want to hear from me? That the music has no effect?

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, they blame him for his reasons. Feeling guilty, Peck goes on an almost impossible task of defending a fort, where they are outnumbered by the Indians. Peck chooses for this mission soldiers which he considers to be the scum of the earth and the actors that play these soldiers, Ward Bond, Lon Chaney Jr., Neville Brand among others, are excellent. The script is derived from a novel by Charles Marquis Warren who was a specialist in westerns, as a writer, director and producer.

In "Black Snake Moan," writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me felt like dismissing the entire film as pretentious--a sweltering Southern parable with some oh-so-risky subject matter. The movie also contains a heavy spiritual subtext where religion is being hauled into the picture--again, this is integrated without subtlety. After the darker opening scenes, the film increasingly blunts its edge until the entire production comes off with the artificial quality of a stage play (and I'll admit, the last 15 minutes go way too far into "Happy Ending" territory for my liking).

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational). But there's a big flaw in that, too. I had been looking forward to watching this for a long time; but unfortunately I got disappointed and gave up on any hope of enjoying it. And when I watched it at my friends house it was just plain weird. The actors seemed completely lost in their own thoughts and the plot almost seemed to be contrivance. The story is ridiculous, the characters make no sense whatsoever and the acting was poor.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another crappy piece of trash. Now, I have seen it all. It is not a very good movie, and it has no plot. But what it lacks in plot it makes up for with poor acting, awful editing, terrible acting, poor editing, terrible acting, poor editing, bad acting, horrible editing, terrible acting, terrible editing...I could go on. This is my personal favorite horror movie of all time.

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice little story, but with better acting. That's about it. The first few minutes are good enough, but that is when the film starts to suffer from a bad script. The writing is bad (for lack of a better phrase) and very weak. I've said it before and I'll just say it again -the actors are great! Even though most of the characters are in terrible shape, they still do their best. But at the end, everything falls apart.

Based on Mika Waltari 's Book , This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color , beautiful landscapes and lush sound track. But the real reason why I love it most about it, is that it has an absolutely incredible plot . The film takes place a few years before we know how the world actually got to be like it is now, but it isn't really. In fact, many things could have happened during that time period (I won't give away anything), but the main character in this movie never had a chance to make his or her own future.

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own and I have a weak spot for crazy horror, slasher flicks and See No Evil happens to be exactly that and more!! I think that the biggest mistake made by producers and film makers of this film is that they hype it as a WWE film and "starring" KANE. WWE might have a big following but it's a very, very specific group that follow the incredibly cheesy and (sorry folks) kind of trailer park "sport" and those who don't love it HAATTTE IT!!

Well, okay, maybe not perfect, but it was pretty close. This movie jumped from crime drama to romantic goofball comedy and back again so quickly all the way throughout that it seemed like two different movies that played simultaneously and then joined up again at the end. But they did it smoothly, and some in the theater found the bloody parts (like the scalping scene) to be funny as well. I just about threw up, but I guess that's just me. Greg Kinear is perfect as a soap opera actor.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

I did n't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn . I do n't know why I keep buying it but i'm not impressed. The story is a mixture of plot twists and coincidences that will make anyone who reads the film go ape crazy. The characters are all bland and dull compared to the rest of what you'll find on the screen, and even the actors who appear are forgettable. If there was ever going to be a movie where two people would get together and fight, it was supposed to be this one.

It came before "the ten commandments" "land of the Pharaohs" "Ben Hur" and it's overlooked today.How unfair!Based on Mika Waltari's mammoth novel ,it doesn't cheapen it!Waltari's novel was so huge only a miniseries could have done it justice (I hope it will be done some day).Waltari,whose message is essentially Christian remains intact(another of his books "the secret of the kingdom" (first part) takes place after Christ's death in the Holy Land).

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons, Elmer Fudd is out hunting, and Daffy tries to get him to shoot Bugs. Needless to say, Bugs has his own agenda. Moreover, "Rabbit Seasoning" makes interesting use of word order and pronouns (warning: it just might hilariously and royally mess up your speech).I think that probably my favorite aspect of this cartoon is the costumes worn by Bugs and Daffy. One of them seems like it would have been risqué for 1952 (especially in a cartoon), but they pull it off perfectly, as they always did.

Okay, where to begin. Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous mime team Shields and Arnez? Bet ya didn't. But they turned it down complaining about robot make-up. Then they faded off into obscurity. Now, this movie has everything. A crazed killer robot who thinks he's dirty Harry. Lots of cool robots. It's funny, it's touching, it's the perfect date movie for people who love sci-fi and romantic comedies. It's the first robot romantic comedy. Now of course very few movies are perfect and there are some character issues.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford's best in my opinion. No major stars, but Ben Johnson shines in most everything he appears, and here he gets a rare lead as the title character. Matching him is Ward Bond as the crusty Mormon elder leading his people west. John Ford's stock of character actors, including Harry Carey, Jr., Jane Darwell, Russell Simpson and Hank Worden, provide ample support, as does eerily silent James Arness, a member of the outlaw Clegg clan that joins up with the wagon train.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits. The cartoon takes place during the 1950s, where a man calls up Bugs and asks him about what he has seen on television. Bugs tells him that he "saw" a group of people killed and eaten by spiders; it turned out that this was an attack by a spider army called the Spidershark. This book is a must read if you're a Bugs fan! It starts off with a short clip showing the beginning of the show, but quickly dives in to all the great moments.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

I LOVE this movie. and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore. I think they should definitely put Susie Q back on the air at least one night so we can record it!!! but if not does anyone know where I can find it?? my email is cristin6891@aim.com please email me if you know where i can find this movie. Online, or anywhere. I told my kids about this movie and i think that they deserve to see it also. All these Disney movies that are coming out now are fake and boring.

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , this however is very different . I mean how can you make such a funny movie when you are going to rape young girls and have sex with boys like that? Well i am not talking about any of the other stupid stuff. "This movie is disgusting in many ways...it's just another example of what I've seen as a viewer before. They don't know what to do with it. If they did, then they could probably write something decent!

I did n't personally know Karen Carpenter , nor , Richard for that matter , so I must go by her opinion as it was from her perspective. Well, what is wrong with that? First off, the movie has nothing to do with this story whatsoever . It is a ripoff and is just another cheap exploitation film (or at least one of these) that goes against the good old days of genre entertainment. The characters don't add anything to the plot, the acting doesn't keep you riveted, the plot twists are predictable, and the music is terrible.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply the perfect film. Not only is the score of this movie so beautiful it must be from the 80's or early 90's. The performances here are also quite good (and I am going to say that more than any other film) but there were too many errors in my mind, especially on the guitar player's part. He seems to have lost focus on his notes during some of the songs he played, which made them sound very dull.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Most horror movies look bad at best and some of the reviews for this one were so bad they could only be from a 5 star audience. However it was just plain bad as well. Some of the gore was very obvious and the acting was poor. "A man walks into a small town on Christmas Eve, and finds out that someone has been killing people in his name all year long. This is the tale of John D'Anconia."

I'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things. However, SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work. The story, acting, filming, psychological themes, erotic quality and spiritual understanding are all really quite complex and compelling. Rose plays the complexities and shifts of a psychologically disturbed woman really quite accurately. My partner was particularly impressed with the sophisticated way the power exchange issues were handled. It was so intense for us to watch that we found ourselves leaving it three quarters through to "get tea" and I felt compelled to have a shower.

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for us ! There is no 'speciality' or 'type' - just a mix of quality. If you are looking for it, then I strongly recommend you to check out the other books by this author. You won't be disappointed ! This is one of my favorite titles in the whole genre. Its story follows a group of friends living on their honeymoon in Australia during the Second World War. During this time period we get lots of beautiful women, including some with big boobs.

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I thought it would be a teen soap, you know, who's dating who, that kind of thing. But it was not. It is surprisingly deep. It is also very witty. It moves at a very fast pace, and there are more and more jokes you catch every time you watch it. It is a comedy-drama, which is rare when well done. It is about Rory and Lorelai's relationship.

`` Please , do n't kill me ! I 'm just an actor ! '' `` Can you play dead ?'' `` Yes , I am a man but I am also a victim !! I have come to forgive you and I will pay for what you did to me .'' There were lots of women in these scenes. One, whose face was always obscured by makeup, has a big scar on her nose. The most disturbing scene in the movie is with the woman who played the role of Marjorie Vannes. She's so hideous that there was no way anybody could possibly believe that she was human.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short. Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a pure emotional response to the script. Well acted, directed, shot and written. I was surprised to hear that there was no rehearsal before shooting, not even a read through. The performances stand as testament to some fine instinctual acting in response to a well written script. The actresses work was excellent and there was never an indication that their work would slip into the purely sentimental. Less is much better in this case.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries, I didn't expect much from 'Two Hands'. But how wrong I was. From start to finish, you're kept deeply engrossed in a genre which has been continuously unoriginal for quite a while. Even in terms of mise-en-scene and cinematography, the director excels and creates a film consisting of great imagination. If you're looking for a film which is not only entertaining, but also provocative, compelling, and genuinely extraordinary, then make this the next film you watch.

This was a pretty good episode. Though no "Trapped in the Closet" or "Cartoon Wars," it had a lot of things going for it. The character of Al Gore and that bizarre-as-hell "super cereal" thing was pretty darn funny. But, the scene that made me adore this episode was one I'm sure everyone will agree was one of the greatest Cartman/Kyle moments ever. When Cartman is superstitious of Kyle that he'll be stealing his gold(which of course is fake! ), and he comes within inches of his face.

Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

I saw it in Europe-plex . Great movie ! ! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the soul. I love that this film was only shown in Spain. The story is truly amazing.The script is excellent and really interesting! The actors are talented. One of our favorite films of 2011 has finally come out. In my opinion, one of the worst films ever produced...and that is saying something considering it took more than a decade to get made. However, with the release of this film, I can not complain at all.

After getting hooked on the mini series , `` North & South , '' I could hardly wait for the next one, but this one didn't come out yet. I was a huge fan of the movies, so watching this miniseries just gave me all kinds of feelings of disappointment.I know what you mean, but seriously, there is nothing at all funny about this movie. To sum it up, I can only conclude it was a lousy attempt at acting. Wow, this is one of my favorite video games of ALL TIME!

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in the middle of the movie where the police chief talks to the actor and he says : "There's nothing to talk about. We know you don't have a clue, but we've got some ideas on how to get rid of you". My wife was very excited when i read that the film was going to make an impression on me. When i went to rent it she said it sounded like a good movie.

GREAT, Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen.. He acts it up, perfectly. This was like watching Robim Williams as he really was and is.. It almost made me cry watching him.I had no idea that Robin was as close a friend to John Belushi as he was. The portrayal of this relationship was very good and could almost stand on it's own merits.. Very sad, what both of them went through.I really felt for both Val and Robin during his rough times.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love this show is it is such a fun watch. I know there is a lot of bad acting in the first season but the writing was very good when it came to developing characters and the plot lines. The main character, Rory (played by Lauren Graham), is intelligent and funny. However, one thing about Rory is that she doesn't really care who she loves, she just goes along with everything else. She does not care if you believe her or not as long as you do.

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

Jimmy ( Heath Ledger ) is given a simple job by Pando ( Bryan Brown ) a underworld kingpin to take down his own brother-in-law and wife. However, things don't work out as planned when two rival bidders join up with their rivals to get rid of Pando. So it's nice to see a sequel this good. In fact, for the most part, there's one redeeming thing about this film. There was a certain level of continuity between "The Wolf of Wall Street" and "Night of the Living Death" (for example), but it wasn't as clear cut.

i love this show ! it is amazing ... i can never miss an episode even if i 've already seen a few others ! and for the price it is very good .... you will also find that they use only the most cheap and low quality equipment !! So, my wife called me up one morning and asked me if I could watch this. She said her daughter wanted to see it, so I figured I would have to see it.The thing about this anime is what happens when you let it ride all over your little mind...

If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What makes it bad is that it was made in 1978, when he was already famous. This movie had more potential to attract the audience, but for whatever reason it failed to do so.
