It has no redeeming qualities, and if you have not watched it recently, you may want to go back as soon as possible. The music is decent at times, and the acting is good overall, but it just doesn't live up to what I expected out of an "oldies" remake.

I have n't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way as this. While the movie is actually pretty boring, there are some really great lines that I could have used in the film. It gets kind of tiresome after about 5 minutes or so. In fact it was starting to get rather irritating. One of my absolute favorite films of the 1980's. The original "Rambo" has been out for three decades but this latest incarnation is far more faithful to the original than previous generations.

Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. Every single one seemed truly talented and knew how to act their way through a movie. I remember Friday nights and running to turn on the TV just to watch their newest movies. Susie Q was one of my all time favorites. I never forgot this movie. Even till this day when one mentions the song "Susie Q" I always remember the movie.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance, women-on-the-verge psychodrama, work place sexual harassment, adultery, and fashion. It's all there. Typical characters found in corporate America. Joan Crawford is the usual long time employee bitch executive who feels the need to be such because she's with the big boys. Hope Lange is the entry level ambitious employee whose determined to get to the top by using her mind and not her body. Their personal lives is the subplot. Wardrobe for the film is great but someone forgot to tell Stephen Boyd's hairstylist that "a little dab will do ya!"

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch. She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of Harry (Mike Wagner) girl friend. Harry a robber down on his luck trying to make one more heist. Harry goes to a funeral where he meets Vittorio De Sica and takes him for a ride. When things don't work out on the ride they put there mines together to figure out the fastest way to get money. Harry and his gang decide with the help of Vittorio De Sica to from there on mob.

I ca n't comment on the accuracy of this production , historical or literary , but I can say that this is one of those rare films that deserves to be seen as such. It is well made and beautifully shot . It took me many months to realise this movie was not going to get a sequel. However I finally realised that it would never get made. And because of that I have to admit that I am quite disappointed at the result. The first two sequels are totally overrated. In fact I did not see them in all they were advertised.

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (one of the writers) giving a great talk. It was all well written and the music was nice, but I thought that it didn't do justice to the story. I have read several reviews of this production saying that there are things wrong with some of the performances. First off, most of the dialogue was too slow for the camera to keep up with the pace of the storyline. The director tried to make them sound like we were playing a game rather than a real life scene.

GREAT , Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen .. He acts as though he are a good actor with great acting abilities. I think this is the worst film I have ever seen on TV. In fact I am quite certain that anyone who watched this film today, would be extremely disappointed. The story is so lame that the characters and their lives are so devoid of life that you can just sit down and watch it. The actors are very bad and don't seem to know how to properly act.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three hundred Indians, murdered an entire village, and taken thousands of children hostage. This movie is the worst movie that I have seen in quite some time. The plot is so convoluted that you just can't get through it. There are so many coincidences that could have led to all these different scenes happening at exactly the same times, but because of this, you end up wondering whether the director was watching the TV version of the movie instead of the movie or vice versa.

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A Boat''. I went with my girlfriend and we rode along the river bank for 4 hrs. We made it to the bottom and got out of the boat without anyone noticing us because we were just so far down the river. When I was halfway up, she stopped at the mouth of the gorge and told me that if I could get down, I'd see her. I saw this video on a local TV channel, which showed a group of hippies driving their bikes through the rock.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland, and it was simply brilliant; the saving grace of what was an other wise forgettable to just plain bad grouping of films.A perfect use of deep black and pure white, with excellent, yet simple animation, this is simply a story of a cat chasing the moon. Funny, charming, and touching. A small piece of heaven for cat lovers, romantics, and any one else who appreciates how beautiful simplicity can be. If it's in your town, see it.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should put the DVD out and let people enjoy it , even though many of them like it. If you were to sit down one morning with a cup of hot coffee in hand, you'd be forgiven for thinking that you were sitting in an art museum. You would be wrong. But then, you've probably been up all night watching documentaries about dinosaurs, so maybe that was what you were expecting.The director, David Lynch, doesn't pull any punches.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including `the young & the restless.' However, I guess some of the profanity, violence, and sexual innuendo in the movie are not suitable for `all your children.' Anyways before the sand fills up the hourglass, let me tell you the name of the film: `Nurse Betty.' Renee Zellweger stars as Betty. She is a Kansas waitress who falls under a trance, and thinks she is a real life character of her favorite soap opera.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class . The musicianship of this album isn't up to par, however. This album is pretty bad, but there was something good in it. I'm not a fan of rock bands, so I wasn't going to have too much faith in "I Got a Dream" when I saw that this was based around a story of one of them being killed at the end of the previous film. But you know what, let's just say it didn't feel like an honest depiction of how these guys were living.

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theatre. But then, that's what happens when you miss out on a movie because it isn't widely known (or even talked about by the filmmakers) until it hits stores. The reason I don't care for this movie is because it tries so hard to do something different than any of the others. This movie is not "alternative" at all--it has nothing to do with anything but itself. It is just a bunch of kids playing a video game.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the "big, blockbuster" movies so that he could afford to make the "small" movies that he loved so well. Wagon Master, with a young Ben Johnson, is clearly one of his best, if not the best of his small movies. The location shooting, the wagons, the intricate work with horses, and the inclusion of the plains Indian are all trade marks of Ford. As in many of his other films, Eisenstein, the great Russian director's influence is seen in this film.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short . Every element of the piece assists in eliciting emotions from the audience. This film is absolutely brilliant and should be seen, not just as a film for kids, but if your age group is anything like me, this could be a must see! I highly recommend you to check it out! What a disappointment! What a shame that the DVD/Blu-ray released on Christmas Day didn't include at least two special features which would have made my Christmas list even worse. First of all: The voice acting.

I liked this a lot. The camera angles are cool, it's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. And I thought they did a great job with the Sound when we see things from Kane's point of view. Lots of fun. Plenty of people were shouting at the screen! Kane did a great job with his various psycho emotions. He's a lot less one-dimensional than most horror heroes.Kane is a lot less scary and more believable than most movie psychos. It was not clear to me how he would react to various situations.

Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks. He has the assignment of spoofing the Robin Hood legacy and the couple of movie dealing with the mythical honorable thief of English folklore. Cary Elwes stars as Robin Hood. He's looking for a few good men who'll join him in his quest to topple the evil sheriff of Nottingham (Roger Rees) and win the fair hand of Maid Marian. Robin also has to deal with Prince John (Richard Lewis).as well.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . There are some pretty bad actors here. First, there is Gary Oldman , in his prime he was a big star when he appeared with Tom Hanks . He was probably one of the best known actors of the decade but I don't care about how much people like him. He just looks old and pathetic. And the rest of the cast has good looks. But what can you say? There is no character who makes you think "this person is real."

The "Hunting Trilogy" of Rabbit Fire (1951), Rabbit Seasoning (1952), and Duck! Rabbit! Duck! (1953) should be considered the comedic high water mark of the Chuck Jones-Michael Maltese collaboration. While they are seldom mentioned in lists of the "greatest" or "most important" cartoons in the history of animation, they are certainly THE FUNNIEST cartoons I've ever seen. Michael Maltese never got the credit that directors like Jones, Freleng or Avery got, but it's his dialogue and situations that make Warner Bros. cartoons, and these three in particular, some of the FUNNIEST ever made.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest, but instead I was struck by how utterly disheartening it was. The characters who were supposed to be good had absolutely no redeeming quality whatsoever. The entire plot involved a bunch of people trying to make sense of the universe after all the alien abductions are over. This film may look like something that you might have seen somewhere else on the cable channel, but I can't imagine anyone watching this movie considering it a serious contender in the horror genre.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe , grappa , aramangac or jungle juice some time in 2006, I would've wondered how they weren't all trying to get away with murder as well. This is possibly the worst movie that was made in 2001. It basically has two things going on. One is that the main character is a drug dealer and he's constantly getting caught. He needs help from a lady who can kill him if he breaks his rules, but she doesn't really care one way or the other.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie . Amy Jo Johnson ( Susie Q ) is a great Actress and she can do the movie very well. I don't know how this movie would be able to win it's Best Picture accolade if it didn't look like something out of the Twilight Zone! There's a lot of action in this movie, but none of it is really effective or interesting. I watched this with my kids and thought it was fine for two days. They were also watching the movie on their TV, so they could enjoy it just as much!

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis. The only good thing I've done with this novel is that it's extremely hard to follow so you don't always get the whole story or what is going on around you. But other than that the story just feels like a long boring movie, not worth watching again. I am sorry but this was a horrible book! Not only do the characters have no redeeming qualities, the plot never comes close to satisfying.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air again ? I know that it is an original story but why am i wasting my money? the only reason was because of the bad acting by the director in the film. This movie just wasn't funny enough. First of all you are a liar, you should not watch this film. It's a remake of a famous movie and no one has been able to get a hold of its original script or director as he left the production in 1960s.

I wanted to watch this , to get a inside look at the show . It told the story more honestly than many TV shows out there and it did so in a good way that I have always been a fan of 's drama. For the longest time I was trying to follow the lead of my sister-in-law, who came home early from her trip to see an old Western movie. She decided that she wanted to play some cowboy, but she also didn't want to be called "that woman", which obviously wasn't in the mood to go on a hunt.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than the others. It's just not as bad as some films you might expect to see. The characters are funny, and even if this isn't the case, it's still an entertaining viewing experience for those of us that enjoy scary movies. I've been a huge fan of Dredd since my early childhood and have always felt that he was one of my favourite films. However, there was no way I would ever get around to watching this dreadful piece of scumf*cking filth.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right . And when it goes wrong ... I 'd love to sit back, have a cup of tea and ponder the reasons why this film went so wrong.It's hard to pick out a few things that make the movie different. First, the music is not as good as it could be in any other genre. It's quite loud and obnoxious. Secondly, there are some problems with the acting. In fact, my favourite thing about the film (for me) was the opening credits which were more than adequate.

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just something which was not unique. it was a series and i even did not know someone in it. later on, i realized that edward hermann is part of the cast of overboard (a movie, i absolutely adore). i had to watch it once with a friend and never stopped since. it's just fun. you have the feeling that it is okay to have sex before being married and it's okay to be a coffee junkie and to eat unhealthy stuff all the time.

Obsessed!!!!! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is because of how smart the script is, its not your average comedy show there isn't any pause after a joke it just keeps on, if you missed you missed it. And its not like a soap opera drama either because it doesn't use dramatic music and the actors never have those stupid cheesy surprise looks. I think Gilmore Girls is one of the bests shows on T.V. shows of its time.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone recommend it to you ? I have to say that I was quite disappointed when I saw this movie, I had never heard of it before (I read a review in a newspaper). It wasn't until I looked at the box office receipts that I understood why people didn't like it. This film has such a dark tone and it feels as if no one really got out of it (in the words of the reviewer).

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

I do n't usually like to see movies while they 're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but this movie is just plain wrong from beginning to end. It should have been a good thriller with believable characters who can survive on their own. The only reason I gave it 5 stars was because of that. I'm not entirely sure whether this is meant to be humorous or for serious, and I think the latter is probably the best choice. There's a whole lot of stuff going on in this movie that makes it almost comical.

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series ever. I'm a fan of everything the movie has to offer because it's one hell of a show and there are always some new episodes on DVD every couple of years as well. I am completely in agreement with you. For the most part, I liked the first episode, which wasn't that bad (just a little too repetitive). However, the second half of the show was pretty bland.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western, given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social history into its plot. Lead by Mario Van Peebles, who does OK, the gang of misfits on the run from Billy Zane's (seemingly unstoppable) army bigwig all acquit themselves well, their adventures plausible yet fun and exciting. There're some nice moody flashback scenes setting up the hero's character and backstory, a good shoot-out ending as our heroes defend the town from greedy white landgrabbers, and even Stephen Baldwin isn't bad in this enjoyable, quite powerful western.

Forget about Donnie Darko . I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have seen on IMDb seem to take this as a joke. I know that IMDb is just one of many film reviewers and there must be thousands or even millions of other reviewers out there who would find this "funny", but what the hell did I ever do? I watched this movie in the theaters and couldn't believe my eyes. I honestly can't understand how people could put this movie into such a dark, disgusting, offensive light.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west. Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . What a waste of time it was and why did they bother to even call it such? You get the point. If you are not an expert on French people, then go read some books. You don't need subtitles. I'm sorry for saying it out loud because I am sure that many people who can't speak English will be shocked by this movie. The dialogue is too clunky and incomprehensible. The characterisation is also bad.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if the romance is entertaining enough to keep you invested. It didn't seem to be in either category. This movie seems like it would have made a good romantic comedy, so it wasn't really much of a shock that it failed to deliver on all those expectations.I thought the character was okay at first but she became boring after only one scene where she seemed to be trying to catch the eye of a handsome boy.

When I saw the preview for this movie , I figured to myself , `` here 's another dumb TV show about a bunch of bums trying to get back together. The first few minutes or so are pretty good . But as soon as you start seeing these bad actors try and do their best, the movie just doesn't get much better. First off, there was a lot of plot in this movie that made me stop and take notice. First, it featured a number of non-action scenes involving cars, trucks and bikes.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin's short 'Chess Fever', a mad tale of how a rigorously intellectual board game could disrupt even the most carefully planned central economies. Such an unpromising comedic subject as chess found an earlier outlet in this delightful short. Two young men play the game earnestly against an artificial background, a painted set. This is in contrast to earlier Lumiere shorts such as 'L'Arrosseur Arrosse' or 'Repas du bebe', wherein the human activity was deliberately framed by a natural setting.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar, which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything, and the movie was by far the highlight of the evening. The technical elements were well meshed and it was obvious that Duncan Rogers had chosen his designers and crew well. But it was the story and it's delivery that truly made this short shine. Duncan Rogers' tight script was just what this evening of "shorts" needed. It neither meandered, as several offerings did, or preached to us. The Reader was simple story telling in it's best form, well cast by Rogers and beautifully acted.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how Colombia has changed since its independence in 1962. At first, we meet the usual old guys and get a good taste of what it must've been like to live as a woman in that part of Latin America. But then I was taken aback.The film opens with a small group of men playing golf on the island of Málaga. They are led by one man, who decides to walk his dog along the beach.

Sweeping drama with great sets, costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett, Scarlett, Melanie and even Lady Macbeth. Patrick Swayze and James Read are excellent as two men trying to maintain a friendship despite the ties of family and location. Splendid villains  you'll want them all to come to a very bad end. Lots of strong female characters in this one  both good and bad. Secondary story lines also are well developed. Several cameos by major stars of past eras. Good representation of history and conflicts for those caught between friendship and politics.

Okay I marked this spoiler so don't be upset when I wrap this up. Now I went into the movie expecting to see a very predictable movie. And I was right, as almost every horror flick I have ever seen it was predictable but not as bad as most. What helped was the story, I did not expect there to be a "WHY" to Kane's madness. But there was and while somewhat foggy you still got the idea and understand the madness. Now of course if you like something that will scare you for nights to come this is not the movie your looking for.

I could n't believe the eye candy from start to finish . Being a fan of movies directed by music people, I was very interested in watching this flick. There was only one problem, it looked like there was no CGI at all. The soundtrack was pretty good but i didn't find anything worth watching. This movie does have some merit, and it's just that it's not a "movie." This is a piece of art made by a talented director whose talent was wasted on this film.

The show is GREAT . No words to describe it . Wonderful music . Incredible dance . The editors could not do an interview about it. If the movie had been made, I don't understand how it would have been so funny . The only thing that was amusing was that the characters were completely off-base. There was no way for me to figure out what they were supposed to be saying in the movie. Most of their lines did not even make sense at all. This is a must see movie! It has one of the funniest dialogues in history and a fantastic acting team.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning, and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has the best humor, you can identify with the characters, we talk about it at work a lot, because I work at a company a lot like IPS, (DHL) and we just love the Teamster plugs!! Carrie is my hero, she is the best, she just puts it out there, no matter what the subject is. Arthur well what can you say? He just cracks you up, and really puts a spin on things.

Renee Zellweger is Betty, a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse, who is infatuated with a soap opera actor (Greg Kinnear), and who is married to Del, a cheating, stupid male chauvinist who's trying to sell some stolen drugs. Unfortunately for him, he gets brutally, bloodily murdered instead, while Betty secretly watches. It leaves her unhinged, believing that Kinnear is really the character he plays, Dr. David Ravell, and that she is his RN ex-fiancée. She heads for LA to find her lost love, not knowing the stolen drugs are in her trunk.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm , wit , and charm . At age 16 Lorelai was forced into a convent where she stayed from 13-19 years old after her parents split up, then had to live at home for a couple of years while her father returned to Spain. The first three seasons were awful, so you could forgive it's faults. The fourth season has all the fun, however, except for the final two episodes. I don't remember the first episode or how I found myself hooked by it.

The best of everything. Just what is the best of everything? It is different for everyone but for most of us it is love. But alas not everyone knows where or who to look to for real love. This story goes the whole gambit of looking for love. Sometimes in all the wrong places and for all the wrong reasons. But as the saying goes,"we are the captains of our own ships", and so it goes for our lives. We are responsible for the choices that we make in our lives. Once we make those choices then we must live with them.

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired and I would have liked to see more, this may be a better than average movie overall. The writing itself is weak, the acting is bad, the plot is not well thought out, etc., etc. All these issues add up to make Conrack just another generic action flick with no story behind it. Don't waste your money on this crap. (Curtis "Buster" Conrack)
When you've got the biggest budget of all time, why do you waste it on such a lousy film?

"The Honkers" is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time. When we were shooting, everyone connected with the production figured that Slim was Academy Award material. Unfortunately, United Artists had a James Bond picture in release at the same time and did not devote much attention to "The Honkers". I personally feel this film was under-rated by most critics. Sam Peckinpaw's "Junior Bonner" was out at the same time and seemed to impress the critics more than our film. Also, Cliff Robertson had a rodeo film out a few months before our release and that might have hurt us, too.

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went to sleep that night and woke up about an hour after the end of the movie, with tears streaming down my face. That was probably one of the saddest things I ever saw in my life. Well, this is a story you don't usually hear anymore. And while some of you may have heard of it, let me tell you: The film is completely un-sourced, never even mentioned as a fact.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a woman feel insecure about their manliness (not that I'm saying it doesn't exist), I was very disappointed. This is not exactly the type of film you'd expect to see directed by David Fincher, so I was surprised at how much I wanted to believe that he was trying something different. I've never been a movie fan but this seemed like such an interesting movie. It looks promising; the script seems to be engaging and intriguing.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for "Once Upon A Time in the West" but couldn't persuade Clint Eastwood to appear in. Three tough-looking gunfighters ride into a town. One is dressed like the Man with No Name in a poncho. Another is dressed like Colonel Mortimer from "For A Few Dollars More," and the third is garbed like Django, except he rides a horse instead of pulls a coffin behind him with a machine gun in it. Our hero meets them in Main Street behind a wagon loaded with three coffins.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one star and only because this movie is so badly paced and poorly shot. The actors are generally very good at acting but none of them do anything really special. The plot line is so vague that you could follow it if you just read it. You'd be surprised how many times you need to sit through it just to understand all the nonsense. I would never recommend this movie, even if you were a fan of King of Queens , despite its low overall rating.

Having just watched this with my mother (Who got it for Christmas) i was thrilled to find something different to the usual stuff i usually watch. All of the stories were detailed and you are able to feel strong emotion towards each character from the very beginning. Every storyline is followed through brilliantly, making you feel completely different things for every single character. The cast is amazing, my personal favourites being James Read and Lesley-Anne Down, as George Hazard and Madeline Fabray/LaMotte/Main. The whole thing is in depth and wonderful, making very compulsive viewing, i recommend it to almost everyone.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments , Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air . The film has its charms but it fails in so many areas that it's hard to justify watching it. A lot of the humor came from what seemed like a simple joke at the end of an evening when I thought I might be about to make a joke. But then my wife came up with the best idea for how to take this seriously. This movie had no good ideas whatsoever and it made me want to laugh so much I could barely control myself.I just laughed so hard!

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture, 'Wagon Master' made after two big Indian-cavalry epics... It is a lovely poetic movie, full of romanticized reincarnation of the pioneer spirit... It didn't have to top the big ones that had preceded it...Photographically, it is extremely simple... The camera moves only once or twice in the entire film, and never when a director would have made it move to underline a shot... Ford even resists the temptation to track his camera in the breathtaking twilight shots of the women wearily marching along in the dust behind their wagons...

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites . The unsung hero of his generation . Nobody knows him, but he made an indelible impact on me in the 80's, so I guess it was a treat to finally have him in a book. This book is as bad as it looks, just terrible. It's not exactly easy to find out anything about Mr. Cukor from television, but now that you've seen this film series, you can probably figure out everything about him from your own childhood.

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me thinks that this film will never be released on videotape. There's no dialogue whatsoever and the picture lacks subtlety (which it seems to be lacking from most movies). If you're going to write a story about an escaped slave in Louisiana, why not start with him talking? There are a few good reasons I didn't enjoy this movie. To start, I had just finished watching "Black Snake Moan" and I found it quite funny and amusing at the same time.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films, I still can't shake the feeling that it would be better if it had been made in this country. It is such a silly movie - there isn't enough humour in the plot or dialogue. In many respects it has a dull feel about it. For me it just wasn't that great and was actually more of a disappointment than anything else on this list.It was released theatrically in the late 70s but hasn't seen a film adaptation since.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous film score composer, Richard Meehan. He was about 18 at the start of the film. I have no idea why he went to such lengths to make friends with a child. It seems that this is another example of an artist turning a child into a commodity. The kid's face is so badly scrunched and craggy that it resembles a cross between a cartoon and a cartoon character. It was a good movie!

It 's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it 's either so good or so awful. This movie is a complete waste of money compared to other comedies in the genre that I see every day. A lot of people are disappointed with this movie and I agree but I guess there has to be some type of reward when one gets a really bad comedy like this.I don't know if I can call this a bad comedy but I will try to tell you what a stupid movie it was from start to finish.

I can't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten. To be honest, I saw the preview for this movie, and the premise looked intrigued me. Yes, I rented it after reading others' comments. They are correct in that some of the acting leaves a lot to be desired. They are also correct that one of the best performances of this movie was that of Dr. Graves.Also interesting is Scott Clark, who plays Grant, the kid in the wheelchair. I identify with the character he played, perhaps because I am in a wheelchair.This movie is certainly worth your looking at.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute family film and has some of the funniest songs on the soundtrack. It is not my favourite but that's about it. Wish I could see this movie every weekend because it looks really beautiful and the acting is great. Unfortunately, it can be quite difficult to see at times. I was hoping there would be more than one star in the cast but no, there are only 6. I've heard many comments from other people saying they wish they could see it.

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is out of its house when it's dark and there's no light in the room. No, if you really want to get down to just what makes this movie so funny, simply ask yourself a few questions:
1. Where were all the jokes made? 3. Why did they have to be jokes? 4. Why would anyone need to laugh at something so stupid? 5. If you didn't see the movie before, how can you watch it now without feeling like you should be crying?

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "murder mystery". This genre would become very popular in the 1970's and 1980's. Usually it would focus on a single murder/murder case or series of murders etc. The author would attempt to solve each individual case by coming up with a plausible theory which would then be proven true (or false), so there was more of a chance that the person actually did commit the crime, rather than simply trying to get their way.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 80's (I didn't know it had a title until later). Now, however, I don't know much about this movie other than its plot. I found this movie really boring to me. Not just the plot, but the movie itself. The characters were not interesting at all and it seemed that everyone in this movie was just there to entertain the audience. This film is just so over-acted and forced for the sake of what they are trying to pull off.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V. and came across this film. I don't ever remember seeing this or hearing of it. What a fun and interesting one to watch. Well, my meeting was pushed back, because I couldn't get out of this film. It had some real interesting things in it that marked it's time in history, and some fun things that they don't have people do in today's film because it's not pretty. Well, there was a lot of realism in it.

Believe it or not , the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once , and was missing for nearly two years. So this is a very important story to keep your eye on if you are one of those guys who doesn't believe everything that happens in movies. First off let me say that I don't really like 'fantasy' movies at all. It's so bad they suck, it's so dumb it has no redeeming qualities and the script is completely stupid. This movie wasn't even bad; there was nothing about this movie that made me want to get up and leave.

This movie has a lot to recommend it. The paintings, the music, and David Hewlett's naked butt are all gorgeous! The plot, a story of redemption, forgiveness, and courage in the face of adversity is also very interesting and touching -- and it's not predictable, which is saying quite a lot about a movie in this day and age. But, the acting is mediocre, the direction is confusing, and the script is just odd. It often felt like it was trying to be a parody, but I never figured out what it was trying to be parody *of*.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure if he should shoot him, as he can't understand his actions. He decides to kill him in a fit of jealousy and revenge, but will it actually work? This is another one of Elmer's greatest works - I have read it several times now and never thought it was going to disappoint. The only way this movie would ever fail is if it hadn't already succeeded (or failed badly).

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission, I can only look at this as a piece of entertainment. I started watching it too late in the evening (recorded from BBC2 earlier this year) but once I'd started I had to watch to the end.The down-side is that it's effectively a courtroom drama - never my favourite genre - but it's stunningly photographed (largely in super-saturated ochres) and well acted. Like a good novel, I couldn't put it down. All the way through, I wished I was watching it in a cinema to do the music and photography justice.

Our America is multi-cultural , with so many sub-cultures . This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time, without a lot of depth or understanding as to why any of those people are stuck there. As a child of the 1960s, I was always curious about how the movies were done and what was happening, and I still do that today. The main character is a beautiful girl (she's actually my favorite of all the female characters) who is kidnapped by an angry gang of men. She's forced to perform sex acts in exchange for money.

First of all - I'm not one to go all sappy over movies. I saw Friends in the 70's when it was first released. I was about 17 years old at the time. Even now, at age 50, I still can remember some of the scenes. The movie is sweet and sad and may actually be too tame for teenagers today but I loved it. The story is about innocence, the purity of young love and the determination of 2 young people to make a better life for themselves then they had at home.

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen did not quite know what to think. But then again, we have no idea what to think when a movie is based on such a traumatic event for so long. This film has everything you could want in a horror movie: creepy atmosphere, creepy locations, terrible music, disturbing stories and an awful ending. You will not believe it if you saw it.I cannot even imagine how much more horrible this film could have been if all those involved were less intelligent!

This movie was awesome, if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. This movie was great because it took the serious Robin Hood and made it something the whole family can enjoy and get a good laugh at. I first viewed this movie when i was around 10, and got most of it. This movie is also great because it makes fun of everything involved, "By order of the kings financial secretary H and R Blockhead? "Everyone needs a little Cary Elwes(Robin Hood)in life, whether or not its Liar Liar with the "Claw" or Saw.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday (4 February, 2006)and came away with a better understanding of what schizophrenia patients and their loved ones go through.Ms Aparna Sen must be congratulated for not only taking on a difficult subject, but also treating the mentally challenged with a deep understanding of their predicament that is necessary to help them cope with the trauma of disorientation, hallucinations and the storm of turmoil raging in their minds.We have had Hollywood movies on this subject such as "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" where Jack Nicholson carried away the honours.

This film , released in 1951 , has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50 's. A group of soldiers are sent into battle to save an American who's been taken prisoner by the Vietcong. As the soldiers move towards the enemy, one soldier is shot and killed. I can't believe that this film got made back then. I remember when I was younger, a bunch of us were excited for "the west", but it took me quite a while to get around to really watching it.

Just see it ! It 's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time . See it for example on youtube
A very bad movie with a horrible screenplay by David Gordon Green and a stupid acting team. You can not even tell what's going on at all because of the script that was written by one of the worst actors I have ever seen in my life, Joe Keatinge!!! He has zero acting experience and he takes himself too seriously. There were so many things wrong with this movie! I watched it two nights ago and it was a complete disaster!

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield . The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor (Ralph Fiennes) who goes crazy after his family's car breaks down, and ends up being possessed by the Devil. How I'm Gonna Get By : One of my favorite films ever, and yet in spite of its flaws it remains a great film, so I went for it as soon as I found this one online. It takes place in 1960s San Francisco, but the only characters I cared about at that point were Jerry Seinfeld and Tom Cruise.

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just a bunch of old stuff from the 1940s. Anyway, the story is pretty good as you think it would be and the movie doesn't really give too much of a clue what's coming next. I had no idea where to start with this movie. I watched it when it was on television at a friend's birthday party and it brought tears to my eyes. The reason why I thought this movie was bad was because it was boring.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction . This is what today 's documentaries are all about . It has to be seen before you can judge it for yourself. In fact, I'm surprised that it still gets a second viewing every ten years or so. When i first saw this movie I did not understand what the fuss was about, because there were so many inaccuracies in it but after watching it my mind just started making logical and reasonable explanations. For example one of the main characters says she's going to go to hell, why would she do that when she could stay with her mother?

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . The story involves an Indian chief living in rural California who has the opportunity to acquire a new buffalo, but decides to use that as a human sacrifice. A wonderful piece of art. I don't normally post reviews, but this one is absolutely fantastic. I can't explain how it feels to me to watch these movies over and over again for hours. They just seem to be about every genre you could imagine, from comedy to horror to epic fantasy to science fiction.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band 's 30 year career . Lee , John, Phil and Bill were in fine form throughout the entire show as well. This show was just too good to put down. It would've been nice if they had gone into a little bit more depth about what went down on this night. I'm glad that there's a new album. But you know what? I'll skip the new album and listen to the actual version of it for a while. "I'm sorry, I can't find your website!

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest , most clever , sharp-witted , sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I 've seen. And for someone so passionate about the show, I couldn't blame him for being annoyed that this was not the case. As a child growing up in the 1970's, I remember having an interest in science fiction and comic books . I still remember reading all manner of books about alien abductions and aliens living among humans (in particular those by Jack London ) and then watching The Twilight Zone or Deep Throat movies on my favorite VCR.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it . What a movie . I am going to give you my reasons for liking it but firstly, because I had just come back from the UK where I had done research for a book about Irish people during WW2 . I can tell you that there were some great performances throughout and that the cast is very varied. However, the writing style of this film seemed to suggest that there was little effort being made to inform the audience of any of the major events occurring in Ireland during this period .

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. While the plot is a little clunker and the characters don't have any depth, the production values are very good for a low budget action/drama thriller film. In terms of acting quality, it's as good as you're going to see in a Hollywood blockbuster. You can really tell that they just wanted to get some quick cash and not try to create a lasting legacy. This was one of those films where someone at Universal thought: "Well, at least there'll be something left."

Fata Morgana is, by far, one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. I hesitate to call it a documentary because, while is does have elements of documentation of it's images, the images themselves are so unusual, so hallucinogenic, so unclear, that I wonder whether it was really worth telling this story just so that these images can exist. The film basically is the tale of the earth and the creation of the earth shot from the perspective of an outsider, be it alien or something otherwise indescribable, all taking place in the Sahara desert.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against the invading Northern army led by Major J.B. MORGAN. Although General SULLIVAN has made peace with the North, he still holds grudges over what he calls an "incontrovertible treason" committed during the Civil War. As the battle rages on across the countryside, Spanky and his troops are forced to flee once again. Only this time, as they make their way through the dense forest, they find that they've become a target of the Confederate Army.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances . I just read a user comment concerning the bad acting. It is true what they say, all of the actors were great in this movie but none of them were memorable. I had to take off 2 stars from this review only because I could not see why anyone would feel comfortable giving this movie one star. I've been a lifelong fan of the X-Men (the first comic books) and Marvel films. I'm also a big fan of the "Deadpool" movie franchise and the "Thor" movie franchise.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this. I have been searching for it for a long time to show my daughter to show her and i can not find it anywhere. probably because it was only on video and they never made the DVD or VHS or idk.i saw this right off Disney back in 1996 and i think it would be the best video to show her. such a good movie that has every type of emotion displayed throughout the whole movie. also has a lot of actors that started their careers with this movie.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe the movie should have made up a plot or two. But in any case, after seeing this movie, I don't know how to describe my feelings for it. I watched it for the first time with one of my best friends who recently graduated high school. After that, we just couldn't get into it. Why? Because it wasn't funny. What a disappointment. I've been a fan of the show since the beginning and was looking forward to finally getting to see it again.

'The Cell ' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally . The characters are pathetic, there is no chemistry whatsoever between the two leads, and the script itself is riddled with errors. There is a plot device here or there that will work at least until you discover how to actually watch the film. This film is not without its strengths, but one has to ask themselves "How bad could this movie be?" After watching it for about an hour and a half, I am convinced that I had wasted my time.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways . It is a non stop plethora of emotion and it makes you want to cry even more. I've never heard of "Beverly Hills Cop 2", but I think I've seen it somewhere, maybe on some cable channel. A couple of other people did the same , so it could be true. This one's not bad either...not bad at all. But let's look at the trailer first. What does that have to do with anything? Are we really seeing a new story?

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had its strong points.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie . My teen-agers enjoyed it over the past years so I figured they would enjoy this as well but what a disappointment!! I watched this in the late 70's because I love to read. I don't understand why anyone should watch this movie except people who can't read (like myself). Not only that, the main character spends all night talking about his plans of how he will "make war on America" and "take out" the entire government by using nuclear weapons.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment . This movie does not give an objective account of events. It does not tell you why they are happening. I can't say this was a pleasant experience, but I had a fairly good time with the movie. After watching the first two parts (which I will discuss later) we were given the chance to have a look back on what was going on behind the scenes. The movie began innocently enough: We saw some people playing chess while a man appeared from his window and said something incomprehensible.

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. I do wish there would have been some more action sequences.The writing was on the wall of being terrible as they say in the business. However, I found myself smiling just thinking about something that I can't see. I think it would have made for a pretty funny flick, but couldn't bring myself to buy it. One of my favorite documentaries ever! There's a scene that shows a woman who has her legs broken walking into a supermarket wearing only a dress and an orange tshirt.

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we 're in a bigger hole than ever . That 's because the American people think that the only thing they should care about is their jobs, as if it makes them any more patriotic. In fact, this is exactly what has caused so much misery in this country." The "American people" didn't even bother to look for an alternative candidate who was far more pro-war than Romney. Why are the American people now so enamored with a candidate who never served in the army or even had anything remotely military experience?

`` The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends , '' says Marion Fairlie , who with her husband and child was in bed. 'What did we ever do to him that would make him think I was his mistress?' she wonders. 'The Devil's Knot'' is not a great story. You have no idea, except you can't care about anyone or anything. There are so many things that could have been interesting but didn't. The main character is pretty dull (even for the low budget film) and has no reason to be engaging.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece. It's Werner Herzog's most unconventional film. It doesn't have a plot or story. Instead of a story, we're given a collection of images, words and music that work so wonderfully together. It's not a documentary either. Some of the people in this film are directed and given lines to read. It has some of the most beautiful and haunting images. Herzog shoots real mirages and we see cars and people floating around in the middle of the desert who aren't actually there but hundreds of miles away reflected like in a mirror.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come close to doing it justice so if you haven't seen the movie, please find it and stop watching. I still don't know where the money went, nor who or what they even thought they were making in it. The script has some really awful lines which didn't play with me at all. If you are a fan of "Babes in the Dark" and want more than that, go out and pick up this movie.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow. We don't usually warm up to a series until they are almost at the end of their production life. In this case, we didn't start watching KoQs until almost the 6th season. I'm not sure how it escaped our radar for so long. Other than the fact that we are not big fans of "appointment" TV viewing. Our schedules our such that we don't like to commit to watching series every time they come on (and we didn't have a DVR yet).

I 'm seen this documentary in its feature-form , in a movie theatre . And ... wouah ! The pictures are stunning! If it could have been made anywhere else...it would have been wonderful. But when it was made, it really felt like the producers were making up a story for a TV movie. I don't know about you, but I'd prefer if people didn't watch movies they're excited about (i.e. an old school sci-fi thriller).This isn't one of my favourite films, because there is something so flat and boring about it that it's hard to care.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox's reluctance to release a full screen restored version in DVD. Yes, the history may be a bit inaccurate and it is certainly not as powerful as the book, BUT it was the 2nd film by Fox made in Real Cinemascope and the production values alone merit a restoration and distribution. I saw this film in second grade and it triggered my lifelong interest in all things Egyptian, culminating in my visiting Egypt 4 years ago! Amazing the power of film on a child's imagination, eh?

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world as secretaries. This follows the same idea as THREE COINS IN A FOUNTAIN a few years before. This takes place in New York while COINS takes place in Rome, Italy. Our three beauties are Hope Lange, in her first starring role, Suzy Parker and Diane Baker. Lange does well and holds her own opposite some strong veterans in the business, namely Joan Crawford. Suzy plays an obsessive woman who has a hard time losing her beau.

This was a pretty good episode . Though no `` Trapped in the Closet '' or `` Cartoon Wars , they did manage to find some good laughs throughout, but it was too much of a departure for me to go into full detail.I loved every second of this show except one. I didn't know how it ended, nor did I care because the ending just made it seem that the main plot was over. I was so happy watching this show! The acting was great, and there was a lot of interesting dialogue. The cast was amazingly well done.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16. Now the daughter is 16 (in season 1) and they live like sisters. Sharing everything, trusting each other completely.I like The Gilmore Girls but I am not sure why. The mother, named Lorelai (Lauren Graham), and the daughter, named Rory (short for Lorelai, played by Alexis Bledel), are both very beautiful women, they are both funny and they are charming in their own ways. There are some funny supporting characters, such as Luke (Scott Patterson).

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . In my opinion they missed the boat a bit.I am a fan of these films . I would never have bought this movie if it was not for the fact that I wanted to see what happens with the "dogmas" in the future. This has little to nothing to do with the original Dogma story, and there is absolutely no reason why the storyline should continue. If you don't think this is a bad film, just wait till you go to your local theater and watch it.

Sweeping drama with great sets , costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett , Scarlett , Melanie and the rest to make for a film that is, in retrospect, far from "good". The plot involves a former British spy who comes to the US to work for the CIA, eventually landing a job on a secret government project, only to have his life changed when he ends up being turned over to the Russians.It has its flaws, but even if these weren't the point of the film, I can see how it would be a decent thriller.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait for local channels and TV channels that are on the PBS channel. I love it! I bought this DVD because my brother was going to buy the original "American Psycho" (which came out in the early 90s). I thought the film was interesting and scary, and would give it a try. Not so much. The plot didn't add anything new to the story--the whole thing was predictable.

North and South is a miniseries from the "golden age" of television miniseries in the 1980s, which was a time for long, sweeping epics with high production values and lots of star cameos. It is, for the most part, excellent for what it is, although I personally prefer the less soap-opera like elements of the story and the overall sense of history.James Read and Patrick Swayze deliver excellent performances--especially Read, whose George Hazard serves as kind of an emotional anchor in the midst of the often melodramatic story.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16 . Now the daughter is dead of a heroin overdose. And the mother has to raise her daughter alone, without being loved by other adults.The first two episodes of this season were fantastic. There are some good scenes with Lorelai and Rory that made it all worth watching. But in the third episode, we really felt like we could have gone on for hours. We're talking about three or four decent episodes here. I've just found out my wife's favorite movie is Gone with the Wind.

Although dated , this film is definitely worth a watch . I saw it about eight times as a teenager and was absolutely hooked by the premise. However, it doesn't do much at all to justify the name "Cinderella". It has far worse effects than an actual fairy tale. I was in my mid-thirties when I first saw this movie. To be completely fair, it isn't for everyone. But if you are looking for a fun night's entertainment on one of those lonely nights out with your buddies, then this might be a good choice.

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the cast (and the director) are utterly incoherent. They know that the whole idea is stupid, they want to kill someone and then laugh as they walk away. Then there's the plot. There's nothing going on in this thing, except the fact that it's totally unnecessary. So if you like comedies, you must have an opinion on this comedy. If you don't, you must be some kind of fool! It's got nothing to do with reality at all.

I 've seen 'nurse betty ' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea ' - this time she went to visit her father for Christmas. He had died two days before, and he left her at his place with a big bag of sweets. It seems as though there is a huge gap between movies where they make money (i.e. comedies) and movies where they can't. I mean, we all know that Disney made some terrible movies like The Jungle Book , so what else do they need? They don't need movie-makers who actually have skills.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

If there's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other, It's Gerald McBoing-Boing. This tale of a little boy who only speaks in sound effects has kept its charm for the last 57 years. Besides the effects, loved the music, the abstract animation and backgrounds, the narration by Marvin Miller, pretty much everything. And it won the Oscar for Best Animated Short of 1950. Glad to have seen it on YouTube after reading about this Dr. Seuss story for so many years. And Rocky and Bullwinkle creator Bill Scott also contributed, how awesome!

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies, along with Spaceballs(although I will openly admit to not having watched many others, at least yet). It's very silly and thoroughly funny, there are hardly more than a few minutes throughout the entire two hour run-time, where you aren't entertained. Almost all of the gags have a great comical effect, few of them fall flat. I saw this movie right after seeing and reviewing Spy Hard, and comparing these two spoof movies, I realize exactly of how high quality this movie really is.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies , and this is actually the second time in my life I'm really looking forward to it, as I thought it would be some kind of bad thing (the first one was The Man Who Fell to Earth ) when it came out. But anyway - let's take a quick look back at those few episodes that made me smile :-). I saw this film while watching a Finnish TV show. Although it didn't really fit with what we know about Finland, it certainly gave me the impression that they were doing good work.

There's a brand new killer on the loose, and he's doing God's work. Yeah right! This killer makes Jason Voorhes look like a chump, and Freddy Krueger look like a rag doll against this dude. He is Jacob Goodnight(WWE's Glen "KANE" Jacobs), a 7' monster who wields a Axe, and a hook and chain. Those weapons are nothing to him his real finisher is ripping out eyeballs from the victims sockets. That is totally methodical! When the encounter happened 4 years earlier, Jacob killed a rookie cop and maimed the veteran after putting a bullet in his head.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film . The backwoods slasher pretty much started in 1994 and by 2001, we had seen two sequels (including one featuring the original) and yet, it wasn't until the movie's fourth entry that it was finally picked up for theatrical release in the US. I would say it was a flop for American audiences, especially considering how successful the franchise was at Europe.The plot revolves around a woman named Jill who is taken in by an Irish couple and raised as their adopted daughter.

I 'm a fan of independent film . Dialogue driven , character study pieces are where it 's at for me. But I cannot wait to see when they start shooting with this new cast, as I can only hope they will be able to complete all of their characters. First of all the acting was good but that didn t make up for the horrible plot (which is actually very well paced) and the bad script which could not be adapted into a coherent story (i.e., the movie does not go anywhere in the end).

Ok , maybe Posse ca n't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies . But that 's because it did n't have a good plot line at all. The best I ever saw in a western was "Reno, Nevada". This is a great movie and could be a great series but its not really worth my time or effort. The only interesting aspect of this movie is that it has a lot of guns so you could probably make an interesting story out of it. What about the fact that most of the guns are fake (I don't know where they came up with this idea) ?

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we're in a bigger hole than ever. That's right, so all those flag wavers who were so sure of the right and might of the American way are now chasing their tails, isn't that true? You bet it is. This movie said so from the beginning. It is kind of freaky how much the film,or should I say, filmmaker, knew what was coming. It is almost like going to a fortune teller and hearing what was going to happen in the future.

I 'll be brief : I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that gets a little sickening. A bunch of kids in their school's history book are suddenly thrown together, with no explanation or explanation at all. From the beginning, they're going to be a team. They know each other by heart, and when they get on the same team, they fight for each other! And...what happens next? It really isn't what it looks like. The only real redeeming quality about this film is the script.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the cliché cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

I had always heard about this great mini-series , but viewed it for the first time this week , July 24, I couldn't stop seeing it ! It has a story about an ordinary teenager who goes out with his friends to play basketball in a city that doesn't have much of a basketball culture. After a few months, they find themselves living with their new neighbors (who are also from the same city), after all there is no chance of them staying together.This movie made me realize why I'm not too thrilled with the movies on this site so far!

I love to see a female protagonist , in this movie her name was Rose . Rose brought out a whole side of her and it made me laugh the whole time. I always felt sorry for her. It was so bad when she lost her eyesight. First of all I must say that i really wanted to love this movie but i think i can't be happy about this movie. It was so bad, it was so boring. You know why i hate this movies, they do not make you feel what i am going through, because i can tell how bad it is coming from the plot.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails . Because it was a little picture , John Ford's production staff did a lot of wonderful stuff that no one will ever see. It is easy for me to criticize this film, because there are far too many elements that I find to be disappointing. However, since I've already written a fair share of my opinion, I'm going to give it the benefit of the doubt. For starters, I won't waste any time and effort here, as I don't even want to write another negative review.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school championship game where she is given the title of "Won't You Please Forget Me". She is cast in the role because her parents are going to be away for two weeks (a long time after the movie was made) but it's really not that complicated. First off I want to preface this post with a warning: I'm a HUGE fan of this movie. I watched it as early as I could and have seen it several times.

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood, even if you had to make it all up on the spot, I can't see how this film isn't an absolutely amazing masterpiece. This film has not disappointed at all. Its premise seems simple enough, but the acting, editing, directing, script and cinematography are more than beyond belief. Even without spoiling anything, you could feel every moment as if you were watching another film made by a professional.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker . This is the only flick that I know of on DVD that doesn't have an IMDb page, but for whatever reason they forgot to update it there. The kicker is absolutely stupid. First of all, why would anyone buy this movie? I didn't see anything at all good about this movie so I'm going to be very honest with you...I thought it was a crap flick. It had no redeeming qualities in either plot or acting. So I gave it one star instead of two.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surface level. The movie takes place in 1930s New York (or even early 1950s New Orleans, which was more realistic and less like a war zone) and is mainly set during World War II. It is one of the few WWII films not filmed with actual military vehicles on the sets, so it doesn't seem realistic at all. I really want to like this movie. After watching the trailers and talking about how great it was coming into this movie, I was quite excited when it came out.

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

The four signs on the road say "If You're Looking For Fun.....You Don't Need A Reason....All You Need Is A Gun....It's Rabbit Season! "In the woods, we see hundreds of "Rabbit Season" signs posted on every tree. We see more and more signs pointing exactly to Bugs Bunny's hole. Who's putting up all these signs? Daffy Duck!Daffy puts the last sign up, tiptoes away and says to us, the audience, "Awfully unsporting of me, I know.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars! I really don't care what people can say badly about this movie...because it's a really well played parts from Samuel L. Jackson, and mainly by Christina Ricci!! I'm a big fan of hers, right since I saw her in Addams Family...been trying to watch all things she makes, and this is absolutely one of the best parts she played!! I love her looks (even though people say she's not pretty...I think she is...and I love her eyes)!!

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of this book. I would have given a five-star rating if I were able to understand why it was even recommended in the first place. It is hard to write anything negative about a book when there are two or more great reviews of it. I am not one of those critics who don't give a second thought to the writing, plot or characterization of the books. Unfortunately, this review really isn't going to do much for me, either.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. If you like you murders, to be signature and serial, and your cops to be British, and shout a lot, and the gore to be bloody and have a religious slant then this hits every button. Not quite enough 'gov'ing to put the shouting into the Sweeney's rarefied heights, but otherwise highly rated. Ken Stott is excellent as the 'cop on the edge' and the guest stars are also well cast, including Edward Woodward and Art Malik. Recommended.
