In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

I haven't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater, and I have been searching for it since. At the time I was 12 and the story excited me; and NOW, the ending eludes me. It was young love that engrossed me the most, not to mention John's vocals and Taupin's lyrics. The story (at the time) hit home to my psyche. I am a lover of sentimental movies and this still hangs in my head after 35 years- it is that good. Place yourself at adolescent age and let your fantasies run.

Sure, it has its pretentious moments, it plays like art-house, live-action Fantasia, but it also has moments of deep beauty and humor. Omnibus films are always a problem, but I have always had a keen interest in them. I will now rate the segments individually.Nicolas Roeg - "Un ballo in maschera" - This segment may very well spoil the film for some people, because it is absolutely the worst of the whole bunch. It is difficult to follow, mostly because it tries to adhere to a clear plot (a hackneyed one, at that).

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant and repetitive violence. The first two minutes were pretty funny, mainly because we get a glimpse at what the movie was going for, but after that, it kind of starts to look boring. There was little suspense, no suspense. The story is about a boy who wants to go to war with the Soviets in Afghanistan. His parents are very concerned about him and want to find something to help him make his plan work.

This one started excellently . The photography and audio are the best I 've experienced in years ( okay , but not a great film). But the script was bad. I watched this movie for about 90 mins and my first thought was, wow. How stupid is this movie? Do I know what they're talking about? They didn't even bother with any plot, it just seemed random. And that's the problem with films. There isn't really much plot to begin with, no action, nothing. All you care about is trying to keep yourself entertained at the same time.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17. The only good thing my father ever did (get us in). This is "our movie" and the music is "our songs". Michelle's song is "our" song. Yeah, nowadays, it's a crime to show naked children on the screen, but we were screwing at 16, why not these kids? The movie is- rich boy impregnates poor girl, then rich dad steals him away from her at the end, after she gives birth under impoverished conditions. She is left alone with child.

In dramatising Wilde 's novel , John Osborne has condensed events , eliminated a number of characters , and generally acted as if nothing happened at all .The film is still the same. There is a very brief but important scene in which the main character is trying to explain why they are being attacked. He does this in order to try and make them understand how bad it is for the humans to kill each other. However, he ends up making things worse when he tells them that there were two people inside the room killing each other.

My favorite film this year . Great characters and plot , and the direction and editing was smooth , visually. If you like a story with strong action, this movie will do for you. I had no problem with watching "The Mummy," but in all honesty I couldn't believe how much my parents hated it. I didn't even see the opening credits on TV, or at least I waited till the last second of the film before watching them. There were times when I was so overcome by terror and fear that I kept my eye on the camera to get a better look at it.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film 's lead-in song 'I Feel It Coming' where he sings: "If you're going to see me

I'll have to wait and see how far I'll go till I've gotten it right"

And this is his reply after being told about that track by Steve McQueen: "Yes, I thought I'd heard it all! And I wasn't wrong. I'm so glad it made it in!"

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / didn't understand this wonderful film. What a sad life he must lead!This movie has more to say about life and relationships than most I've ever seen, yet it's not dark or preachy like the "ordinary people" type of film. It is mostly humorous, though not technically a comedy.The whole thing feels a little like a fantasy, perhaps Shakespear's "Midsummer Nights' Dream." Beautiful, intelligent women abound, with wonderful cinematography and a non-insulting screenplay that doesn't miss a beat.I look forward to seeing it every time this film is re-run on cable.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen(mostly in English). In the earlier film she treated a contemporary political environment and its effect on individuals. In this film it is the impact of mentally disabled member of the family and its impact on the family. As a parallel sub theme she treats a philosophical concept on "reality". It is a film which leads to thinking after seeing the film.Mithee the younger sister (Konkana Sen Sharma, the daughter of Aparna Sen) is suffering from Schizophrenia being taken care of by the dominant elder sister Anjali (Shabana Azmi) .

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because i was very impressed by how many shows are being produced here. The cast is great, there's lots of laughs in the beginning, but eventually the comedy comes to a head. There is also a tendency for certain characters to get snarkier and not quite funny. I found it amusing to watch every episode with no clue as to who the punch line or joke was. I didn't care that it wasn't funny; if this were a sitcom, you'd expect it to come off as cliche.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome ; more bloodshed and very graphic details ( a bit too much gore in fact). If you don't like gore, then this isn't for you. The only thing that I was really worried about going into this film was how bad it would be with all the terrible actors involved. Unfortunately, this did not prove to be an issue. There was quite a lot of carnage, but nothing that truly shocked or made me feel scared. It just felt cheap and unoriginal. The acting was good, but the plot was weak.

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , ``This was a tough script. And there was too much of it in the movie.'' then you should be all right. What I did not like was the ending.The first 2 or 3 minutes were hard to watch, but the third minute made me laugh so hard that I actually laughed out loud.It ended with one of the most annoying and clichéd sequences i have seen in my 30+ years of trying to work on a movie.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just laughing at how lame this is. It's funny, but it really doesn't add much value to the story. I don't recommend watching this movie unless you can stomach a laugh. The only reason I gave it a three was that I had been watching "Cabaret" on Netflix, which I did. This movie is simply awful. This is one of the worst animated films I own, ever.

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that's been released lately. It was funny, but it also had many touching moments. Zellwegger, Freeman, Rock, Kinnear, & the rest of the cast made their incredibly weird characters seem real. The story took such twist & turns that made it incredibly enjoyable to watch. If you're sick of the recent formula movies, see Nurse Betty for something completely different. Go see this movie in the theater or at least rent it when it comes out!

Come on . Anyone who does n't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic's watch list for no good reason, unless of course they are too lazy to search out an original or even a rip off! I have seen many cartoons and I cannot remember one which made me more excited to see it come to television. There was something so different about this particular piece of animation that I was eager to see it in my living room. The story was compelling and the production values were excellent.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the late 70s and early 80s. The story is based on the novel, written and directed by Alfred Hitchcock . I'll explain in a few paragraphs why I like this movie and why I feel it doesn't have any depth. For the sake of being more specific, I've chosen "The Road" as the title (not because of Hitchcock's reputation among horror fans; that's ridiculous). It's been a long time since we have had a new Steven King film.

I couldn't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character. I laughed for days just thinking about this show. Having finally seen the pilot I guess I will stick around for a few more episodes. Assy is pretty funny and the whole crew of police show characters are around, but Assy is hard to understand and that was a little frustrating. Most of the humor revolves around the fact that the title character is literally a walking ass with nothing else but legs that sport socks with garters and feet with traditional wing tips.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It has a documentary-like feel to it as it traces the journey West of a party of Mormons and it may be the most authentic looking of all Ford's films, (it's on par with "The Sun Shines Bright" which he made a couple of years later).There is a plot of sorts, (a group of bank robbers join the wagon train at one point), but the film's dramatic highlights are almost incidental.

I loved this movie! OH MY GOSH! This movie rocked so hard! I found it amongst some old tapes and didn't know what it was and after having read the back of the cover to see what the summer had to say about it (Which btw, mentioned the fact that Elton John covered the soundtrack for the film more times than it mentioned what the film was actually about. ), I thought it sounded interesting, and I was even more interested in seeing it because it was an older film. "What controversy?"

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd' expect from an actual horror film. However, I would suggest watching it without subtitles if you'd like to find out what the hell was going on. In this one there were only a handful of shots and the direction was poor. If you've been to a horror fest you'll know what I'm talking about. It really felt like something that was filmed for a TV show instead of a horror flick.

Personally, I regard "The Egyptian" in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Australian movie commenter & critic named Bill who was renowned for his insight & broad vision of people & places & particularly of films. This movie fitted the Bill perfectly & I came to appreciate his commentary & enthusiasm for this movie that emerged all the more as I watched it, as I was literally drawn into it, minute by minute, beyond his introductory comments, on my initial viewing many years ago.To me, it was propelled, layer upon layer, within half an hour, into an intriguing & fascinating production!

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made , `` Murder in the Music Hall '' seems to have undeservably tarnished its already tarnished reputations. But, of course, that isn't what this film is about: it is about how an awful tragedy was caused by the stupidity and lack of preparation of a band who had only a few weeks of rehearsal before they went on stage during a live performance. "I didn't want to believe anything I heard or saw at the house. We weren't planning anything special."

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters.I came across it while switching TV channels and was immediately engrossed in this story of an aging rodeo bum whose recklessness and lack of responsibility hurt everyone around him. I've often wanted to see the movie again but couldn't even remember its name, and have never seen it in the rental stores.James Coburn and Slim Pickens were excellent in their roles, and the rodeo footage was first rate. While being an action movie and having a western setting and theme it could be enjoyed by anyone regardless of their taste in films.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer , his secretary passes along a letter from him, asking for his advice about the play. The producer tells the director to get on with it and that the script should be finished within one week or the production would be cancelled. He also states that he could never work in such conditions again. A young man receives a copy of 'The Man With No Name' - an obscure novel by Robert Louis Stevenson (1925).

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger, and I really remember liking it. However, I didn't have great taste back then (not to say that I do now) so I can't vouch for my nine-year-old self too well. The movie was probably a 7/10 but it had some good music so I gave it an extra point. Yeah, worth watching. I know that some fans of this movie are wondering what a certain song is - the one that appears when she is in the car crash.

See No Evil With Kane . The Movie Has a great storyline But it just was n't a Hide my Ass movie... It was one of the worst movies i've ever seen and i feel sorry for the film makers who were trying their very best but couldn't keep the film from making some poor choices with its themes. I can't imagine what it's like to be a teenage girl watching such a poorly acted movie. As someone who went to see this, I'm not sure I'd call myself a fan of the script.

"Jaded" takes on the complex question of abuse: the perpetrators and the victims. In lesser hands it would have degenerated into an erotic thriller made for direct-to-video. This director, however, has managed to pull off a textured multi-layered study with a decidedly different point of view.Given the fact that the director/writer is a woman and the main detective and D.A. are also women, this could have turned into a very anti-male film. It is not. To be a sexual predator IS gender neutral. The nudity of this film is not erotic. The rape is brutal not sexual.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn more about each other and the realities of life in general. If you love a good war film this is the one. There are plenty of scenes of death and destruction here that I have forgotten about (but I'm sure they do get old eventually) but when it comes to the people involved it's all right. It's really hard to judge from what I was watching because so many people died or had their lives torn apart.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland , and it is one of those rare moments where the animation doesn't bother me, or at least doesn't distract me from having to look at it. In my view it is just a cheap gimmick that does not give enough substance to an otherwise good piece of filmmaking. The plot is laughable, particularly when taken at face value. I'll admit I watched it thinking "What? That was supposed to be so funny?"

Based on Mika Waltari's Book,This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color,beautiful music and panoramic spectacle.The Plot sometimes gets muddled in contrite wording,But all in all it has a strong social content:Man is ruled by his emotions,and that every action has an equal consequence.But to truly enjoy this film,First see the movie,then read the book.Although different,it sheds light on a whole lot of things that were not seen on the screen,and gives breath to some more of the depth of Sinuhe.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

This is the best movie I have ever seen . It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. The acting is always good and the plot is clever. The main character of this story is a little kid who gets his first job on a ship. Unfortunately he doesn't make it beyond the first few minutes because of his horrible temper, which he usually uses to torment his co-workers. There are moments when he comes close to being funny (and there was one moment during the movie that really got me going). Most of the action takes place on the decks of the ship.

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 star rating it's got on IMDb.First, the story itself is kind of crappy; if you haven't watched it yet, do so. It doesn't help that there is literally no reason for this plot at all. This film is more of a slapstick comedy sketch, where the hero tries to be "realistic" (which means trying to act like him/herself) and they fail miserably. Well... i'll try my best to be honest.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are searching for gold. They soon become enamored with each other and begin a romantic relationship which goes terribly wrong. The whole movie has to be pretty bad. The acting is terrible, the scenes are cheesy, there is none of the drama that I would normally associate with a Disney movie (I know, you're probably thinking: "Well, that's why they make all these movies! It just isn't that kind of film."

As I was reading through the comments , I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was just bad. So let me say it again : This movie is a waste of time. Why? Because it does not do anything at all. First of all what are you going to call this movie? It's called "Deadman Walking" (or whatever you call it now). The rest of the film, which consists of four short scenes, has no depth or substance whatsoever.The story is very simple - a serial killer breaks into a house and kills every living soul he meets.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets were made from scratch? "I have no idea how a woman with glasses could look this good. And then I saw this, and everything started to make sense. I just knew that she was going to be one of the best actors I've ever worked with, even if it is her first major feature-length film." Well, it's been ten years since my last review of this stupid crap.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta , they went over there looking for something to watch but no one was allowed into the house. My friend and I were at a show in Charlotte (just off of Route 1) when we heard a big sound that sounded like a door opening and closing, followed by a weird noise and then screaming. The whole thing lasted about 15 minutes. When we got outside and saw what was happening we all ran inside to avoid running into people trying to help.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

`5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters, stories of war, drag queens, kangaroos and koalas, and Australians in general being represented as nitwits living off the land, saying words like cobber' and generally being the classic underdog.Luckily Australian film has evolved over the last couple years and is churning out modern day classics' such as Blackrock, Moulin Rouge, Chopper, Yolngu Boy and Sample People.In this evolution of film we also find Two Hands.Set in Sydney's Kings Cross, Two Hands is a black comedy about crime and survival in the rough end of town.

It 's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand it's got a great premise that manages to be utterly bizarre and nonsensical, while still managing to manage to be hilarious. The most obvious clue is that the title is "Auschwitz". It's also probably the least original thing about the film (it all seems to have happened before), although I guess if you're going to write such an incomprehensible mess of a story, at least start off with something less ridiculous.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult. To say that is even an understatement. My sister, brother and I watched it one year at our grandparents' house during Christmas vacation. They had taped it from TV. Our parents were glad it kept us occupied for the one night but they thought we would tire of it and be ready for outdoor activities the next day. Not so! We became mesmerized. They could not have unglued us if they tried. It became a cherished yearly tradition.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It had so much potential . But after three seasons, I don't think there will ever be another film or TV show as good as this . This show is just so overrated , and I hate to say this but it's almost hard not to root for people who couldn't get away with even worse. The story revolves around two teenage boys in Chicago. They've been adopted from South America and spent their whole lives trying to live up to the white trash stereotypes of "the rich kid".

I saw it in Europe-plex. Great movie!! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Flesh in modern times. Protagonist Jim Kirk, drives an unwieldy RV across America, stopping often to fill his gas-guzzling tank. He is middle-aged and confused . He fuels his thick, diabetic body with cups of coffee and radio chatter. He is the Flesh: agitated and sometimes spaced out, fairly oblivious to the growing tension around him but feeling it as twinges of discomfort. The Spirit suffuses the film through speeches and other sounds, as well as what appears and goes by in the visual field.

Unlike some of the former commentators, I was (and am) an avid fan of the Carpenters. Face it, Christmas would never be Christmas without The Carpenters. That said, I believe the movie did a good, not excellent, job at depicting Karen's life. The movie was enjoyable to see on primetime TV, but the content fell a little short. I suggest that you all look into getting some of the Carpenters specials that were shown in the 70's. You cannot believe how awesome a drummer Karen was. Cynthia did not capture the extent of Karen's talent.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year. It seemed to be going through a few phases at one point where the cast and crew were losing touch with reality and making outlandish claims in order to make the audience believe that something horrible happened. I went to see this film on a Saturday night with my brother and his girlfriend. We were sitting in the middle of the room, but there is no way that we couldn't have been able to find someone else to sit with.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to shoot him with a gun. Unfortunately, no such gun is available in the home he's living in at that time. While this was released on VHS, it has been recently remixed into DVD and I have never seen this movie! I don't know why anyone would even think to put this crap on any DVD/Blu-ray, but apparently there's lots of money in getting rid of it. I guess they just couldn't see how popular it would be as a kids show or something.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teenaged women have to survive on the floor of their room. One woman tries to sleep, another gets raped by a man who tries to keep her from sleeping.The main problem with this movie is the ending. "I don't mean to be so rude but seriously, why did you put it on Netflix? The original was pretty good and I thought it had some depth to it. Now that it isn't as good there's really nothing to complain about.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat , but as the film progresses, it turns into a slow crawl. There are times where Buckwheat makes no sense at all (which really annoys me), but the story was just terrible to begin with. I've recently seen a lot of "spice films" which are just plain boring. I can't understand anyone who would make them, especially not one made by a major production company such as Sony Pictures Home Entertainment. It's like trying to describe the entire movie "Cocaine Man".

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist , I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out in the cinema. The director and producer are always looking over my shoulder for some flaw, but never find it. This was the first time I've been disappointed by a movie because of its production. It's just awful. I'm a sucker for comedies. If you're lucky enough to get one, make sure it has a really bad script. You won't like it. The best comedies are ones where you get to know the characters before they get involved with their big plot points.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice and once was a complete bust . It seems like they cut out anything that might have been an offensive word or even something that would cause trouble. The only thing that made it worth seeing was the fight scene at the very end.I had a hard time keeping track of how long the whole movie actually took to make. As I thought it was just a short fight scene between these two "baboons" with no serious storyline , I kept going back to see which one was better.

There are many film now on DVD, but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers. The Egyptian, along with El Cid and other favorites of the era of the wide screen, big budget epics had merit. Many people from my generation learn a lot about history of Egypt, medieval Spain and even the Incas, (The first time I heard from them was a very cheap adventure movie with Charlton Heston called The Treasure of the Incas), same happened to me with Egypt, or Rome seen many "bad" epics of the era.

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a genius, but beyond. I was so enthused and entertained watching this that I actually got through the whole thing in about 25 minutes or so. As it turned out, my brain had been tricked into believing the whole thing was going to be made into a film (which it wasn't), since I could hardly see the plot point. I can't begin to guess how many hours have gone into making this movie.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships , 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the cast were mostly women, and there was no way to tell whether or not the lead actress was a female or an American. I didn't read anything about this movie. But I did look at the reviews for it and realized that while the plot isn't very interesting, the actors do a good job acting out what would be expected of people in that situation. I can't really give them any bad reviews since they seem like normal people.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment ! It is an energetic dance/salsa show, full of great performances and hilarious stories. I watched it on VH1 in the 80's with some friends (my brother was a regular) and thought it was really entertaining. There are just a few things I have not found in any book or DVD that would have excited me as much as this one. If you love movies, especially American movies, then this is a must watch. For my generation of movie fans, this might be your last chance to see these wonderful movies.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows two brothers who are hunting a huge snake and they have to escape.There are also some other things about the story which is just not as good as what you see in the movies. But, I do not think that this film will ever be released on DVD. The first time I saw this film there were four or five people waiting near the entrance (in front of a cinema). It didn't take too long for us to leave.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert , and its influence on them is obvious (although perhaps not as much as it should be). However, there are many things wrong in this movie that I wish were fixed. If you've seen Road Warrior or Priscilla of the Desert , you know that this movie was never supposed to be an Australian hit, even though it managed to smash the box office record. I'm quite certain that most fans of these films saw Road Warrior and Priscilla together, and considered them friends.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford 's work . Mainly because it 's the only one that features a train. And there are a lot of things wrong with it, but the best criticism I could get for this movie is that it was made without any sense of pacing or direction (well, maybe not in the beginning!). I don't like to watch films which start off badly and end up quite good. It's nice if the first couple of hours provide an interesting background to the plot or introduce some fresh ideas (if those are there), but they rarely do.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a little bit of drama. I like this kind of story as it gives me a lot of interesting characters to play with. I have been a big fan of these stories for many years now and in this particular instance I have to agree with what other reviewers have said about this film being quite dull. I am not sure why the director took this move, given that there is only one or two decent parts on offer, if any, which are at all worth reading.

Ok, maybe Posse can't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies. But that's because it didn't have the FUNDING those movies had. Obviously, whenever you want to produce a story such as this one, focusing on African American historical involvement (and NO, servants and 'mammies' are not historical involvement), Hollywood isn't going to be too supportive. And believe me they weren't. The producers and actors sacrificed a lot of 'out of pocket' expenses to make "Posse", just so that the story could be told. I think that alone is commendable.

I've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's proper rebirth on DVD. Of course it didn't have the same impact on me as it would have if I had seen in it the 80s, but director Lieberman (his film "Squirm" is excellent) makes good use of the lovely Oregon location and takes the time to develop the characters, not just to have them dispatched in creative ways. A high note, Brad Fiedel's whistling music is really creepy and adds to the desolate proceedings making this great fun for genre fans.

I absolutely fell in love with this girls. let me tell you something: I am from Romania and here is only the sixth series running bunt every other day that is on USA TV I check the internet and download it from there, so i am in line with the rest of the world. I can not believe how deep I am in this show. I become to know absolutely everything about them I looked on the internet what's Rory's car what are their middle names and stuff like that: Rory is also Leigh and Lorelay is Victoria.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door , I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling . On the one hand, you can be certain he is not afraid to say something controversial or upsetting. I feel like it's my job to write about films in order to make an impression on moviegoers and so I'm willing to take whatever criticism comes my way. I'm not sure why I've had to write this review, though...the reviews seem to indicate that the film was terrible, which certainly could have been explained. The thing is, I just couldn't stomach it anymore.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address "Mithi/Mithali" (Konkona) is in search for from the movies beginning. "Prof.Anu" (Shabhana Azmi)is Mithi's extremely caring and loving half sister from Mithi's mom's earlier marriage. The movie revolves around these characters and looks into the life of a schizophrenic patient (Mithi). The director tries to explain to the viewer the imaginary world of Mithi, through her continuous blabbering to Anu and others. Konkona deserves not one but thousands of awards (which I am sure, she will be getting)for this rendition of Mithi in this movie.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old. I knew nothing of westerns then but recognized Ben Johnson from the movie "Mighty Joe Young." What attracted me to "Wagon Master" were the great songs sung by the "Sons of the Pioneers." Merian C. Cooper, who produced the movie, was the first to commission original music to fit the mood of a specific scene and so created the modern movie soundtrack. Cooper hired Max Steiner to create the mood for his classic creation King Kong.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic. I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment. This movie does an excellent job of revealing the complexity of the task and the incredible challenges facing South Africa. I believe every one should see this movie as I think few people outside of South Africa understand its past and what is being attempted in the Truth and Reconciliation process. Almost every country has some part of its own history which is still a source of continuing hatred and bitterness. We all need to understand ways of dealing with the past. What's happening in South Africa should guide us all.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations , discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional turmoil for an audience which has grown accustomed to films of this kind. The only thing worth saying is, I wish it was on Netflix and not some other site. It would be so much better. There is nothing wrong with the movie itself. It's actually quite touching in certain cases, but the story is rather simplistic. A group of young people from Brooklyn have been caught up in a series of bizarre disappearances and are trying to track down their lost parents.

I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the sequel, especially as the original was pretty bad. It was not a bad film and I thought it had an interesting premise. If this were to happen again, I would give it 5 stars but that's all you can ask for in a sequel. This movie is NOT funny. That could easily be said of almost any movie out there. I have no clue how many movies are made every year trying to make money.

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight, in particular, did an extraordinary job playing a guy who has lost all interest in his life (a character he's played before but not quite on equal terms today). The fact that the story starts and ends in such a completely different city is one of its greatest strengths. I'm a huge fan of Stephen King's works. I loved The Dark Tower so much, although I didn't watch this movie at all.

`` Two Hands '' is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life history and fictional history. First time viewer: I can see some flaws with this movie but I am not sure what to do about it. It is very amateurish in some respects compared to most other films I've seen lately. It is almost like two people, one from the future and the other from the past, are talking while listening to the same music on a classical violin. The only thing that made me laugh out loud was all of the accents.

`` Side Show '' is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures . Very gory, in fact. It's really quite hard to describe how awful it is. You can see that the actors are terrible, the script isn't funny, and the story doesn't make any sense either. Even though I gave this 4 stars, because I thought it was a great movie, it still has a lot of problems. This film is very bad, even by modern standards. The acting skills are all there at first, but they get old very quickly.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound affect on me then. I saw in again about a year ago (I am now 29) and it still moved me in similar ways. This is a great movie that personifies the struggle of "principle vs. pragmistism". Voight's character is the idealist teacher that won't give in to any psuedo-racist leanings of the Superintendent, Mr. Skeffington. That story also personifies the struggle of how older people often resist change, and more specifically, cultural change.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin. There aren't much left when it arrives. Not of the train and not of some passengers.This is a black comedy directed by Peter Dalle and acted like they used to act in the 40s and also photographed (in b/w) like they used to during that period. The actors must have had lots of fun making it. They aren't much of characters, like they weren't in the 40s, but the story is well narrated and everybody has timing.A deadly black and deadly funny film.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys , but providing a very nice reference guide for the movie. What better way to celebrate one's birthday than by enjoying a good film and having fun with it? This movie was no different. I don't know how anyone could have picked up this movie without checking it out in its entirety. The plot is nothing special, but there were plenty of things that stood out as being worthy of watching.For starters, there was absolutely no racism or homophobia in this movie.

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends . I don't normally get to watch movies like that, so I didn't pay very much attention to it before I left for work. But now, after seeing it again, I'm sure I can't stop talking about it! This movie is great. I am not an actor and have never watched a drama before. But this film is just amazing. My wife and I sat down to watch it when we got home at 3AM.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

With all the dreck out there, this is a gentle movie about young love. Yes, it's true that young love often makes more out of something than it deserves, but why aren't people down on "Romeo and Juliet"? Paul and Michelle are models of good behave compared to them.Yes, they run away, and set up an ideal life, but this is a movie, not real life. Paul is more sexually interested than Michelle, who has been come onto in a bad way. Eventually, they have sex, but no one is forced into it.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) has ever made, but he really is an absolute master of his craft. From the start, there's something about this film that will have you thinking, "Wow, if this was any other director then I'd think twice about it". It's like watching a good movie from start to finish with all the right lighting, great music, acting and directing skills going on. This one has it all. There's some truly outstanding acting here, particularly by Peter O'Toole.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a shy child who has fallen in love with a handsome prince, but his parents are away on holiday. When their daughter returns, however, there's an old secret hidden from them and they need to find it before she runs away again. This film is about a young girl who grows up, moves out of her parents' house and learns about her past. There were quite a few reasons I decided to watch this when I made my decision to read the books.

Unlike some of the former commentators , I was ( and am ) an avid fan of the Carpenters . But this film is so bad it made me cringe.There are a few things to say about this, but there's too much going on in that trailer to list them all.The main character, who you're supposed to care for very deeply, is a womanizer. The first half is a bunch of scenes where she seductively kisses men, then lures them into her private quarters with the promise of having sex. You think she's gonna be good?

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has! It was funny and creative; I wish my children and grandchildren could have seen it. It ranks right up there with Winky Dink - another favorite. I was pleased to find out that one of the creators later worked on Rocky and Bullwinkle. These early shows had a lot going for them that todays cartoons for kids don't have. Today's cartoons seem to push the idea that one needs something special, some magic formula or talent to be able to succeed against evil or dangerous circumstances.

`` Two Hands '' is an entertaining , funny story about Australian lowlifes . The screenplay contrasts the world of television in which it was broadcast and with that of reality TV in which it is being produced. The plot revolves around a guy who lives in a house he built on top of a hillside, and one day someone from his past comes back home to kill him because he's a low-life. Well, I'm not sure what you're doing with this film or if you even know who made it. It's like watching an episode of "The X-Files," minus the supernatural element.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday ( 4 February , 2006 ) and came away with a very bad impression. I don't think the movie was as good as advertised. First of all, it's a comedy-drama about a pair of friends that fall in love and spend their honeymoon together at a beautiful place called "Palawan". Although they do have fun and try hard to maintain their relationship, they ultimately end up fighting for their lives when they run into a group of drunk sailors who throw them overboard by the side of the road on their journey back from a party.

`` L'Auberge Espagnole '' collected the audience wherever it was shown . It gathered audience awards on many film festivals and was even given an Emmy by the National Arts Centre. The film follows one woman, who works as a prostitute in Paris, until one evening, she discovers her friend's body. She investigates, but finds that the body is actually the wife of another prostitute. When she tries to find her companion, she meets a man named Jean, who leads her away for questioning. The next day, he turns up dead too.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit it was a flop). For this remake of "Lincoln" it seems like we may have to take the same tack as "Caddyshack". It's hard to find much redeeming elements in this film, but for those that enjoy melodrama and high tension scenes there is little here for you other than that.The movie starts out quite nicely. A couple of police officers investigating a robbery at a convenience store are interrupted by shots fired which causes them to stop and see what's happening.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way ! ! When I first tuned in to America 's Next Top Model I was really hoping it would make an attempt at a reality show, or maybe a reality TV show of some sort. However, nothing could have prepared me for the utter disaster that was the premiere episode.The producers of this show didn't even know what they wanted to do and how much they were going to charge people to watch it!!! It took about ten minutes before I realized there was absolutely no value whatsoever in watching one minute of footage of someone's sex act.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars ' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It plays as an action film at its very best and it holds up perfectly to the low budget production standards required. This movie is great. I have never been this disappointed with any movie in my whole life. I was hoping for something better, so I went out of my way to find this movie. What a waste of time. Why bother if you don't see much of anything except what you can see on your television?

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's infamous white-collar crime family. It's a good thing, because the rest of the film suffers for being "too" good at what it does. First I would like to congratulate John Hurt on having a very nice acting career after such a long and successful run in the British TV/movie business. The story lines and plot are all interesting and have a lot of twists and turns but the performances are as poor as can possibly be.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "the murder mystery", as the addition of sound to films helped to make a more faithful translation to film of what the audiences experienced in the original plays. And since horror films were very popular in those years, by enhancing the horror elements of the plots the murder mystery films experienced a popularity almost equal to what it enjoyed in the previous decade (in which the first movies of the genre were produced).

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even remotely accurate is beyond me.The story starts with a group of boys living in the countryside who decide to rob a rich man in order to make some money to buy better clothes. They are only successful in robbing him after he falls under the spell of one of their henchmen, whom they can't control. One day the young boy goes on a shopping spree. As he moves about the countryside he is seen walking along with his henchmen.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie . They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to deliver a memorable performance on stage or screen. Jackie's character, however, is not one you'll be watching for the most part. She can't keep an ounce of energy under control. That's because she is just too boring. It's rare to see a movie where the lead actress doesn't give her best performance. My two cents on this film. I'm a big fan of Jackie (which I really am now) but I wasn't exactly sure what to expect.

Brian (Wesley Eure) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton (Conrad Bain). The Norton firm is in financial trouble for, unknown to the owner, he has an employee who is selling secrets to a rival firm's owner (Jim Bacchus). It's not Brian, as he is a loyal and faithful employee and a good inventor. But, Mr. Norton has no patience with Brian, in part because Norton's beautiful daughter, Casey (Valerie Bertinelli) has a thing for Brian and Norton questions Brian's motives for wooing her.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film. The backwoods slasher pretty much started with films like Friday the 13th, The Burning, and Madman. Just Before Dawn is a step ahead of the typical backwoods slasher flick. The cinematography is gorgeous. The acting is top notch. The heroine of the film is not your typical 'final girl'.Constance is a 'woods' girl, but when it comes down to the primal instinct of survival, she's a step behind. Not until it comes to saving the life of her and her boyfriend, does the primal notion of survival kick in.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome; more bloodshed and very graphic details (a bit too much for my taste). Great script and acting (I was especially impressed by Ken Stott and there were no weak points in te cast). Good cinematography and very realistic stereo-sound. One of the best thrillers I've seen since years. Although it was scheduled on BBC in three parts I watched Messiah on video in one take. One point of critic; the motivation of the villain was not very convincing.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes (with the exception of the Imaginationland trilogy) this is the one that made laugh the most, definitely is my favourite so far of Season 11. So basically Cartman sees at a toy store a kid who has the Tourette's syndrome and a new idea comes to Cartman. You can imagine, now Cartman has Tourette's syndrome and is great since Kyle once he knows about this is like "he's faking". Cartman is certainly on fire, saying whatever he wants to the teachers, to the principal, to anybody.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really do n't approve of pornography all that much, but you can see why it's such a hit. I have never seen porn before in my life and I'm quite scared to ask the question, am I alone here or is this what people watch? Well, if you're not used to watching porn then don't worry! You'll be able to appreciate this film very easily when you get over the stench from the trailer and the movie itself. This will be your first chance to see something new and exciting!

Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogotá, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the stupid`
This is not the movie you watch as a child of 7. This movie is awful. The plot, characters, dialogue and acting were all completely unoriginal. I had to skip over several scenes during the first half hour in case I wanted to see what they were about. And I did. You should not see it because there's nothing special about it whatsoever.The whole story was based on a book of the same name written by an English scientist called Thomas More.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

America's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense. It has a great hostess, has great guests, a great production and some of the best professionals of the modeling world contributing for something they hadn't achieved yet: present a true America's Next Top Model. Of course this is not something easy to do, therefore USA and the world already would have 10 top models concurring and fighting between themselves in this cruel world.But it's obvious that its intention is not to present the America's next top model, but yes, the America's Next Pop Model.

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bum cheeks and around her bum hole. It was also brilliant to see Alan's bum going up and down like a fiddler's elbow later on in the film.Alan was tough as hell in it like when he got annoyed and pushed the four eyed wimp onto the sofa.I've been laughing for days about the cut throat razor bit. A brilliant idea by the script writers. Alan must be brought back into Eastenders so he can do the same to Peggy.Alan is back, and this time he's armed with a razor.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend . It was a fun romp with some cool action scenes and an excellent performance from Jodie Foster. The movie starts off great, but slowly takes a turn as it drags on for far longer than what's expected. This is just plain bad. If I could give a 5 star to ANY movie I would. This flick does not care how good it is or how much it sucks in terms of story or characters. There's absolutely nothing here that doesn't suck (or worse).

Very good `` Precoder '' starring Dick Barthelmess , which in a way , kind of reminded me of Hawks . (I actually liked that version, because I've heard that some people like it when they're bored.) This film is not bad at all. The best sci-fi movie on this list. You really should check out the trailer and see for yourself if this one would make your first or second watch. In fact, what could be better than to go to the movies and sit through an 8 minute horror film?

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own. There is nothing wrong with that, I'm just very disappointed in this film. After a long time I've finally decided to give up trying to understand Japanese movies. If I had the time to read a bunch of bad reviews I would, but I don't. Not anymore. At least not for this one.This movie isn't bad. In fact, it could have been great. But instead it is like watching your favorite TV show on a loop while you watch someone else's.

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . That's what comes from the movie, but it's hard to listen to it all together when you see some of the dialogue. I really enjoyed this movie. The plot had a good hook and a great cast with some interesting moments. It took me a couple of hours to sit down and watch it as it went on. In fact, I felt sorry for the scriptwriter (who has never done a feature film before).

I 'm absolutely disgusted this movie is n't being sold . All who love this movie should email Disney and ask for a refund or they'll regret buying this movie ! And all the people who made the movie , do you actually have the guts to tell these people not to make it ? This movie deserves a much better ending! This has no place in our culture, but I thought there was one redeeming aspect that could be added. In The Dark Knight Rises Bruce Wayne tries to save an old friend's life by stopping an assassin from torturing his brother.

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her face. There was one other time where a guy came to the toilet, only to find his feet covered in sperm. There were so many things wrong with this movie that I can't even count them all! The biggest mistake is that it had not been properly shown to its intended audience for a long time. In fact, the production team may have taken away much from what they should have done.

This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . If there was ever a movie to make me laugh out loud, this one it is it. The characters are so stupid that you would be better off watching the film without them.The only real redeeming element about this movie is some really dumb acting from Eddie Murphy who does not appear to understand anything he does. I must admit I did not see this on the internet but I've seen it for the first time and boy, is it great!

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good:The camera work was absolutely phenomenal. Every shot is done beautifully.It was interesting seeing all the different animals that I could have never even imagined.David Attenborough has the perfect narrator's voice. No one could have done any better.The Bad:There were one or two different times where there was a reference to the Earth being 1 million years old ( I hold a different belief). Overall a TV series anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend buying it. 10/10 stars.

I get really fed up with sitcoms ; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be suspenseful or interesting. For me, a good TV show just isn't worth watching every week. The problem I have with this show and many others like it is: the writers don't seem to care about the characters. Why are there two "hero" versions of each guy on television? The reason why most people like this show is that they can make sense of all of the stories, especially the main ones.

As a European, the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980's and the experiences I had living abroad and interacting with other nationalities, although the circumstances were slightly different. Klapisch (the director) went to the New York Film School from 1982-85, so one would think that he is drawing on this experience.It is interesting how the film balances the message that "one should not generalize" with the notion that "for every stereotype, there is some underlying truth". For example, the Italian character is based more on the pothead aspect than on any well-known Italian stereotype.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it. Even the ending can be pretty terrifying at times, and sometimes I thought that there could have been some real tension behind the scenes between the main cast and their respective love interests. The movie was a mess from start-to-finish. A few years ago, my wife and I decided to spend some time in a friend's hometown of New York. We made our way around the area, stopped into a certain restaurant, and took a quick lunch break before heading home.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game. This is the number one best TH game in the series. Next to Underground. It deserves strong love. It is an insane game. There are massive levels, massive unlockable characters... it's just a massive game. Waste your money on this game. This is the kind of money that is wasted properly. And even though graphics suck, thats doesn't make a game good. Actually, the graphics were good at the time. Today the graphics are crap. WHO CARES?

The above summary really isn't meant as a slam against this film, as the series followed a very similar format. As usual, Simon Templar ("The Saint") meets a lady in distress and comes to her aid. He also comes to the aid of a police detective who was framed of accepting a bribe. Along the way, he meets some interesting supporting characters (this time, Paul Guilfoyle as "Pearly" Gates) and during his unraveling of this not especially compelling mystery (none of them really are), Templar is extremely erudite and just plain cool!

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . I don't get why anyone would even attempt to understand this book, if they had the slightest idea as to the plot and/or story. Like so many others I was not impressed by any aspect of the book. However, once I got into it I found a way to enjoy it with little trouble. It has an intriguing plot, and a strong lead character who seems to really know what she is doing. If you like suspense thriller then this will do.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! As an archivist, I was extremely disappointed in the quality of the sound track and I'm sorry for any embarrassment that caused. If you are going to put out a movie like this, it is very important that you not only use your talent as a screenwriter, editor and director, but at least have a decent knowledge of your subject. In this case, if you didn't know what you're talking about, you would have been better off cutting the script completely and watching the finished film.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. It was great that you used so many African-American artists to tell the tale of the black cowboy. It was also good to see Billy Zane in this movie. Does he ever play a good guy?I would highly recommend this film to anyone who wants to broaden their way of thinking. This is an excellent movie and I feel privileged to have seen it.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright , Wagon Master was one of Ford 's favorite films. I didn't see it in theaters (it never made its way to a home video release) but my daughter and I came back to the theater thinking that maybe we could watch it on DVD. First off, there is no word as to why this film is so bad. It has absolutely no special effects or animation to speak of - if you've seen the trailer, you know what I'm saying. What makes this film any good?

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I'm sorry, but I found out she is not what I was expecting of her. I am a HUGE fan of The Twilight Zone. My husband and I have always hated movies like this because they are so preachy and preachy they can get you really fired up if you watch it. But then I saw this movie...and for the life of me I didn't even care. This movie has no plot or any kind of direction.

If you want to see a movie with nudity, sex, drugs, alcohol, brutal beating of a woman and child rape, this movie will satisfy you. If you want to see a man creatively exact revenge on the treasure of a wife who left him, this movie has it. You've already heard the wonderful music that keeps the raw emotion going. The surprise is that in a story of violence, action and music a climax can come in a moment of silence, without a pedantic speech, which transforms the movie.

First love . Teenage love . We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the ones I have. It is like that moment in one of those movies when you find your girlfriend and realize you are in love with him or her. I don't know why I ever fell for anyone who can't read and write English. In my youth I was taught a lot by my older brother who had studied abroad, and who was able to help me learn French. When I returned home I found this guy on a flight from Paris to London.

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me its like being on tv in the 70's with my mother. This isn't funny, it just makes you look stupid for thinking otherwise. It's all made to look bad so that people won't believe the stupidity of the actors playing themselves. If you watch this one, you will realize how many people out there don't have the talent or education to act like this. They're really only trying to please their fans.

Blue Planet... Wow... Where do I begin? The years of hard work paid off in what is, without question, one of the best documentaries ever created.The sights and sounds presented in Blue Planet, like most documentaries with the Attenborough stamp, are rare and haven't even experienced by most people. That alone should be enough reason to buy this series, especially if you're the curious type who 'wants to know'.Blue Planet is not a perfect documentary, however. It does get a bit repetitive after the 3rd episode.

I'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film. If you're looking for something different then this movie is a good choice. Definitely not your typical mindless story that seems to be everywhere starring Ben Idiot Affleck or some other Hollywood loser. It's an intellectual film, you actually need to pay attention so some people might be turned off by that. However, if you are looking for something that keeps you on your toes then this is a good choice. Warning to parents - it has some fairly graphic sex scenes so watch it once the kiddies are in bed.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three Indians for what appears at first to be no apparent reason..that is until the Lone Ranger discovers from a conversation with the Indian Chief Tomache that each man possessed a medallion. The five medallions given by Tomache to his friends as gifts we later learn when combined will provide the mastermind behind the hooded raiders with a map to a legendary lost city of gold. Can the Lone Ranger protect the remaining two individuals in possession of the medallions before the hooded raiders get their hands on it?

If there 's one cartoon that helped to put UPA on the map more than any other , It 's A Bunch of Guys. This movie was written by Bill Condon (Paddington) & David Walliams (Lloyd). I really liked the story but it has its faults. Firstly, you can't imagine what they had to go through in order to get there. There was literally no way they could find anyone to take over for Lloyd. He was too old for this sort of thing. A Bunch of Guys and Friends is not a great movie although it does feature some solid actors.

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in that area at the same time. The rest of the movie seems to take place in another part of California or even Mexico, which would seem odd considering that many of these films don't really make any sense in any other state.I thought this was going to be great, but after a while you just start thinking that this is nothing more than an adaptation of a book I have read some years ago and it didn't quite stick in your head.

This is a really great film! It gets you thinking about your parents. How we all have fragile relationships we all have with them, unless we really make an effort to know who they are as people. And just as important, we should remember to open up and show them our real selves, not just who we think they want us to be. Definitely see this documentary! IMDb is making me write more text before they will post my comment, how odd. Usually online comments need to be short short, and here I am being asked to write more!

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world. The premise is simple, and it's one of my favorites: a group of girls are offered a chance to make money from their dreams by writing stories that can be published for a fee. They take the offer, but find themselves struggling to reach the level of success that would warrant an agent's attention. Like most of the genre films released in the United States in the early '60s, "Beverly Hills Cop" is a comedy.

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her daughter who are having trouble at school due to their unusual parenting skills.The acting was superb and it was quite easy to tell that they really cared about these kids. I can imagine many parents watching this program, wondering how they got their children to go to such a fine school and have such a happy life.This is a great story and very well-written, with lots of fun characters. I watched this show because of my daughter's friend. She said it was good and we should watch it together.

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring.

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show right from the start and i watched it on a cold morning last night and couldn't stop watching it! if you can get over the first few episodes, this show is a must-watch for any fan of sci fi ! I've read so many reviews that give me high hopes for this show but I don't find them to hold water. The main reason being that I didn't like it when I was a kid.

This film, released in 1951, has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50's; the cavalry needing to protect the territory from a murderous band of Indians, an officer determined to see that task through, and the men with him with various character flaws that he has to merge together into a cohesive unit. This small band must hold on to a fort located close to the Indian village until reinforcements arrive. The Indians know, all to well, that the small band is undermanned, and could be wiped out before the help comes.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``The Last of the Mohicans''. However this film fails to make us feel the same emotion as we would have felt in the first half hour of an 80s horror movie. It makes you wonder how much money Sergio Leone would have spent on this, and if there were any extras. In fact the only reason you think this film even exists is because of the great soundtrack. I watched this movie twice, so don't judge too much on it.

SPOILERS AHEAD------------------------- Mel has got it going on. From the opening credits to the ending credits this movie has straight laughs. Dave Chappel shows why he is a comedic force. Cary Eewes carries the movie most of the time, but the supporting cast fills in strong when the plot is drawn away from Robin Hood. Right from the beginning this movie proclaims it's self not to be taken seriously. If you took a time machine and gave the characters thoughts of modern day antics you would get this movie.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore . I 'm sure it pisses a few liberals off . I really don't know what I'd do if I was running my local animal shelter or some such. They're the only thing I have going for me in this world. This week I watched a little bit of the film "Al Gore" which was actually good. But then I had to finish it on my own, and it took awhile to get through because I just couldn't help but notice how awful everything was about it (i.e., there are very few funny lines).

*spoiler* *spoilers* *spoilers* I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it,I laughed a lot so the bottom line is that I recommend the film.However I have problems with what LaBute wanted to say.The plot is very simple.Betty(Renee Zellweger), a hard life house wife watch her husband being murdered and while having forgotten everything she had seen,she follow her "true love" for a soap series character,Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear). Simple enough but not enough to hold a 95 minutes film.

I played Sam ( the porter , Lou 's sidekick ) in the Film `` Dead Rail '' Which later became the very popular film. My brother and I both worked for a railroad company in Wisconsin. Our first job was as an office assistant. In that job we were supposed to help the train crew at all times. We also had to watch out for other people on the tracks.
