This is what our jobs would normally be like when we were kids. After reading numerous reviews of this movie I decided to try it for myself.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and, as mysteries should, keeps you guessing until the end and has several suspects to choose from.Many films from the Golden Age are not for all tastes, especially younger viewers. They date themselves by clothing, cars, settings, etc. Who nowadays asks for a highball? Or wears a suit and tie everywhere? And the legal process was so much simpler - must have been a dearth of lawyers back then. Frankly, much of value is missing from those days.In any case, go with it and enjoy.

The `` Hunting Trilogy '' of Rabbit Fire ( 1951 ) , Rabbit Seasoning ( 1952 ) , and Duck Tailed Deer ( 1953 ) is also worth watching as are many others in the genre, but I don't have a particular need for any of it. The whole series consists of five movies, so that's a total of thirty-six episodes. They were filmed in several different locations, and each film was about three or four minutes long. That's probably the least boring part of the whole thing; the second half was just too short.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great movie but it's not what you're looking for in a B&W action movie; it has too much blood, gore and violence (I can forgive that as I don't have a problem with gore). I think there are some inaccuracies or mistakes in this film. For example:
-The title of the movie says "In the Shadow of Death''. In fact, the film is actually about a boy named Joseph Smith (played by Tom Hanks) finding God and becoming a prophet.

'The Cell' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally. The film is about the journey, about the world it shows during this journey, the destination does not really matter. In my opinion this journey through the mind gives such beautiful images other things do not really matter as long as they are not distracting. In fact, the story is pretty good.We start with Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) in the mind of a catatonic boy. How this works exactly does not really matter, but it looks a lot like virtual reality.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare, but Fata Morgana is a good case. You can chalk up the large subject to the ambitions of youth, but Herzog does an amazingly good job. The movie's point is to show human beings, and even the world, from a non-human point of view.The movie is in three parts: Creation, Paradise, and The Golden Age. The imagery of each is in counterpoint to the voice-over. Although the text of `The Creation' (from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan myth) refers to the primordial wasteland, the scene goes no further in illustrating the myth.

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's nakedness make for a really good time . The dialogue is pretty good too.The special effects don't take over this movie , but they certainly add an extra dimension. I've seen this film dozens of times before. It's one of those odd films that you go "Oh, so that's what this was about. Why would I want to see that?" in the name of being cynical. This is such a bad mistake.

I ca n't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten . To be honest , I saw this movie with no idea of what it was gonna be and not even one of the actors had done any acting whatsoever. It was like watching someone throw a baby out the window while they watched TV. So i guess i am a little disappointed, at least for me and my wife. But hey, this movie wasn't as bad as it could've been. This movie was nothing compared to anything else on the television. I must admit I really did enjoy this movie.

this is a really great series . i love the show and i am so glad it is n't canceled ! I didn't really know what I was going to do with this, but I'm glad I took the plunge because it's one hell of an experience. First of all, the music is incredible. There are many pieces on here that would make someone say "WTF IS THIS?!" The lyrics are hilarious and you're laughing at yourself for hearing them in the first place. This movie is just plain weird.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as well as me (who was a senior at the time).The plot is pretty convoluted. At the beginning there's a war between nations known as the Civi Nations, who seek to take over the world after a powerful man dies of apoplexy. However, things aren't that easy. They don't have all the resources they need for such an attempt, nor do they have a clear strategy for the war and it will take years for them to complete it successfully.

One of the better made for TV biopics , I just wish it had told us more . I have been waiting to see this one for so long and sadly, was disappointed when it was released. This movie is NOT a thriller! It is a low hanging plot line that has no redeeming characteristics other than "we can't trust anyone here". That's all it is. Nothing else. If you've watched enough movies about cops or serial killers, you will understand that this film isn't something special. You are supposed to hate police. Why?

Absolutely, I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting,fascinating and certainly beautiful film. It's not necessary to see all the episodes,since the first ones are the best,while the last ones are a-bit tiresome,but for any person who likes German's and their good-natured ways,all episodes are worth seeing.In typical german fashion, values are constantly questioned,even it's murderous Nazi past is confronted in the last episodes, the rich dialogues are particularly interesting. These episodes are recommended for anyone who is about to live or travel in Germany,preferably in original language!

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. The producers did not try to create some happy ending that didn't exist. The lack of a happy ending would create agitation in the audience that, hopefully would spur them on to action. At least that's how it seemed at the time. In today's movie world this movie would probably not be done. There would, definitely, not be this ending, however realistic.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released . The controversy that surrounded the original release was ridiculous. We both agreed that this movie is not a good movie, but we were glad to see that many people came away feeling cheated. It's been a bad week for me. First off, I'd like to say that I'm very sorry about the things I said in yesterday's post. I shouldn't have let everyone down last night. And I would've learned from my mistake sooner if I had paid more attention to what happened in the theater.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south. The story follows a man named Lazarus whose wife dumps him for his brother and finds Rae abandoned and beaten up on the side of the road. Lazarus finds out that Rae is a sex addict and was abused as a child so he decides to take matters into his own hands by tying up Rae with a chain to cure her of her wickedness. Samuel L Jackson and Christina Ricci have great chemistry together and their performances make you believe that through their struggles and search for redemption that Lazarus and Rae become best friends.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made, "Murder in the Music Hall" seems to have undeservably faded into oblivion. A shame, because this lusciously produced, expertly directed and written, and crafty mystery-suspense item spins an enticing whodunnit thriller against the setting of Radio City Music Hall. A murder in one of the building's posh penthouse apartments casts suspicion on the luscious Rockettes--among them, Vera Ralston (who besides giving an appealing performance of subtlety and vulnerablity, provides a few dazzling ice-skating production numbers), Helen Walker, Ann Rutherford, Julie Bishop, and several other delectable B-movie starlets of the '40s.

This show is really great. It's smart.It's funny.It's great acting and writing. This show is really the fastest show I've ever seen. The Dialogues are really funny and well acted. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel have a great chemistry.You really do believe they are mother and daughter. This show really showed that mother daughter relationships really don't have to be just mother and daughter, they can be best friends but on the same time it shows that it's really hard sometimes being more than just mother and daughter especially with Lorelai and Emily.

Well ..... I would n't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I don't think anyone should have to face. Okay so here's how i get into this film: There is a girl who gets kidnapped by people that she knows and believes in . The kidnapping plot goes something like this, when the girl arrives at their hideout and meets with her captors, she learns about their plans and what she will have to do to escape. But before she can act, she must kill them or else they are going to destroy everything she holds dear.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. This low-key Western is unusual for Ford in that it lacks any big stars. Johnson gets top-billing but his is basically a supporting role, although he and Carey work well together. Dru is given little to do other than provide the love interest. The best performance is given by Ford favorite Bond, playing the leader of the Mormons. In fact, this role helped him land a starring role in the long-running TV Western "Wagon Train" before his untimely death at age 57.

* spoiler * * spoilers * * spoilers * I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it.I know I should, but...what a waste.There isn't much to the film other than how it plays with the rules of what it is supposed to be. The biggest mistake I've ever heard about this movie is that most people who don't like horror films will take it up with someone who already has a huge crush on it (which is why they call it a "crazed romantic comedy").

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

I just watched this movie on it's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia. I liked (not loved) "Mork & Mindy" as a kid, mostly for Robin William's zany energetic performance. This movie made me remember why. Was the original show great? Not really, but Robin certainly was. Which brings me to this movie.I was pleasantly surprised, expecting nothing more than a paint by numbers chronological retelling of the show (which in a way it was). But, of course, the real focus was on Robin.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with "Valley of the Kings." These movies helped inspire a lifelong interest in Egyptology. (In 1975 I visited Egypt!) Seen today, "The Egyptian" suffers from flat dialog and a few gauche touches, but it's a glorious movie to look at -- the sort of thing Hollywood, alas, just doesn't do anymore -- and it has a great story... not just the usual boy-meets-girl or vengeance-is-mine affair. Too bad 20th won't re-issue restored prints of this to be seen on the Big Screen.

As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's, but for what it's worth I can see no excuse why it should be seen by children today. I don't recall much about this "movie" (although it would have been very entertaining), but I will say that there were some disturbing scenes at one or more times which were not particularly shocking to me. In particular, I noticed that something was going on behind the counter and the cashier got up, walked back out of the shop and waited around with her mouth wide open.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie in a way that neither one of them have been able to achieve. They both find themselves caught up in a deadly murder-for-hire ring, and the story takes a strange turn when Ronnie ends up involved as well.The movie is not really a comedy, so if you're looking for something to watch with a laugh, this is not the best option. I'm sure it would be fine with most folks, but if you're like me, you'll probably want to rent this instead.

When I was engaged , my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores . He would look for his books in a small aisle and I would find them in a full size one. I bought this book because I was looking for a little something different from many other books on the shelf that I had read. However, it failed me at every turn. From the start of the story to the end of it, it is almost impossible to get past the first twenty pages. Also, while I do enjoy reading a good romance story, there are worse things out there.

This game is very good for the n64 . You can skate as Tony Hawk , Bob Burnquist , Steve Austin and others. The graphics have a bit too realistic. The music is OK but there are some bad parts to it, like the background music and the score. This game is definitely not for everyone. However, if you like the look of the games that come out now then you will be very glad that this was released. I mean why else would you buy this game???? ?

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty. IT was about a middle class black family who had a teen aged daughter and son who moved to a middle class neighborhood from Oakland or somewhere (I can't remember). I remember several episodes but the one I remember most was when their cousin got her period for the first time. I was probably 7-8 when I first watched it and I was able to keep up with the program.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford 's best in my opinion . No major stars , but great performances. The plot is a little contrived, the ending is disappointing, and the character designs are stereotypical. I'll admit that I wasn't a fan of this movie before its release. However, I was hooked after watching it. When I started watching the final act, things just stopped being scary and everything started to be really enjoyable. The action sequences were fun, and all the actors had their moments. The film was definitely made for the small screen.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago . I 've seen it 4 or 5 more than that. It's not even close. I'm sorry folks! I know some people may disagree and they have their own opinions on this film, but there is no one who does not like this movie. There are also many other good movies to choose from here, so I won't go in depth into that.The main character is a man named "Tito". He has a bad reputation (as do many of his peers) and suffers from an eating disorder.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I was not a big fan of Robin Hood, or Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, but this movie was a lot different! It made fun of Robin Hood, and was HILARIOUS! I was extremely pleased with how well it was put together, and how well acted it was! Besides Home Alone, Mrs. Doubtfire, and Houseguest, this was the funniest move I've ever seen! I especially love the song; "We're Men in tights!"

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

Our America is multi-cultural, with so many sub-cultures. This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time within one of these sub-cultures. It is basically an objective look at a group of forgotten people, living their lives oblivious to the rest of the world. Generally, a good movie. It entertained, provoked thought, and showed lives that would not be seen otherwise, right in our own back yard. Should be seen by all. Having lived in the U.S. all my life, I had no idea that there were citizens here that didn't know they were citizens.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama to comedy and I think you can guess what happened inbetween. It is hard to say, if it's good or bad, because it seems to make up for it with a lot of cheap jokes. There isn't much of substance behind the jokes, there are so many characters that should be likable, that most of them aren't, even when they show their potential (which I suppose is understandable).The problem with this movie lies in the story line.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one. I really can't come up with one. I think it's because most of the films that take on this topic (war, peace, violence) are in a fixed documentary style.There are some terrific ones out there, all of them better known than USA T.M., I'm sure, but they are intended to be informational and to bring your emotional response to the surface through intellectual means. This DVD, in some ways may seem more intellectual but it really isn't.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

In Mississippi, the former blues man Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) is in crisis, missing his wife that has just left him. He finds the town slut and nymphomaniac Rae (Chritina Ricci) dumped on the road nearby his little farm, drugged, beaten and almost dead. Lazarus brings her home, giving medicine and nursing and nourishing her like a father, keeping her chained to control her heat. When her boyfriend Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) is discharged from the army due to his anxiety issue, he misunderstands the relationship of Lazarus and Rae, and tries to kill him.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that is probably the only reason I went. I watched this movie for the first time last night, and I have to admit it's a pretty good one.The story in fact is quite short, but there is enough suspense and intrigue to keep you going even if you don't care about anything else in the movie.It's really funny, too, especially on the TV commercials.There isn't much wrong with this movie, as far as I am concerned - at least I didn't think so right from the outset.

Maybe it 's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel , or a fondness for this old film in general. What I'm trying to say is that this is an awful movie. I am a big fan of James Bond movies since I've seen some pretty good ones back in the day. This was one of the worst ever. It was made before the events of the third movie (although it doesn't take into account the first, which takes place two years after the events of the first film) and it has nothing to do with what happened in the previous one.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say "french culture". I thought the way it was filmed and the editing was real good but mostly it was entertaining especially the guy that played Wendy's brother. Also the story line was really good as well as it was believable and yet adventurous as well.Favorite Part: When William is making fun of the German guy studying and when he acts out how flies reproduce! :) My french isn't that good but with the subtitles i could pretty much get what was going on. WATCH IT!

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought the DVD. I'm glad that I went through it, because I couldn't quite believe what I was seeing. There are some of the same problems you'll find with other horror films such as 'Halloween II' and 'Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy'. This is a movie that could have been directed by Jim Jarmusch (The Usual Suspects) but decided to be directed by his son. The script, acting and cinematography were all terrible.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films, In The Company of Men & Your Friends and Neighbors, with this funny and original thriller/comedy/road movie. When Betty (Renee Zellwegger) witnesses the brutal murder of her no-good husband (Aaron Eckhart), she develops a bizarre sort of amnesia, and flees in his car, not knowing that there is large stash of drugs in the trunk. Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock are the hit men who follow her.What Betty is chasing, besides a new beginning (although she can't remember the old life) is her beloved, Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear).

A remarkable film , bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much , much older. There was a lot to like but I couldn't shake the feeling that this film did not really have time to go on. I saw this movie three times at various festivals in different parts of Spain. After seeing it, I gave it two stars just so I could save myself the embarrassment of watching another one. The first time I watched the film I felt sorry for the audience as they sat in a gallery with no idea what was going on.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie. They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine. In particular, the way Candice pronounces the words "Puerto Rican" is very funny, as she is being kind as she can be but condescending at the same time. I had seen the original of this movie, called "Old Acquaintance", starring Bette Davis and Miriam Hopkins. They allegedly did not get along, so because the movie is about female friendship, that might have been a problem. Here, the actresses clearly admire and respect each other.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

`` Jaded '' takes on the complex question of abuse : the perpetrators and the victims . In lesser hands this would be an intriguing story. I like this movie. I didn't know it was coming out yet. I'm so glad when it does. It is hard to believe how bad this film is, but I think that's why it's worth the money. Even though it is far from a masterpiece or something that should be viewed in isolation, this is still a good example of "good art without making you feel bad for yourself" (to quote Robert Redford).

Hmm, is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar's post Saved By The Bell acting? Of course it's not right, it's ridiculous. And is right to give this movie a `10' rating? Hahahahahaha... that's funny. This movie wasn't so horrible, though; better than I expected it to be. Made-for-TV movies are often so so so similar. So many of them have the same feel to them. This one had that same feel but it worked even though it was yet another tortured wife who's gotta get the b*stard in the end story.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest . In many ways, it is a very entertaining film. Many of these scenes and plot points could have been executed well in a feature film, yet are not at all seen in this piece. This movie should never have been made. I really don't like this movie. There are so many things here that go against the spirit of the original (even if there's a nice twist) and I just can't see them fitting together in one coherent story.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival. I went in with the assumption that if it stars Chiwetel Ejiofor and Hilary Swank it had to be at least decent. Well, after a kind of a slow start, I was far from disappointed. In fact, I was quite pleased with the final product.I must admit the Afrikaaner and Xhosa(?) accented English of some of the actors were kind of hard to understand but like seeing "Waking Ned Devine", "Trainspotting" or any other film with heavy-accented actors I adjusted after about 15 minutes.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ... I guess the director didn't even give it time to really work, but it's just okay. This movie is not for me, so please don't ask me to watch it. I saw this movie and thought it was pretty good, especially if you're a fan of the '70s horror movies. It's a very silly movie, with a strong female lead. But at the end of the day, it's a stupid movie that does nothing in the way of telling a plot.

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and making a movie that gets funnier each time you watch it.The first time I saw this, I cried from laughing so hard. Everything about it is funny.While "Robin Hood: Men In Tights" is not my favorite comedy (that spot is taken by "Real Genius"), it ranks way up there in my book. So go see it! If you don't spend the whole time laughing, then at least you'll spend the whole time drooling over Cary Elwes.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / did n't understand this wonderful film . What a sad life he must have had. I feel bad for this poor guy who tried to make some kind of positive change in the world, but he failed miserably at it. This film is a disaster of a film. From start to finish, and even though I am not a big fan of horror films, I could tell by the end that the story of Mary Shelley's Frankenstein was nothing more or less than "The worst idea ever conceived".

"The Cell" is a rather difficult film to classify. If you read the plot outline, "a psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim", you might think it's a thriller with a touch of science fiction. But that doesn't really do this movie justice. There is a fantasy aspect within the sub-conscious minds that is stunning, with lavish visuals and incredible mind-tripping scenarios. There is drama as the aforementioned psychotherapist (played by Lopez prior to her becoming a solely romantic comedy component) makes contact with the child within and witnesses his terrifying upbringing.

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

There's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster, Sergeant Rutledge, and The Sun Shines Bright. It was these three films with no box office names in them that Ford didn't have to tailor the film around the persona of a star being it John Wayne, Henry Fonda, or any of the others he worked with. Not surprising that Ford considered all these as favorites of one kind or another. Ben Johnson and Harry Carey, Jr. a couple of likable cowpokes sign on to guide a Mormon wagon train to a valley in Arizona territory.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

My favorite film this year. Great characters and plot, and the direction and editing was smooth, visually beautiful, and interesting. Set in Barcelona, the film follows a year in the lives of six foreign graduate students and assorted others. Cultures and languages clash but hearts and lives intertwine. The leading role would never have been cast in Hollywood, but he carried the part perfectly. The characters were nicely developed and their interplay was honest and accurate. There were two especially noteworthy scenes, the climax was truly inspired.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

I 'm not the type of person to watch T.V . shows because the acting normally sucks or it 's so bad in the first half of the show that it really doesn 't make a lot of sense and I don 't really care what is on screen. So why would anyone even watch something about this? I bought this movie for my father. It is very similar to "E.T. ", but he had no time to actually look at the picture before he saw the title, so he couldn' t be bothered watching it.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film! I enjoyed it.. its a sci fi film, if you want a thriller watch another channel.. This is what the scifi lovers want. Excellently produced by one of Sci-fi's best producers Scot Vandiver ! OK the special effects weren't excellent, but what a great cast! Some more money could have been used for effects but then again what sci fi has high budgeted effects. Stop complaining and change the channel if you don't like these type of films..

I can't comment on the accuracy of this production, historical or literary, but I can say that I enjoyed it. If there is a God, the sound track will be released, Ilona Sekacz' work is truly enduring. Twenty years on I am still moved by the haunting themes of this production and return to it frequently.The story surrounds the entry into society of Catherine Moreland. Somewhat awkward and possessed of an unhealthy interest in Gothic stories (early pulp fiction? ), Catherine descends on Bath in the company of Mrs Allen where she meets Henry Tilney.

Wagon Master (1950) Dir: John Ford Production: Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings the stock company out into the Utah desert to film a western and comes out with this minor classic. No John Wayne, no conflicted anti-heroes, no psychological exploration, no fireworks, just a gem of a picture.This ensemble piece nominally stars Ben Johnson (as Travis) and Harry Carey Jr. (Sandy). They're horse traders who come into town to do some business just as a group of Mormons, led by Ward Bond, are being shown the exit.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. I had read all the reviews before seeing it. It was pretty good, but too far out of reach for me. The actors were terrible and the plot was lame (although they did bring up a good point to be made). That's why I recommend watching it with a large bowl of popcorn and a small amount of sugar. As an added bonus, at least you can watch it with the right sound on your speaker.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across a movie that I never would have thought to watch myself. The title is not very descriptive, but it does give you a hint of what the movie is all about.The story is based off of a young girl's dream which involves her getting married at an exclusive boarding school in England. What she really wants is to marry someone from another country and go to another continent. Unfortunately this dreams come true for her at the last minute as she has no idea where to begin or where to end.

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of writing, with lots of suspense that I couldn't find in anything else. The way the story is paced throughout is very interesting and makes you wonder about all the characters. There's also a lot of psychological stuff involved, which is pretty cool. I have to give a special shoutout to the score, it's one of the best I have ever heard. This is NOT my first time watching this tv series. In fact I haven't watched anyone else's show in almost three years.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of American society at the time, and how they apply today. The movie is so bad that it is hard not to hate it. This movie is a mess. From start to end, it tries to make every aspect of life seem cool and fun. I watched this movie with the intention of sitting down to watch one of those annoying video games like "Grand Theft Auto: Los Santos" or "Battlestar Galactica" and laughing my way through it.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny ( and fun ) puns . The first shot we see in the film depicts an old woman, who is talking to her mother as she's walking towards the beach. We're not sure what the point was of this scene except that it was funny. A few years earlier, someone asked a friend of mine "Where do I start?" To my mind, one of the greatest comedies of all time, "My Three Sons", should have been rated PG-13. I found this movie to be quite entertaining.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best movies ever made. You get a glimpse of what it was like for these poor girls who had no idea that they were going to be married in a church. There are several good reasons behind why I didn't recommend this film. One, the screenplay is simply ridiculous. All the bad parts are there, as well as some pretty awful acting. That's the only reason I gave it two stars rather than 3 or 4 (they're all worth seeing anyway).

The Killing Yard is a great film, although uneven at times. Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort as a mentally wounded and judicially jilted prison inmate, and the presence of Alan Alda as his defense attorney is none other than genius. The emotion and raw reality portrayed in this film's "flashback" scenes have the ability of putting viewers directly into the midst of the events being pictured. I was not even born when the Attica riot took place, however, through extensive research, I find that "The Killing Yard" does the story all of it's fair justices.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty, easily one of the most charming, off-beat, and lighthearted comedies of the year.When soap opera obsessed waitress Betty Sizemore witnesses her insensitive husband's murder by two hitmen (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), she snaps and thinks the cast members on A Reason to Love are real. She decides to travel to Los Angeles to find famed heart specialist Dr. David Ravell (a character on the show).As the two oddly paired Hitmen, the caustic Rock and the pontificating Freeman generate some very fun chemistry, and Greg Kinnear also has fun with his smarmy offscreen actor persona.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. However, from what I did see and learn of Karen, I felt her pain, share her sadness, and she was a very special person to me growing up. I know that I wasn't born until 1965 so I didn't get to know her as much as some of you older fans but I definitely grew up listening to her music and I have fond memories of her music.

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney , Australia , following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old A-List actress Julie Burchill (played by Susanne Bier). Her father and brother are in jail, so she goes there to take care of them. I am not a huge moviegoer but this is among the worst I have seen in years. The plot is laughable and it's just plain wrong. The film has so many faults that one wonders if it could have possibly had anything to do with John Ford or Alfred Hitchcock.

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again in your fifties you don't really understand the characters or the narrative. I remember seeing The Muppet Christmas Carol (1978) and thinking it wasn't funny but now it is, at least I guess. I'm just writing to let everyone know this was one of the greatest films ever made by a British director. I have read reviews from people who have seen the film for years and so I was hoping to find someone to tell me what they thought of it.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by , no matter how bad it might be (and if it was good, of course it would be great!) This movie is about a high school chemistry teacher who tries his hardest in class to teach others about chemistry, but must find an excuse to go out and shoot up some kids' dorms to save himself the trouble of trying to convince anyone. He's pretty successful at doing both, but ends up falling into a hole that won't quit until he's had his fun.

I got this movie with my BBC `` Jane Austen Collection '' ( 5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations ) ,and its a great picture. I think i saw it in the 90s. But, then i heard that they had re-edited it to make it worse and worse. So, I didn't really watch it. But, i did enjoy watching it again after several years' hiatus. It's not bad, but the film doesn't deliver any surprises at all. As a matter of fact, it makes no sense whatsoever. A lot of plot holes were created by the editing team.

This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official. Then he's a fugitive on the run. They later blow up his house and then he finally commits suicide. Seems like they should have just made it a film for a more mature audience or made it more family friendly.This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration (and music). I'll do each one separately:Nicolas Roeg (dir)--Giuseppe Verdi (music). A story about an assassination attempt in 1931 Vienna. Theresa Russell (Roegs wife) plays a man! Not bad--very beautiful and exotic. Russell is great.Charles Sturridge--Verdi. No story but there is some haunting black and white imagery that fits perfectly with the music.Jean-Luc Godard--Jean Baptiste Lully. Horrendous. Pointless, boring, no plot, no nothing.

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn near worth $40 to rent and then watch. Why do I give a crap? Well if you're not interested in going out and killing people just to enjoy some cheap trash like this film, then you should probably go find something more interesting. This is definitely not a story about how we will get from point A to point B by jumping across the finish line.This film is full of characters that have little else in common with each other than being born into poverty.

With Nurse Betty ( 2000 ) , acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute ( In the Company of Men , Your Name) is making a follow-up to his critically acclaimed debut, This Old Dog. The script for this film is in very early development, so we don't know much about what might happen. As such, there is no reason to consider it as a "serious" or "truly dark" movie. I remember thinking I should write a letter telling you that your movie was awful. It was awful. And now you can all hear me yelling, "HOLY SHIT!"

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements. I think they were trying to capture what you'd be looking at when attending a live performance. The feet, the faces, the overall view. Unfortunately, it falls a bit short. But, having said that, watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying. It's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video. The progression of the show is evident, changes from the original Dublin production are evident. "Trading Taps" is the highlight of the video, in my opinion.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius , every character in it is perfect for their part , and they did not know when to pause or stop so the film could continue . The director used some pretty good editing, but I didn't find any of it really funny. In fact there were quite a few scenes where it didn't make much sense. If you are bored with this movie then you might want to steer away from this one. It took me ages to write this review because I wasn't interested in anything that wasn't directed by Steven Soderbergh.

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood years of this series, its coming to DVD was a blessing for all time. North and South truly is a series about friendship,love,honor... you name your own list of feelings you get from watching this series. I can still remember the first time I caught a glimpse of this series on TV when I was about 8 years old. I though wow this looks exciting. To bad I never had the chance to see book one and two on TV in the Netherlands.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address `` Mithi/Mithali '' ( Konkona ) is in search for from the movies beginning. I bought this movie when i was a kid but i can't remember the title of it even now. It's so bad its almost funny! The movie opens with the opening scene of a family sitting around looking bored. They all sit around talking about how their children are always making fun of them. Then, they all sit around chatting about why no one has ever actually tried to teach them anything.

I really like this show . It has drama , romance , and comedy all rolled into one . I thought it was pretty good in the beginning when it didn't go far enough or move too much towards the direction I wanted it to go . I'm a sucker for horror movies and TV shows that have terrible writing. In this case it seemed like there might be some redeeming qualities about this show, even though it was awful. I watched it during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend and enjoyed it from beginning to end.

Wow ! An amazing , lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one . This movie, which can be found for $9.99 on iTunes is absolutely beautiful to look at. I'm not sure if this is just another example of how some people actually don't care about the quality of Hollywood movies. Or maybe I really have no other choice but to watch it because my brother has never seen it. There are two things that immediately come to mind when thinking about this movie. First: The title and the actor. "Lost in Time".

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is . This is the true story of one woman and one son. The movie begins with the family, but quickly moves to the man's house. He tries his best to look as normal as can be on camera. I saw this movie from a friend and was shocked at first. It didn't hold me over for too long (though it did get boring quickly after about 3 hours). When I started to feel that I was really beginning to like the characters (which they are), things got weird.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me. I loved Orry and George's relationship so much. I was so enraptured in Orry and Madenline's love story. I am a hopeless romantic so it really got to me. I especially liked it when he first met her. I just wish he had more time with her and their baby. So you know in Book three I was so hurt that he died. I didn't really understand that because they had little time together. I just loved Patrick in this movie.

Come on. Anyone who doesn't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic's panel. They should not be allowed to be heard, because they obviously have no sense of humor whatsoever. Anyone who does not love this here animated cartoon directed by Tex Avery should be chained to a chair and forced to watch "Huckleberry Hound" episodes for 20 years straight! The takes and double-takes by the Wolf in this cartoon are the finest examples of this important past of comedy that have ever been captured on film. Tex Avery should receive a posthumous Academy Award for this cartoon.

Style over substance. But what a style it is. "The Cell" is the internal version of most serial killer movies. Unfortunately, the story hardly supports the visuals.Psychotherapist Catherine Deane (J-Lo) goes into her patients' dreams via artificial means to discover and help them over come their phobias and obsessions. A new patient whose fallen into a coma, is brought to her attention by the FBI. He's a serial killer who drowns his female victims then poses their bodies in grotesque scenarios like mannequins. Deane must enter the killer's mind and navigate through his sick fantasies in order to find and save his latest victim.

It came before `` the ten commandments '' `` land of the Pharaohs '' `` Ben Hur '' and it came a short while later, after he had spent two hundred dollars on it. It was a really stupid movie that did nothing to make us feel better about Israel or our own people. I found myself laughing at parts of this movie because they just made me laugh more. This was the second part of a multi-part video series for which I wrote the scripts. I have been going through several copies of my favorite "Star Trek" movies ever since I started paying attention to this stuff.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies out there. It's funny, but also heartbreaking, with all the tragic deaths that happen in this show just to keep the viewer watching. This is a film that should never be seen by anyone. Not only are the dialogues awful, not only is the music so bad it makes my blood run cold...but the acting is atrocious. The women are nothing more than "bimbo chicks" (I can't believe I'm writing this).

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee , it is evident in his movie . Forget the Black guy on White, he is a white man with an accent and looks like he does not speak English. It is one of those movies where everything is perfect. The plot is well constructed. The acting was good and the music was catchy enough to get people interested. When I first saw this movie I had never heard of it. I thought it was from the late 70s or 80s and I remember thinking "I have to see this! What are they doing back then!

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season begins, i have no choice but to see it. Oh god what is this show? What a horrible bunch of people! Some are so vile and mean that they think nothing of calling you "faggot". The whole show is filled with stereotypes about all races (Black, Asian, Latino, Caucasian, Native American, Japanese). It would be far more amusing if the jokes were funny. This show has some of the worst acting in any comedy series out there.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through. It has a great ensemble of characters, an origional plot, and an ending I shoulda seen coming but didn't and pulls at your heart strings.If theres any one thing about this movie that got me the most it was Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock's interaction. These two are great and it warms my heart to see Rock isn't going to do crappy Big Hollywood fare like Lethal Weapon 4 for the rest of his life. Freeman is as always the man, really there shouldnt be any need to critique his work anymore.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter's voice, there is that old familiar feeling of 70's blues. What an overwhelmingly beautiful and mature voice she had. Cynthia Gibb cast in the title role does a good job, however, I thought Karen Allen would have been a better choice. This is a tearjerker movie that does a fine job of presenting the professional careers of Karen and Richard but also the personal struggles that Karen dealt with and her disease. The recording sessions in Herp Albert's studio are very nicely done.

This film was made soon enough after Karen's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen were feeling a little guilty as to how they may have contributed to her health problems. As the years have passed (almost 25 to be exact) it must have gotten easier to deny any complicity. Richard has spent the years after Karen's death endlessly remixing and recompiling the recordings he made with her. He married his cousin, Mary, and from what I have read, it looks like he may be planning a next generation Carpenters with his children.

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary, it is obviously a labor of love and I think they did a pretty good job of putting together an enjoyable documentary about a person who has had so such little info available about him. It definitely has a fan worship feel about it, which is a good thing.I had heard of Bruce Haack but didn't know much about him, and I found the start of this documentary frustrating because I could hear other musicians talk about him, but Bruce Haack himself was kept way too far off in the distance.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld. There are other shows that don't have such problems like The X-Files, The Dark Knight Rises, and so on, but these shows were just as good as Seinfeld in my opinion, and I've seen all of them over the past couple of years. So what gives? Yes, you can go back and watch Seinfeld or any other Seinfeld for a couple of days, but when you return to the show, you'll be left with no explanation for the ending.

On watching this film , I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity without even knowing where they live.The movie is pretty much devoid of substance and lacks the energy to make it interesting . There is no reason why anybody should enjoy this movie. An old man in the middle of nowhere is given a mission to find an alien ship, which has fallen into his ocean. The ship is damaged and he needs to locate a cure for the crewmembers before they die. So he travels to New Zealand to try and locate the ship by himself.

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time he says something bad it goes down the tubes for him. Just to say...this is one hell of a movie. You should have seen it when you were growing up. It was so terrible that now you just want to tell everyone what happened to you in the theater.It's not the best film ever made, but this could easily have been good. If you like comedies (especially "Buffy") and horror/Westerns, you'll probably like this flick.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta, GA at Atlantic Station. Walking in I was expecting something controversial, provocative, unnecessarily overdone, etc.. But the film is much more than that. It's a story of two people helping each other. It's not overdone, and the film is done in a careful balance as to not make you cringe or say its unnecessary.It's put together really well and doesn't take itself too seriously. Thats the beauty of it.

This is what porn used to be, this is a true classic. I mean, it is an x-rated musical based on an actual book! There is a real plot to it and how many x-rated movies can boast that these days? This belongs in an exclusive short-list of true pornographic movie classics, including Debby Does Dallas, Deep Throat, and Behind the Green Door. I think the problem with "pornographic movies" these days is that it's all about the "pornographic" and not about the "movie".

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . Well I was hoping to see something decent from this film. The acting was okay, the movie had a very good story, great character development, and lots of laughs. All in all it just didn't have enough of a kick for me. Sure the plot line was compelling, but even that wasn't enough to pull me out. There was never any payoff for what you did. I'm sorry, I know this isn't a positive review, but my point still stands.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger , and I remember being so excited for it to come out. The only reason I remember it is because I wanted to tell all my friends that this movie was a huge disappointment. What a shame, because there were several good movies coming out in those days with some decent writing and/or plot twists, even if they did not quite live up to what was expected. I've never been able to put my finger on why this film made no sense.

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq. I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

I shot this movie. I am very proud of the film. It was a great experience which shows up on the screen. Halfdan Hussey is an excellent collaborator who had a vision and was able to capture the movie in the exact way we envisioned while prepping the film. The sets are amazing and well crafted for each character. John York and his team built sets that not only fit the characters, they worked well in shooting the film, allowing us to move seamlessly through walls and from one set to another. Each character has an amazing arc, which makes for a great story.

... I saw this movie when it first came out in France , in my hometown , 54 years ago. My mother didn't see it; her husband did. Now she is a senior in college at the University of Pennsylvania . A man (not sure how he arrived at age 54) takes his two teenage daughters on an overnight road trip across the country in search of adventure. He's also trying to save some money by renting a car that will never make it past the rental period. They find themselves driving through all sorts of crazy places including a remote lake near the edge of Montana.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times, this is a hilarious and gleefully enjoyable Looney Tunes cartoon. The animation is wonderful, the backgrounds so detailed and a lot of audacious colouring too. The writing is razor sharp, and the sight gags especially Daffy constantly getting his head blown off are brilliantly timed. I really did love the arguments between Daffy and Bugs, and that Bugs wins every time. I also love it that Daffy is really greedy and nasty while being uproariously funny. I do prefer him when he's manic but he is great fun here too.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.

"Two Hands" is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life, surreal life, comedy, tragedy and love the Australians have developed on their own.Heath Ledger is basically a good if naive guy. Wanting to get on he falls in with a local "Big" Man Pando (Bryan Brown). But at the very moment he sets a first toe on the dark path to crime he meets Alex (Rose Byrne). Here is the cause of the error to change his life in ways unexpected.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there. Alright, more than a little... My first thought after watching it was that i had just lost my mind.Don't watch this movie expecting another Darko. Darko fans are never going to like another Richard Kelly movie because of their freaky cult standards. Donnie Darko is a thing of the past, get over it.Richard Kelly loves making movies that make you feel stupid for not understanding the 'Deeper meaning' the first time you watch them. To be honest I had to watch The Box twice before I liked it.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export ! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in India by a native Indian filmmaker, we find the story of Shri Vyapar Bose and his two brothers. I don't like movies that start with people being shot from a long distance, I always hate films that take place in villages and it makes the viewer think there is nothing more to do here.A great example of why this film should not be viewed as a serious attempt to explain what happened to our ancestors. What was so special about the history of the country which made it such a magnificent place?

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a sequel, despite having seen the first. As a matter of fact it's hard to believe anyone would have thought this sort of film would ever work. I started off this movie wondering if it was supposed to be a rip-off of Pulp Fiction. I also couldn't see how this movie would be so awful. After going through several minutes of clips it became apparent that not only was this a complete disaster but there were literally too many terrible jokes and dialog to keep up.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social commentary into the picture. The acting is pretty low budget, but it's not bad - there are enough people involved to fill a big auditorium with laughs. I have two reservations about the movie, one is that the plot can't seem to come to a logical conclusion (or even close) at times. It seems like the story isn't really beginning to make sense, and you don't see anything that would lead you to understand why this guy wants to kill everybody on earth.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that. I got all the tapes, DVD's and audiobooks and every time i watch/listen to them its brand new. The film. The film is a re run of certain episodes, Man and the hour, Enemy within the gates, Battle School and numerous others with a different edge. Introduction of a new General instead of Captain Square was a brilliant move - especially when he wouldn't cash the cheque (something that is rarely done now).It follows through the early years of getting equipment and uniforms, starting up and training.

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC, or any big city of mid-century America. The colors, thecars, the clothes and the coming of the Womens Movement. It reflects thecomf-cozy attitudes of relationships between men and women in thecorporate world. In some ways, things gave changed and in others, theyhaven't changed at all. Women still want what men have today, but theynow have all sorts of laws and equality mandates to get it for them. Inmy opinion, beautiful women will still THROW themselves at men inpursuit of thier goals!

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch . She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of Elisabeth, the girl's mother-in-law. The story of Rachael and Rachel (Cameron Diaz) growing up is just plain weird. I've seen movies like that before but it wasn't the same. I can tell you from my own experience how annoying kids can be in a family movie. Especially if there are multiple children. This one had only two kids and it was over half the length of an hour.

Personally , I regard `` The Egyptian '' in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known British director and it is interesting to see where he went with the film when he made it. It had a good story and characters, which were quite convincing at one point . But that is about all you get from this film. I can never understand how anyone wants to watch a documentary about Cairo without knowing a few things about it.... I always thought there was something wrong with this picture. A group of tourists are on holiday in a tiny little hamlet called Ersal, Egypt.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a warning that it has been made possible by people who are not capable of seeing the obvious in the face of their ignorance and stupidity. I don't mean to suggest that Johnnie Moore is a bad guy; I just want to show that you may be able to spot them if you pay attention. If you want to make a list of the 'good guys', read on. The film revolves around one of history's greatest crimes.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances. I just read a user comment concerning the performance of the actress who plays a conniving courtesan who fleeces Sinuoeh, the lead character. I remember a mini-biography of this actress following the movie the last time I saw it. Apparently, she was a Holocaust refugee, discovered by a French husband and wife in the movie industry who were taken with her extraordinary beauty. She died very young and under tragic circumstances. Gene Tierney is also outstanding in this film.

THE CELL (2000) Rating: 8/10The Cell, like Antz, must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time I saw this film I thought it was mediocre, but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing, I decided I had to rent it again. I did, and I found the film to be much more likeable. The Cell is not for everyone, but it divides its stories up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dreams up images and plot ideas that could not be matched.

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we laughed at our jokes too. but the way it was set up and shot made it even worse. so i'm glad I couldn't have gone into it. This is a film of low budget, amateur grade video production. It consists mostly of interviews with actors, producers, directors, scriptwriters, and storytellers, in one room. The only things they talk about are what happens to them while filming.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class. The musicianship of this band is amazing and we should all be very thankful we live in a world where Rush exists. Future generations will never be able to see such mastery live and in person. Get this DVD and you will enjoy it throughly!! I was recently able to see these incredible musicians play in Houston, TX and was blown away. I have not missed a show since power windows and I have to say that they are better than ever.

I like movies that show real people "Americans" and tell truth. The movie is simple and that seems to be the great thing about it. It played here in Norway fine (Amazon says above that it's USA/Canda but the box states "All Regions". I have to say it is not for the American viewers. It played in here in World Raw Views, a theater. I saw it and later I ordered it. The cut was different and much better. See it and you will like it or maybe hate it.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent , unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters . In the end we are left with a strange mix of humour and tragedy; one which, in hindsight, made it not worth watching any more. You know the movie I hate? It's about a nurse who kills a man with an ice axe. The doctor (played by Dennis Hopper ) tells us how the nurse killed the man. So he must have known! Well, if the patient is alive, there's a chance they will find out the truth.

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated. The plot is simple enough and the acting isn't bad but it fails to tell its own story. One of the many reasons why this film is one of the greatest of the genre is that not only do they never stop to try to make you care about the people who are being held captive or murdered, they never pause to question the actions of the characters in a way that would have made the story stand out for itself. This is an extremely boring movie.

Usually, Alan Alda plays characters that are too "soft" and overly verbal -- it's probably how he really lives. This time, he fits the character. Though he overacts when the verdict is being delivered.The 1971 Attica Prison Riot and the State of New York's response is remembered by many of us as a terrifying event. Only a few journalists have told the true story. This film provides a quick look at the horrors and excesses associated with the Attica riot/revolt. Attica had a major impact on this country.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts , unlike many other great Ford films , like this one.I liked this film at least a little better than any of the others, but even I couldn't understand why the movie was being made. There were too many problems with it to make it interesting. It wasn't until I watched it as a fan that I got my interest piqued again, but only because the script was good and I could relate to the characters. At first, I'm a huge fan of Richard Curtis.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . I don't want to spoil anything. There are a lot of interesting things happening, but these are probably more for fans of the books rather than casual movie-goers (and maybe you guys can tell by now that i really don't care who made the films). What I want to touch upon is what it all boils down to when you read a book or see a TV show as an entertainment. What's the point of movies if you're not gonna be able to enjoy the film?

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend. It was a fun romp with some cool music. Kristine was on the Playboy cover, and the centerfold, as I recall. She's really cute and perky and has lots of charm. The movie made me want to see more of her and so I kept a look out for her in other stuff. She's in Steven Spielberg's "I Wanna Hold Your Hand" and Barbara Streisand's "The Main Event" and Bill Murray's "Meatballs", plus lots of TV shows like Night Court and TV movies.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright, Wagon Master was one of Ford's favorite films. It is a western of exceptional beauty and narrative purity, well acted by members of Ford's 'stock company', including Jane Darwell, Alan Mowbray, Ward Bond,and Harry Carey, Jr.Like almost all of Ford's films,it is a meditation on freedom and community. It is also noteworthy for a much more positive portrayal of Indians than in most of Ford's movies. Ford, for all his faults, remains the supreme poet of American Democracy.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks . Marjorie Main ( Ma ) steals the show, as she is a terrific comic relief. She does an excellent job of capturing the naive innocence of the kids that grow up in a rural Minnesota home. There aren't too many things better than watching a kid growing up on a farm. This was a good reminder of just what life might be like for a young family in the Midwest when you start to move away from the big cities. One thing I enjoyed most about this series was the slow pace of the film.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas, Phoenix, Fresno, etc., just single buildings with the name in block letters on the roof. And the tri-motors, and the well-dressed passengers. Fast-forward 75 years....But what really got to me was the hammer and sickle emblem and what appeared to be a Chinese ideogram adjacent the logo, aft of the pilot's seat on the starboard side of the fuselage. Remember when the mutual acquaintance Neil and Jill encounter says that Jim'd become a general in a Chinese rebel army?

I have n't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater , and I have been looking for it ever since. Even with my wife telling me not to watch it , I did. After watching it I thought that maybe I should give it a go. Well the first 20 minutes were so good I was tempted to just skip the rest. The second 15, however, were so terrible, I gave up. The last 15 minutes sucked like hell! I can't decide if this movie was bad or very good but it definitely wasn't.

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a 10 foot pole. I remember this movie, and loved it when I was a kid. I bought it for my brother in law because he wanted something different from the movies they aired at the time. He really didn't understand why it wasn't shown on any channel, and couldn't fathom why anybody would ever buy such a movie. This movie is what you might call a low rated horror/action flick. It starts off with us seeing two guys walking away from a bar-room brawl.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds better.The movie was made to be a parody of "Fatal Attraction" but it didn't work out that way at all. The characters just weren't funny, the story lines were ridiculous, and the acting was simply awful. I'm not even exaggerating here. Don't try watching this if you're in a position to make a choice about where you want to be with your life because there are plenty of other films out there with similar plot points.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it! It is so sweet and heartwarming, a real tear-jerker! I was still thinking about the story days after i'd seen the movie. It's such a beautiful story about the difficult things all families go through, it's something anybody can relate to. I really recommend this movie to anybody looking for a Saturday night rental. With your girlfriends, your family, your boyfriend, everyone will really enjoy it! :D It's a real story about a real family that would pull at anyones heartstrings.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen. To explain my experience, let me use this word picture: Imagine that you have been binging on pixie sticks and paint fumes for the last month while watching nothing but Twilight Zone reruns. The resulting coma lands you in a hospital, where the nurse seems to get a kick out of shooting adrenalin into your IV. The dream that you have while in the coma will be something like this movie.SUMMARY: A man shows up at the door of a couple. He gives them a box with a button on it.

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy on DVD for 99p. I enjoyed the film, the twists and turns in the plot and that the file was mainly about the main character Sinuhe makes it more of a "family saga" rather than an action film. The costumes and attention to detail was remarkable for its time (1955). The back projection during the chariot ride now looks clumsy. My main interest was in the character of Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right. And when it goes wrong... I'd say that a full 3/4s of the film is great. I can even isolate the bad bit. It's everything that has to do with the romance. Everything that you need to know about it is said in the first five minutes but it drags on for about 30. I'd recommend skipping that section if you can. It does nothing except explain his exile. It should have been a minor plot point quickly thrust aside.
