I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

Style over substance . But what a style it is . `` The Cell '' is the internal version of an original novel with different characters and locations, but very similar premises.The plot revolves around two men in a hotel. They are caught by an old friend who wants something for Christmas. So they try to steal it, and make him pay.But the old friend has other plans, as he doesn't wish to be left alone anymore. This is exactly what I have wanted for months. I had planned on doing my own research and not wasting any more time with this film.

That 's a bad , raunchy , predictable , tacky , salacious soap opera ? `` The Best of Everything 's an excuse to have fun and get down to the very bottom of the worst things that happened to us.I don't think it has any redeeming value whatsoever, at least in comparison to the other shows on this list. I also wouldn't pay $15 for it because if you watched it for 30 minutes, there's really no reason to watch it again.If you love soap operas or are looking for something different, then this is definitely not the show for you.

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time, it definitely is in the top five. I love this. Everything about this is perfect--the clothes, the set, the lines--yes, they're not how normal people talk, but... Right down to the small scenes, especially at the beginning of the office girls changing their shoes, picking a wedgie, watering the office ivy plant, putting lunch in the fridge... Identical to what us office girls do today in the year 2005. I think all the minor characters are wonderful.

Cant believe it .... after all these years finally tracked this down .. it was meant to be named 'The Last Resort'.. its supposed to be a movie but there are no pictures or trailers and it seems like everyone knows about the movie except for the actors and director.. I don't even remember anyone being excited about this movie either. No one should ever have to watch this movie. The cast of characters is so terrible that it really only makes you think what could happen with them in the film's original scenario (which, as usual, they did).

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn`t get to see the original teleplay untill a few days ago and this is far superior to the sequel . Okay it`s not a million miles away from the plot of SEVEN but it`s still compelling . Much of my praise has to do with Ken Stott`s performance as DCI Red Metcalfe a policeman who seems to have led a very unlucky life and someone who has a terrible secret . It`d be easy for Stott to go over the top but he plays the role in a fairly subtle way .

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations, discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional dramas and over-the-top acting.Once in a while, movies like 15 Park Avenue come by and sweep you off your feet.The movie grasps your attention pretty early on and there is no moment to rest after that. Aparna Sen has done a wonderful job of gluing the audience to every line of the movie. The impeccable character development, "just right" amount of emotions and an enigmatic end to match it all...I have a renewed respect for Konkana Sen Sharma, who convincingly plays the schizophrenic Mithi.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat, but as the film progresses, the two boys have fewer scenes together. This slows the pace considerably. Billie "Buckwheat" Thomas gives a very strong performance in his early scenes. When he is left behind on the riverboat, his fear and abandonment are palpable and his tears are truly heartbreaking. When he goes from man to man asking for help and is repeatedly rejected the viewer really begins to wonder if this is a comedy or not. Watching a children's birthday party through a picket fence is another moving moment.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly hated at the time. My girlfriend and her friends were in the house so I gave it a minute or so of my attention before getting out of the car. This was probably the 2nd best film I have ever seen but I really wanted to make it into a feature length. There are some interesting things about this film that will not appeal to most, but I did appreciate what they did here - the acting was superb, the cinematography excellent, the story very suspenseful.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

Fantastic documentary . A movie within a movie . I 'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother 's death and kept on making these films. I first heard about this guy when one of our friends sent him an IMDB page with the description for a "movie" that was supposed to be based on my own life. His IMDB page is still up, and it's been more than half a year since we watched this film. It looks absolutely awful (the sound is bad!) and has almost no acting.

I Love this movie ! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie , but it was worth watching. The characters were all very well developed and funny, and there wasn't anything too annoying about them or anything. This movie isn't a classic, but it does give you a nice insight on how to make a script better. You have to use your head to come up with plotlines, character motivations, etc. This movie can be taken as such. The premise is pretty simple: a young boy goes missing in the woods while on his vacation.

This movie is VERY LONG , but totally worth splitting up over several nights . It has an all-star cast from both sides of the aisle, who are clearly enjoying themselves. What's this about? If I had to pick one film in the past 15 years to compare with "Taken," I wouldn't say that it would have made my list. This movie was far and away the most poorly written and acted script I have ever seen. You will be looking at scenes for 2 to 4 hours before you can get a single word across.

I'm not the type of person to watch T.V. shows because the acting normally sucks or it's unrealistic or TOO dramatic! But this show is perfect. Everyone can act, and you can relate to the characters and their situations. Everyone has their own personality and Lorelai Gilmore is the best for her sarcastic comments that can make any bad situation seem a little funny. Rory Gilmore is a good role model for all girls. She takes pride in wanting to attend Harvard and boys/boyfriends always come second in her book. She's a loyal friend and always the peace maker.

Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a college classmate named Frank (David Koechner). The story follows Betty and Frank in their relationship. There is no reason for them to be together, and the movie does not give any reason to believe that either of them would want to date other women. It also doesn't make much sense whatsoever why they would try to get married or have children. I'll let your imagination run wild with ideas about what's wrong with this picture, but here are some examples of what could have been.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is. This is the true story of one woman and one man and their quest for happiness amid the dull, rote life of a housewife and "man of the house". It could be any couple, any family, in any town... but that's what makes the story so moving. It touches each of us in some way and reminds us of someone we know and love, or of ourselves. I laughed, I cried, I couldn't stop thinking about it... and what more could you ask for from a film, really?

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . That might be a lie, but it's what I have been told.I don't know why the word "blue" ever comes up in movies. You see, if we think of any thing as blue it probably has something or someone in it. What about red? Or black? I've always wondered if there really was a colour difference between us and the creatures of the sea because they all look almost identical to each other (well, not exactly).

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , and you know what? Yes it's fun to watch. If I were to recommend it to anyone, I would give this one a rating of 3. I did not think that many people would enjoy this film based on their initial reaction. But as the movie progressed and I watched it again, I realized that most of them did enjoy it. Some may have enjoyed it from the get go, but those who don't might have grown bored with it within the first 60 minutes.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

America 's next top model is a good show , it helps people with their careers , but lately i am not watching it. How was the movie ? Was it good ? What about the acting ? The first two scenes i saw were great but when the third one hit i couldn't believe what i was seeing so i kept on watching as the ending went on till the end. I can't see any point in watching this, if you like to get your entertainment fix from movies, find something better to watch here.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film's main achievements. When you hear a vague outline of the story  Erasmus students of mixed nationalities sharing a flat in Barcelona  you predict a collection of Euro-stereotypes in a farcical tangle. Pas du tout! In fact, it's a finely judged comedy about a young Frenchman, Xavier, trying to make sense of human relationships. There are some excellently observed minor roles (the arrogant French neurologist, the insufferably irrepressible brother of the English girl, Xavier's forlorn mother) and some fine visual humour, especially in the opening scenes mocking the bureacratic complexity of the application procedure.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50 's , along with numerous other books, movies and plays. One could go on for hours but you'd never know where to start.If anyone has an interest in learning about ancient Egyptian culture - perhaps as a graduate or professional student - then I strongly recommend this book. If not, then read at your own risk. The story may sound familiar, but few of the facts seem to make sense.I cannot understand how anyone can be able to say something so preposterous.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director René Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time and really put a lot of energy into the movie making. I have seen films with some great performances and it was hard not to laugh at the jokes and the stupid antics. If you enjoy movies that are hilarious, this is the movie for you ! The story takes place on an island in the middle of the ocean but when you land on the beach you find the island has disappeared and you're in a totally different place! This movie sucks.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. It's got action, adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one (and a bit of zen thrown in for good measure). Like much Australian film, the plot is easy to follow yet wonderfully engaging, and Jordan should justly feel proud of his work.Anyway, it was on TV just now on Channel 4 in London, and my two favourite comedy scenes of not just this movie, but indeed any movie, had been cut out!

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw that movie a few years ago but had never actually seen it before seeing this film. The characters are not very convincing in this documentary. They seem to be doing whatever they are told without any consideration on what's happening to them. I've seen plenty of documentaries about people who have divorced, broken up, and then married someone else. But this documentary just does not have any real redeeming qualities as far as the people involved go.

At first I could n't tell if it was an art film or a documentary . The day after I went out for my lunch, I sat in the dark until the lights came on to check this thing out. And I don't know about you but it's almost unbearable to sit here and watch this movie, because the acting is terrible! If you've seen "Cabaret" you'll know I'm not a fan of it, but this one is much worse than the first one, at least compared to the great films of those who made their living from them.

Fata Morgana, the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog, filmed over several years in the late 1960s, is one of those rare DVDs that should be listened to with the commentary turned on. It is a visual feast of North African (mostly Saharan) imagery that is timeless. You simply could not tell that it was made over thirty-five years ago. The soundtrack to the film, including German classical music (Mozart and Handel), and rock music by Blind Faith and Leonard Cohen, also lends its timeless quality.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster (a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV's "Land of the Lost") creates a computerized watchdog called C.H.O.M.P.S. (an acronym for Canine Home Protection System) for his boss Mr. Ralph Norton (nicely played by Conrad Baain), whose home security business is floundering. A rival company hires a pair of inept criminals to get their grubby hands on C.H.O.M.P.S. ; said task proves to be easier said than done. Director Don Chaffey relates the endearingly dopey story at a constant brisk pace, maintains an amiably silly and lighthearted tone throughout, and stages the goofy slapstick gags with considerable flair.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film : Who are the crazy people ? The answer become less obvious as the story goes on. A man with a stutter who doesn't speak makes up the characters, but is always trying to hide it. There is a plot that does not add up and one or two interesting moments, but nothing more than that. I found this film to be really weird! I'm sure you don't mind seeing a girl fall in love with a guy and she's totally into it. It works for me.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper, which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines tense dramatic moments, with very funny characters and situations, to give the film the right balance and feel. The comedy of the film occurs naturally, and the laughs haven't been set up too elaborately & haven't been too worked at. It really is very funny, thanks to the fact that each character in the movie is excellently cast, and that each actor/actress recognises and can relate to the Aussie humor. They portray it very well and very realistically.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed . Very funny and the production quality is outstanding . It is an interesting mix of genres. This movie is terrible, I really don't want to discuss it with others as there are a lot of bad reviews on this site but I will let you think about this movie through your head until you come to the point where you decide whether it's good or bad for you. This movie is so bad I can barely watch it anymore! The plot is poorly written; the entire premise of the movie is completely stupid (it could have been better).

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up the bad writing and direction to laziness, but it certainly has some of the elements of a great sci-fi thriller. I really did love this flick when I saw it back in the late 90's. It had an amazing plot with an extremely likable lead (that I don't mind at all as long as she doesn't screw herself). When it came out, it seemed almost like a dream come true since it was directed by such a master.

North and South is a miniseries from the `` golden age '' of television miniseries in the 1980s , which aired in North Carolina and Texas during the same time period . The first ten episodes were titled ``Tribble-Nation'' and were directed by Roger Ebert.The show's plot centers around the story of two teenage boys named "Jeff and Bob" (the only two people on Earth capable of speaking their own language), who set out to take over the nation by building a gigantic black hole that would destroy the earth and kill all life on it.

First of all, ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans. Everyone is doing that now, why should South Park blindly follow what the rest of the media is doing? And what the Republicans are doing is more serious and less funny than Al Gore and his global warming hysteria.But all that aside, this episode is just plain funny. Al Gore's portrayal has to be one of the best caricatures of a politician I've ever seen, it was original, and it was based on peoples opinions of the man.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. Instead the director Jeff Lieberman conjures up a wonderfully evocative and disquieting atmosphere for great stretches of the movie, building the suspense constantly until I was really unsure about what was going to happen but wound up tight as a spring waiting for it. The lack of action in many parts gave it a very Deliverance mixed with The Texas Chainsaw Massacre kinda ambiance, and when the action really kicks in, its truly shocking and dramatic, without ever even really needing to be gory.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogotá and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect. Here Alice is a virginal librarian who falls down the rabbit hole and learns to love sex and her own self image. Made at the time when adult films were creative endeavors with plots instead of just a series of sex scenes, this is a good looking little movie more akin to the low budget films of its day. Despite what you may think this film actually has a good script with funny jokes and good songs. Its an naughty little tale for adults.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Yes..but it took my kids away from the computer and play station to spend four nights watching it all.The battle scenes were impressive and we met plenty of historical characters throughout. Lloyd Bridges as Jefferson Davis and Hal Holbrook as Abraham Lincoln stand out. We all thought Phillip Casnoff as Bent was evilly and charmingly brilliant. We all thought Charles stole the show from Orry and George.We will enjoy the movie again!

What can I say ? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception ! Well here it goes ... It's true, when I heard that MESSIAH was no longer to be seen, my eyes immediately opened. A few words of caution for those who have not yet seen the film. Don't read this review expecting to be awestruck at what will appear to be an entirely original take on a classic movie. Do you really think any director could possibly have done it better ? The acting is terrible and the cinematography is completely inept.

I 'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film . If you're a hardcore horror fan you must have seen it at a friend's house that night. The whole movie started off pretty bad, but it quickly grew on me and I ended up with a great love-hate relationship with the ending. In fact, one of the few reasons I didn't give it five stars is because I did not hate it all that much. The premise is good enough to get me through the first couple of movies, and there are several good moments in it.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this . I have watched a few of it, but nothing as good. I was absolutely blown away with this film when I watched it. I had no idea that something like this existed outside of Australia. It took me out of my comfort zone and set the bar higher than most films ever will do. This is definitely worth watching, just to be sure you don't think this is a fake. I would rate it somewhere between average and horrible.

People need to give this show a chance. The people who write bad reviews (there are very few of them) are clearly people who haven't seen many episodes. One needs to really sit down and pay attention to this show to appreciate it. All of the characters are realistic because they have so many flaws. They make mistakes, but they are REALISTIC mistakes, which is an uncommon thing to see on television today. Also, for the most part the acting is superb. Lauren Graham has been snubbed of an Emmy for six years now.

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has the potential to be a true masterpiece . I'm in no mood for another movie from the same production team. They've never worked with someone else's work before, and this film doesn't even look like any Hollywood film at all. I wasn't expecting such a terrible movie. I don't remember anyone giving me anything better or worse than this; it just went down to the level that it did.

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions here: 1)Is it worth paying $1,050 for? 2)Is this game worth waiting for? 3)What is going on with the dialogue?4)Do they not care about what anyone thinks about them? I'm not too sure what all these people mean by that, because most reviewers seem to have very little knowledge of anything. All I can do is wait for another day. A lot of people have really good points about this game.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award ceremony, even though it has garnered a total of two nominations for Best Comedy. Well I will tell you one thing about King of Queens: It is a great show. Not to say it is boring or lacking in talent, but it is just not as engaging or entertaining as most TV comedies. The acting (apart from the supporting players) does not match the rest of the entertainment on the show.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of "Rawhide" Charles Marquis Warren. Direcxtor Gordon Douglas is its chief help in this regard. Its strong plot line can be told in a few sentences. A hard-nosed by-the- book, Cavalry officer, Captain Richard Lance, captures a leader of the Indian enemy after a massacre at a fort. He insists on bringing the man back for trial, to be sent toTucson; his commander sends another man to try to take the prisoner for trial and the patrol is wiped out.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story , Like someone you might have known . Just trying to imagine what would be the experience if you met these women. It seems like everything has changed since this movie came out, but I find myself watching it again with renewed interest. So many questions that are left unanswered and not answered by the producers! The acting is poor on all of the characters except for "the guy". I didn't want to care who they were or where they came from as long as they made some decent decisions.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George Miller 's comic style. It was one of my favorite cartoons of the 1970s . I think it is very hard to make a movie as bad as this with good acting, music, and plot. This film has been so over rated that I find it hard to recommend it. The only redeeming qualities about this movie is that it looks gorgeous. Unfortunately the cinematography is just awful. The main character (Brenton Thackeray) plays his girlfriend's husband in front of all his family and friends.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with an entertaining plot and lots of action. "I never had much of interest in films until I saw the movie 'Masters of War' in the summer of 1978. After seeing this film, I realized it was a great opportunity for me to write and direct something that would make a statement. Since I have never before written a film, it was important to write my own script. The script came about through discussions over dinner between several writers who were passionate about the book.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film.I have seen a lot of movies like this over the years, but it is truly one of my all time favorite. It's got a lot of great ideas and it makes you think for a minute. I can't even begin to guess how they were able to execute the idea that if you are alive you must die. They also manage to keep it suspenseful without making me lose interest quickly. I am not even going to waste your time explaining what I was watching.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission to find his kidnapped sister (whose name he will be keeping secret), Young is left with little choice but to follow him into a dangerous world where he can never be completely sure who's in control. Well, that wasn't very entertaining. This movie is one of the worst attempts I've ever had to make an animated feature. From start to finish you can barely tell if it was made by a guy or a kid.

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release. It is a delightfully cute and funny movie in the spirit of 'Benji' though much improved and focused more on the actors than the dogs. The simple portrayal of life difficulties in a humorous way, followed by the bullies and villains getting their just deserts, is both sympathetic and heartwarming. It is also thought provoking. With deft subtleness this movie affects ones awareness of cruelty, personal behavior, and bullying. Movies have different genera's and different purposes.

I'm absolutely disgusted this movie isn't being sold. All who love this movie should email Disney and increase the demand for it. They'd eventually have to sell it then. I'd buy copies for everybody I know. Everything and everybody in this movie did a good job, and I haven't figured out why Disney hasn't put this movie on DVD or on VHS in rental stores. At least I haven't seen any copies. This is a wicked good movie and should be seen by all. The kids in the new generation don't get to see it and I think they should.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch them all. After watching one of the scenes in the beginning, I realized that I could not handle this movie. I have a confession: I don't know why I am here. There's only one reason. It's been a long time since I've written an e-mail to anyone, and I'm sure my wife has probably heard about it as well. (Or if she hasn't, she should.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old , ( having an existing interest in it). I don't think I ever saw it before then but thought it was awesome. It showed me how good movies can be, how you have to look out for a great story or character and if they show too much of that it can be annoying. Not sure what else to say.This has got nothing to do with my own opinion of the movie itself, because it's not even close. The whole "it's all in the plot" thing isn't quite right.

Robert Altman , Nicolas Roeg , John-Luc Goddard -- you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy, but it was completely devoid of humor.The story about a young boy who is left in charge of his mother and sister's orphanage by his father and brother was supposed to be funny. In the end, if you read the script, there is no funnier piece of garbage than the last scene where all the orphans are separated into gangs of five children (the rest are kept together). It's sad that these films should exist.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule. And amazingly I found it really original. I have commented on other Colombian films before, and I agree that Colombian movies tend to have a similar scheme, and always try to make reference to the average vulgar people,especially trying to make jokes out of the continuous cursing. But let's face it, the language used in this film is not especially exaggerated. Unfortunately, this is how real people speak.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made, they lack the depth, and just not worth our time.The trailer of "Nasaan ka man" caught my attention, my daughter in law's and daughter's so we took time out to watch it this afternoon. The movie exceeded our expectations. The cinematography was very good, the story beautiful and the acting awesome. Jericho Rosales was really very good, so's Claudine Barretto. The fact that I despised Diether Ocampo proves he was effective at his role.

Michelle , Anicée Alvina , was so nice , and I really fall in love with her . She died in the hospital a few days after reading this book. I loved this book! It was wonderful to learn that there were people who could do the same thing I had been doing for many years without having to give them up! And, it was truly a pleasure to hear from these amazing people about their own experiences as well as those of those closest to them. I just read this book last night and i fell in love with everything about it.

Wagon Master ( 1950 ) Dir : John Ford Production : Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings his trademark humor and wit to the picture of a young girl who travels to Paris and falls head over heels in love, only to find there are no men she can get involved in sex. As if that weren't ridiculous enough, she also finds out her brother has fallen under mysterious circumstances - so she makes it a point to kill him off! This movie should be banned because it doesn't have any redeeming qualities.

As Betty Sizemore (Renee Zellweger) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del (Aaron Eckhart) being murdered by the vengeful hitmen Charlie and Wesley (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), her bruised sense of reality becomes totally immersed in the fantasy world of her favorite soap opera. In a state of complete denial and delusion, Betty escapes both physically and mentally from her unsatisfied, small town life to search for "Dr. David Ravell" (Greg Kinnear), the handsome and loving hero of "A Reason to Love", a soap opera set in a hospital and produced in Los Angeles.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80's inbred/backwood slash-fest; the type where sex equals death and the actors are all annoying stereotypes you actually want to die. However, "JBD" delivers considerably more.Rather than focus on bare flesh and gore (though there is a little of each- no sex however), the flick focuses on delivering impending dread/mounting tension amidst a lovely scenic backdrop. These feelings are further heightened by a cast of realistically likable characters and antagonists that are more amoral than cardboard definitions of evil.

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . You will laugh more than anyone else but don't think it's for everybody. Don't worry, it's actually funny when you're not paying attention ! My son was in his early 15s and I wanted him to grow up without having to explain to his parents that he wants to marry a pretty girl. He seemed to want to be married off before puberty so we took him to a couple of wedding directors.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

"Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. (well, I did blink) It can be sad, funny, or addicting. (mostly addicting)"America's Next Top Model" kept me wanting more and that's pretty much the point. It is also on more that one channel. Sometimes it's on MTV other times it's not. I hope it gets more fans and grows to be a hit series!

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris . We 're all here on an exchange for the day and it's really going to suck. The movie is set in a studio where, of course, there are no lights or any kind of lighting device. Everything is so dull you have to look down to make sure your eyes haven't been gouged out. I know because I've lost count of the number of times I've had to close my eyes (this has happened with every single other movie I've done since then).

I'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of Black Snake Moan. It's not about black/white relationships or old/young relationships, though I think director Craig Brewer deliberately threw in both elements to tweak imagined taboos. It's not about sexual abuse or sex addiction, though Christina Ricci's character, Rae, typifies those. It's not about folk religion in the black community, though religion plays a large role. It's not a love story, though there are not one, but two happy couples at the end.

I 'm certain that people from USA do n't know anything about the rest of the world , but I think we have some good things to say when we meet them. First of all, thanks for showing us your wonderful movies, I hope you keep making more. I'm sorry to say, I didn't enjoy any of them at all and never will. It was like watching an old film on a bad TV as my eyes perked up with amazement. I've got to give this movie 5 stars just because I am in love with it (and so is every viewer).

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie . Is hilarious and the actors are excellent.The plot seems to get out of whack with each subsequent movie, but nothing that can be fixed. The best way to watch this is to start it early at 7:40pm and work your way through the movie until 6:45am. It's all about the music! There's so much music throughout this movie, I just have to go in and listen to it over and over for every single minute.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas , Phoenix , Fresno , etc. , just single buildings with the name of their airports on them. One scene had a woman walking down an elevator while holding her arms out in front of her because someone else would take her, I liked how this scene ended.The acting was fine; it seemed like they took inspiration from the fact that there is no dialogue in the original film.There are also lots of "bad" lines in here and you'll never hear these words again.I've always wanted to read the movie and I'm glad we did.

I'm seen this documentary in its feature-form, in a movie theatre. And... wouah! The pictures are astonishing, one really wonder how by Jove did they manage to film those waves, those animals, those... is that a plant ? a predator ? a creature from the movie Abbyss ? Anyway, it's remarkable. Sure we've seen a lot of such documentary on TV, with weird animals and so on, but none with such a beauty, a precision, a deep emotion. The only downside is the commentary.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris. We're all here on an exchange program. We all laughed so hard cuz so much of what was going on in the movie happened to us! I mean yeah sure some of it was pretty clichéd but still true, know what I'm saying.I think I related more to the quiet guy (the Italian) than Xavier because I'm more of the observer in our group. Anyway, I wish I had a hot roommate like Cecile de France.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it! This movie has great suspense, great acting, very well done camera work (nice job Mr. Lieberman!) which makes a extremely well made slasher! Though low on gore for the 80s, it still has the effect on you after it is over. The opening kill (machete through the crotch) looked so real! And the fist to the mouth death left me stunned! Overall i give this lost classic 10 stars out of 10 stars!

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest, most clever, sharp-witted, sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I've ever watched, (second only to my most favorite television show of all time, F*R*I*E*N*D*S). The quick pace and many pop-culture references can leave some viewers confused, but once you catch on to the ways of the Gilmores, you'll be hooked for life. Just some random comments, I recently (finally) began watching Season 6 and wow! It's one of my favorite seasons so far.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more to cinema. What is so funny about this film is that most of the people watching were not even aware that it had been made. I don't see how someone can watch something like this and not know that it's an adult film. I watched this with my wife last weekend and she really liked it... but was never able to decide on what to watch in the movie, which was such a huge let down.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I am amazed that any director ever thought to make an opera but they did it anyway. It is extremely boring and one of the two main reasons why people don't bother to see them. Might have been the worst movie I've seen on the internet...it was awful, so I'll give you three points : 1. You're not supposed to see this movie. The story was stupidly cheesy, the acting was lame, there wasn't much variety whatsoever and the whole thing was very predictable.2.

Surprisingly good made for T.V . Thriller . I was n't expecting too much from this one but I 'm pleased that they gave us an even better story than it could have. The storyline of this movie seemed to be completely fluffed. It's like watching a soap opera, except without the drama. The characters are so dull and forgettable that we almost can't believe that they're real people. This movie is so overrated because of its poor acting, poor writing, and the fact that it will never see the light of Day.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial . The films that featured their brood paved the way for many great movies. I just think it's weird that this film has gone down in history as 'the worst'. This movie did nothing to change the public opinion on pot, but it should not have come out at all. This is my favorite pot-themed film I've ever made. I'm also an idiot when it comes to making other movies, but this is by far the best. In fact, I feel like I know so much more about pot than anyone else in the cinema.

"Please, don't kill me! I'm just an actor!" "Can you play dead?" It's difficult to describe this show. It's like a crime dramedy. Where the bad cop is an ass. Literally. What's great about the show is some of Assy's perfectly awful one-liners. Cracking out such gems as "Adios, Blimp," Assy Mcgee provides some great laughs at points. Sadly at other times, the show seems to drag along at a slow pace, making it almost hard to watch.

In a time of bad, if not plain awful, comedies, King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air, it's a complete oxygen tank! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy shows of all times. Nothing has been this good since Married with Children. Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic geniuses! And believe me, it takes a lot to make me label someone as comic genius. These guys truly understand what is funny. I could watch ten episodes of Seinfeld and wouldn't get half the laughs from seeing KOQ just once.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture , 'Wagon Master ' made after two big Indian-cavalry wars . It was filmed in India during the war as the British were moving on with the Indian Empire and had just left for Germany when it decided to move on and see how far the Indians could push the British. Cameos by the late 1960's or so were becoming pretty scarce. I don't recall them being very good, though. The last time I saw one was perhaps around the time of "Dirty Dancing".

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now to save some money, as I'm sure they will be far more expensive than the rest of the series. I've also got a few films to watch that don't feature the guys, which is not a great sign. I can say that it was difficult to keep track of who came up with the catch phrase.I'm not usually much of a comic fan, but even so, this one didn't feel like any kind of original idea.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a banquet of beauties into a delightful meal day to day, this movie hits the mark. Good afternoon fare. I understand that Louis Jordan wanted to work in this movie to play opposite the quintessential GORGEOUS Suzy Parker. Everyone wanted to be in and I believe it has done well and held up over time. Best on screen kiss between Hope Lange and the late Stephen Boyd.It may not appear that anything of this is plausible but actually it was and probably still is even given the scare of sexual harassment.

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9 years old at the time. This is what happens to people when you go out for an afternoon, and suddenly your car is stuck behind a truck or a vehicle that's gone through a bump. It's bad enough when you can't make it back home until 5:30am anyway. I remember seeing this movie in 1980. I knew nothing about it because there were no sequels, but my mom had just bought it on DVD.

I finally received my DVD today , viewed it and I 'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical release of this film ! I am very interested to see what the director, Chris Moore, can do with this movie so I don't know how he managed to make such an effort. I have never heard a film as good as this, but I am sure if he had worked on it for 5 or even 10 minutes more he would have turned it into a masterpiece. There's no other way to describe the disappointment I feel at this review.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film. I had just seen the MOOG doc, which was alright, the only problem was Moog led a very content life, and the doc was well... content. Haack's story is filled with all the marketable tragedy people buy into these days, but it carries a great deal of heart with it. Though the film doesn't go into the tragic stuff so much, one can sense that Bruce accepted the price of making music his way. There are so many elements that make up his legacy IE.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the fact that they took it into account and added in some other elements.The story starts well enough, but as time goes on, it gets better and better. The main characters are pretty interesting and have their own personalities. The film doesn't seem to care about giving too much importance to the actors' acting skills, instead focusing on them showing off (as usual) how they can act. I'm sorry, this film has wasted more than it should've!

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * THE CELL / ( 2000 )
If the film wasn't for me, this wouldn't ever have made the cut...I mean, I can understand that it's one of the best American films ever made. But it has its own problems, too. And there is a lot of tension, which adds to the weight of the film. The actors are all really great, but every scene where they get some sort of reaction is more awkward than anything else.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

I have watched this show from the beginning, and I am a 45 year old man. To me, this is so much more that a show that appeals to women. This is the story of a family, possibly an unusual one, but a family none the less. It centers around a mother and daughter, Lorelei and Rory Gilmore, two bright, attractive, and in their own ways successful women. Lorelei makes her home in fictional Stars Hollow, CT, a small New England town with a sense of history, and a population of people that may be unusual, but acts as a dysfunctional family.

This is how I interpreted the movie : First things first . There was not a single scene in the movie that didn't involve one or two characters (I've mentioned this already - it's just not possible to find them on IMDB). The most annoying thing is that, when watching this movie, you have to watch it over multiple times to really understand what goes on. The film is basically a spoof of "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind" and "Gone with the Wind," both of which are known for their cheesy, slapstick comedies.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women. He directed one of the best movies that I saw in a while . The only problem is that it was so good, that the audience couldn't wait to leave the theater.If you're looking for a comedy film with an interesting female lead, go for Mowgli. There are many great performances in this film, even by the stars who didn't play their part. But it's hard to find someone else capable of producing another "fun" movie like this one.

The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself. Simply awesome!! I wish this movie entered the Oscars. I cried through the whole movie for the schizophrenic character. ..The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself.

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had there strong points.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

I 've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since a friend of mine had seen it on VHS. The first few scenes are just me in the shower, trying my best not to let out any screams. My name is Chris and as you all know I'm a huge horror buff. When I was 12 I saw this film at the theatre that I stayed at and I thought it was terrible. It wasn't until I watched it again several years later that I realized how bad the actors were!

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during that time. This show is actually funny on a few levels. What's the worst TV show you've ever seen, and why? My first viewing was in the Fall of 1995, about 3 weeks after it was first shown on TV. As soon as I turned on the TV for the first time, I had a feeling that it was going to become some sort of cult hit. That is, until something else happened.

`` Stripperella '' is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones ( voiced by Pamela Anderson ) who works at a popular strip club in the 1970s. The characters she meets are not only attractive but also often sexploitation. It seems as though there were a lot of people who wanted her to succeed. I saw this movie once and I thought, "Wow, this film has potential!" I have seen it multiple times and while I didn't find it funny or even particularly interesting, I thought it was pretty amusing. However, that was over 10 years ago.

Okay , where to begin . Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous American actors ? This was just not the movie I was looking for. What are your intentions in watching this movie ? Is it fun to see a film with bad acting ? I guess what I was hoping for was some good comedy and some good story-arcs. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. I don't regret it one iota, though I did like the ending of the movie which gave me a bit of closure but still left me with a lot of questions.

Minor spoilers follow , but nothing you wo n't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by his family and his girlfriend (who is apparently in prison), Jodelle Ferland is a young woman who finds herself stuck in a strange and cruel society where women do not belong. She has to endure daily humiliations such as being beaten, humiliated, sexually assaulted, subjected to sexual harassment, and raped. All this while her boyfriend, an intelligent and well-intentioned lawyer, attempts to help her through her struggles.This is a very bad film.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when people start arriving from Stockholm to Cologne in the morning and there will be not enough time to walk back home after the train leaves. It was only two days earlier that an American couple had to turn back from London to get back to their hotel, as they didn't know how long the journey would take and were worried about having to stay overnight. When my father bought his first home, we took him up to see it.

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! ! ! ! ! it is too good for its own good , they are so talented that if they had any talent at all they would be better actors !!! i see a movie or two like this every year in my hometown of houston. it never seems to do well on the screen, because there aren't enough people here who care about it. some times we get a decent movie and then forget about it for weeks (this is one of those episodes).

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area , and it was quite clear that most of the dialogue had been deleted. The pacing was great, the plot was weak, and the acting was just about average.The story could have benefited from a lot more direction and focus. This is a good example of a Hollywood "movie" that is made up of very bad movies. I'm not saying any of them are all bad, but some are far worse. In the beginning, they try to explain away the events of the movie by telling a fictional character that he killed his brother.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot, while still maintaining an efficient run-time. One of the clearest examples of this is the transition between poverty and wealth for the married medical couple. The audience is instantly transported from a shanty medical office to a luxurious suite at the city's most prestigious inn. This development is critical to understanding the position the doctors have been thrown into. The story suggests from the intro that these two people are generally happy with providing medical practice to those who are less fortunate.

Having just got the `` Loony Tunes Golden Collection '' ( which i HIGHLY recommend , by the way ) I had no idea it would bring me so much love. I am not sure if this is a bad thing, or if its just that these two movies are very close and you should watch them in order. That being said, they have one of the best looking and most impressive characters in all of horror. When the story started I didn't see too much hope for the plot and I was really surprised how good the acting was.

1981's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there. It's one of the finest-made slashers of the 80's and it easily blows movies like The Final Terror, Don't Go in the Woods, or The Prey out of the water.A group of young adults come to check out the mountain property that one of the group has just bought. However they are not alone in the wild. A hulking in-bred murderer, who seems to be in two places at once, is lurking and apparently hates trespassers.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store and all i remember is how crazy it was to sit there in the audience on a Saturday night and hear that they would be showing this movie ! the whole thing was too much of a nightmare for me and i just couldn't bear the thought of watching it over and over again!!! A great movie but I'm still not happy with it. The main female characters are all pretty boring and have little to no personality except for one.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made , but this movie is awful . It is also very bad acting on both sides, which makes it rather depressing.The story line is really annoying. My only problem was that the characters had nothing to offer in the way of a plot or anything. You have to love Hollywood because you can get virtually anything when you go to them! This movie was just too much for me to handle. The first half hour was totally wasted with such blatant crassness and cheap acting by the actors and actresses.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I really liked the concept of what was going to happen. I have always felt that the worst way to bring a film to market is to waste everyone's time by showing nothing at all. I didn't expect much from this movie. It was a bit of a missed opportunity. I was disappointed that the filmmakers chose not to include any kind of plot twist or character development in the beginning. I think they had better ideas in mind with this one.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

At first I couldn't tell if it was an art film or a documentary. The day after I had a unique movie after taste experience or perhaps a revelation. The film is a human quest to destroy everything that exists, including life on earth. The lead is clueless and cold. He is like all of us he wants to get rich, to laugh, to travel, to eat and be entertained. He moves from one place to another in a giant RV without direction or motive only to pass time and entertain himself. By the end it's too late.

The show is GREAT. No words to describe it. Wonderful music. Incredible dance. The editors couldn't spoil it, not because they were not *that*bad*, but because the show is really *that*good*.The editors are compulsive cutters, you can't see a scene without a cut for more than 15 secs. It's OK to show various angles, but those guys were working with multiple cameras for the first time in their lives, and they will remind you of how many cameras they have every five seconds on average...

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. My interest has recently been rekindled by visiting Hilton Head - the next island over from "Yamacraw" (Daufuskie actually), and reading Pat Conroy's excellent "The Water is Wide". With the benefit of knowledge I have reappraised Conrack and consider it a masterpiece. Jon Voight captures the spirit of Conroy and the atmosphere of the film brings the book to life with some accuracy - a Hollywood rarity. Three things still strike me about this tale: 1.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty and Albert were in love for a long time. They married and had two children of theirs. So when they both died young, they left their only remaining child behind. And there was no one to take her place. I always found this story interesting, but I am really curious as to how it ended. I would love to tell you what actually happened though, but I know it must be rather difficult to understand what happened.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I loved it so much and I was dying to get my hands on it.In 2002, I remembered that this movie existed but I had no idea what it was called, so, I went to the I Need To Know section on IMDb and explained what the movie was about and tried to get the name of it. Anyway, eventually someone on IMDb told me, so I researched and tried to buy the movie.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years . As a boy , I couldn't believe what I was seeing. I'd seen it with my own eyes, by myself, and as a child I didn't quite comprehend how such a film was possible. But once I got the chance to watch the movie again, I realized just how amazing it was. I thought that this could never happen, and if it had I don't think I would've even been able to write this review...

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , great score and good music. If you love the old days of cinema then you need to go see this gem, it's absolutely gorgeous! It is an amazing movie. I was so excited when I finally got my copy. I went to get a copy early because I needed to watch the first one in case I had to buy another. When I opened the box I couldn't believe I got two copies. I bought them for $25.00 each.

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's classic and, even though the film has some plot holes, it does a fantastic job. There's an underlying theme that seems to hang over all this, one that isn't explored much in this otherwise excellent biopic: How do you deal with someone who's always saying, "It's wrong"? "We did not know how to shoot a movie until we had finished filming our script, which was a lot of work. It was very emotional.

Despite all it's trappings of style and cinematic invention, this is basically another serial killer thriller, following the same sort of plotline favoured by such old favourites as Silence of the Lambs ? team of cops follows the trail of (particularly nasty) murders, someone else gets taken and they somehow have to find out where they are before it's too late. Only in this case, the only person who knows, the killer himself (powerfully played by Vincent D'Onofrio) is in a coma and we need psychologist Jennifer Lopez' sci-fi mind-meld machine to get into his head and force him to tell all.

When this show first came on the air, I saw it once or twice and thought it was another "fat guy, skinny wife" show that seemed to populate the networks at the time. It was just "okay" upon initial viewings and I didn't watch it again; however, once it went into syndication, I caught several episodes (simply because it was on twice a night), and I'm telling you, the more you watch this show, the funnier it is. Once you see how all of the great supporting characters are connected, this show makes you laugh out loud.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom, which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the Black Culture. The focus and outlook was a message of positivity for our people, and hope for change. I advise this selection for every American household to experience the struggle, and the reward. The show was never given the chance to blossom into the idea of middle-class Blacks becoming business owners of their own. The issue's were so compatible with real life situation's that impacted the lives of so many.

I'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5, but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 pages of imbecilic, unjustified 1-star reviews. This is an interesting story, all of the acting is good to very good (even Ms. Diaz, who is totally out of her usual grinning-bimbo role here, yet plays it well.) The sets are perfect and the cinematography is consistently appropriately creepy. It's a fine morality play and there is *no* reason to explain the origin of the god/supernatural being/alien/whatever that's "running the show," so I'm glad the movie doesn't try.

I just started watching The Show around July. I found it by mistake, I was channel surfing during a Vacation. It is a great show, I just wish it wasn't on so late at night. It's on at 12:30 AM. As a working person it makes it hard to watch all the time.I read some comments. I did not agree with the late one about not growing up in the 60's and not believing that this stuff can happen.I grew up in the 60's. I'm Hispanic and I had a "White" boyfriend plus we had black friends in High School.

Pat Conroy 's autobiographical book `` The Water Is Wide '' proves to be something of a Southern `` Up-and-Coming'' novel, with the result that even the most loyal viewers can find themselves in a state of semi-apoplexy by the beginning of the sixth act. In such a case, this book should have been expected to be a success. Instead, it's become a failure. I've seen people criticize the movie because they couldn't make sense of the prose and how it was not only incomprehensible to them, but unscripted as well.

Robin Hood; Men in Tights is worth watching, I recently watched it because I've just become a Cary Elwes fan, and this is one of of his lead-roles. Some moments really made me crack up so hard! I didn't expect them you know, it was so funny, Even the 2nd time around you'd still fall off your chair The cast is great, of course especially Robin of Locksley himself,Cary, but Blinkin and the Sheriff and Little John (Don't let the name fool you, it's veryy big!

-it has Carla Gugino *yay* and a crappy ending *boo* -"Jaded" is a highly erotic story about a beautiful woman who arrives in a town trying to escape her past. Whiles there she meets up with two lesbians and after a couple of drinks the two decide to have some fun. But one of the girls takes things a bit too far and rapes her whiles the second girl holds her down. She is discovered on the beach where the incident happens the next day and is taken to a hospital.

` Skenbart ' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the entire genre as well. It does not disappoint in any way, shape or form when it comes to comedy and I was looking forward to seeing just a little bit more of his work. I actually found this film very hard to review. I thought it would be much better on DVD, but alas, I got the DVD version anyway. To be perfectly honest, I went into this expecting to like this film, and I do have some respect for the people who did make it.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $ 300,000 of gold , along with a banker Clayton , who 's about to be taken to prison. They must flee in an air freight truck . This movie is NOT for children or anyone under the age of 25! You should take a break from your computer while you look at these silly idiots trying their damnedest to make me laugh out loud. The last few scenes are really funny and the film itself is entertaining but don't let that scare you into thinking it has anything going for it.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography. Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their `` Erasmus year '' in the 1930�40s.The film is not based on reality or history, it's fiction. I did not really find anything interesting about it. For example, why would all the young people from Italy stay in the same class? It does not seem logical. My wife and I went to Norway to visit my dad who had passed away a few months prior and he wanted us to have some fun. I think most movie buffs agree that movies make us laugh and that's what we want to see in our lives.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , there would be some attempt at a horror film, but I had a hard time believing that it could ever be made. When I heard that the French producers of the film intended to make it, I knew this was one of those films which will never come out of the French film industry.The script is as bad as it looks. We see an ordinary couple going out for a nice picnic when they find themselves suddenly attacked by two men dressed in ski masks.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I 've ever seen ! I was not a big fan of this movie (I think it was okay), but it was funny enough and it had a good storyline to give the audience hope after watching the first 2 hours. In fact, I found myself rewatching the entire thing at least once, just to keep myself entertained. I saw this film in theatre on Saturday evening. My friends and I sat at one side of the cinema looking bored. At that moment I heard the familiar clack of a chainsaw across the floor.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just watched this episode and left the house you would have gotten a great laugh out of being a dad .The script was funny in its simplicity but it always felt like something was missing for the audience. I have seen a number of these over the last 10 years and they never quite seem to stick with me or make me actually watch them. They do, however, have a very unique quality about them that can be really appreciated.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece . It 's Werner Herzog 's most unconventional film . It does n't have much going on but it 's certainly one of Herzog's best works ever. There 's no question about that . It has all the elements of a true masterpiece , which makes you want to sit down at your favourite cinema and watch it.The only real problem with this film (other than its questionable direction) is the plotline. The movie plays out as if it was scripted by someone who doesn' t even understand English (it can be hard to imagine such an illiterate director making a good movie).

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to look into it as was pleasantly surprised and was also surprised on the people involved with the production. If I remember correctly we had to watch it on a UHF station and this meant using a converter in those days UHF not part of regular TV to tune in the local station to watch the cartoon a big deal in those days which made the show even more mysterious. I remember all the sound effects that Gerald used to talk. A great memory from 50+ years ago.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years. I rate it one of the best ever. I've just returned to Ireland from Arizona on American Airlines from a biz trip and by chance they showed several episodes. I laughed my head off and later I asked the stewards to play again and they did. Thank you AA. The acting from all the team is first rate and especially from Kevin James, Leah Remini and Gerry Stiller, but from all of the cast in fact the acting is superb. I love all the cast, they are so funny.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain (of course, because it's so sensational) that it missed most of the movie, which is about a developing, although rather simply drawn, relationship between Lazarus and Rae as they attempt to recover from their past pains with each other.Of course, with the premise of a nymphomaniac in chains, it's no surprise that there's plenty of implied sex involved. However, at it's core, Black Snake Moan is a basic tale of redemption and the healing power of helping another person along.

I saw the Messiah : - The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes ever put on screen. I watched it for the last two seasons, and just about every season in between (in fact most of its run) I can only imagine the lengths some people went to to to see it. There are three main characters in this story, each one trying to bring their lives back together after a traumatic death. This is an amazing film that should be studied by everyone who watches horror, or any type of dramatic event.

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student body of a South African University.The director of this film has no idea what he is doing . I was really hoping this movie would be something special, but sadly I was disappointed with it. The plot wasn't much, but the acting was... OK! But not great either. The rest of the movie could have easily made it onto my list of 'must watch's' (although it was too long).

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an absolute gem. All the scenes are amazing in every possible way. One of the worst was the first time I saw it, when there was no one else in the room. The scene where they were all trying to take out the baby and her mother? You could hardly see any of them.
